original: su yang skye med 'chi ba med //
analyzed: su yang skye med 'chi ba med //
translated: No one is born and no one dies.

original: las rnams byas kyang 'jig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: las rnams byas kyang 'jig mi 'gyur //
translated: Although actions are done, they do not disintegrate.

original: gnag dkar 'bras smin 'khor ba na'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: gnag dkar 'bras smin 'khor ba na'o // zhes pa ste /
translated: The ripening of black and white karma is in cyclic existence.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las 'gyur ba dpyad pa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las 'gyur ba dpyad pa brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighth chapter in the analysis of change in the third section of the Bodhisattvayogacarabhumi called ‚ÄúThe Chapter of Application‚Äù explained by the noble Manjushri.üîΩ‚Äú

original: // / blo gros chen po chos thams cad kyi sgra ji bzhin du mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni tshad med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / blo gros chen po chos thams cad kyi sgra ji bzhin du mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni tshad med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Mahamati, the attachment to the literal meaning of all dharmas is limitless‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni mtshan nyid mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni mtshan nyid mtshan ma ste /
translated: The attachment to characteristics is the connection to characteristics.

original: tha snyad pa rnams kyi chos dang chos can gyi dngos por rtog go //
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams kyi chos dang chos can gyi dngos por rtog go //
translated: Conventionally, it is imagined as the entity of dharmas and possessors of dharmas.

original: rkyen la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: rkyen la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba zhes pa la /
translated: The attachment to conditions is the connection to conditions.

original: rkyen ni chud pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ni chud pa ste /
translated: Conditions are the basis.

original: ji lta bur yid ches pa de lta bur yod do zhes te /
analyzed: ji lta bur yid ches pa de lta bur yod do zhes te /
translated: Whatever is believed, that is how it exists.

original: kha cig gis mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis mthong ba ni mi 'thad pa ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Some say: It is not incorrect to see it that way.

original: yang na byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byed pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is the agent.

original: 'dis 'di yod do zhes byed pa dang / byed pa po la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'di yod do zhes byed pa dang / byed pa po la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to the agent and to what belongs to the agent.

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med par mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yod la /
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med par mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yod la /
translated: The link of attachment to existence and nonexistence is the conceptual thought that the existence of the object and subject exists at the time when one is not asleep,

original: rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: but does not exist at the time of a dream.

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni 'khor ba'i dngos po las ni skye la /
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni 'khor ba'i dngos po las ni skye la /
translated: The link of attachment to the conceptual thought of origination and nonorigination is the conceptual thought of the tƒ´rthikas who think, ‚ÄúOrigination occurs from the entity of sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa mi skye'o zhes mu stegs can rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa mi skye'o zhes mu stegs can rnam par rtog go //
translated: but not from BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on.‚Äù

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis yang kun rdzob kyi bden pas 'jig rten skye la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyis yang kun rdzob kyi bden pas 'jig rten skye la /
translated: The Sugatas also say, ‚ÄúOrigination occurs in the world through conventional truth,

original: don dam pa'i bden pas mi skye zhes mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas mi skye zhes mod kyi /
translated: but not through ultimate truth.‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba la sogs pa bzhin lung nod pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba la sogs pa bzhin lung nod pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to impute to dependent origination such things as arising, etc., just as it is not proper to impute to a magical creation such things as being taught, etc.

original: des na mi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na mi 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement by the Omniscient One, ‚ÄúThat which does not arise is dependent origination,‚Äù is this.

original: 'gog pa med pa la mngon par chags pa so @184b sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa med pa la mngon par chags pa so @184b sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni /
translated: The connection of the discriminations of the non-existence of cessation, etc., is as follows.

original: 'gog pa la sogs pa yang skad cig ma gtogs par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la sogs pa yang skad cig ma gtogs par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Cessation, etc., do not exist apart from the momentariness of things.

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since the permanent is not produced, it is like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: med pa ste log ba la mngon par chags nas mu stegs can rnams kyis rtag par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ste log ba la mngon par chags nas mu stegs can rnams kyis rtag par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas imagine the permanent by being attached to the non-existence, i.e., the non-reality, of cessation, etc.

original: theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la mngon par chags pas so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni mu stegs byed rnams kyi brtul zhugs dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa thar pa'i phyir 'di ni theg pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la mngon par chags pas so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni mu stegs byed rnams kyi brtul zhugs dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa thar pa'i phyir 'di ni theg pa'o //
translated: The connection of discriminating attachment to vehicle and non-vehicle is the asceticism of the tƒ´rthikas, and the various contemplations, etc.

original: 'di ni theg pa ma yin no zhes rnam pa mang por rtog go //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa ma yin no zhes rnam pa mang por rtog go //
translated: They think, ‚ÄúThis is a vehicle for liberation, but that is not a vehicle.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas par so sor rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi dbang skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bur 'gro ba 'di ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas par so sor rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi dbang skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bur 'gro ba 'di ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The connection of discriminating attachment to the compounded and the uncompounded is the compounded, which is the nature of the stream of momentary dependent origination, like a dream, a magical illusion, etc.

original: la las ni grub pa yang dag par rig pa med cing skad cig pa ma yin par 'dus ma byas par yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: la las ni grub pa yang dag par rig pa med cing skad cig pa ma yin par 'dus ma byas par yongs su rtog go //
translated: Some imagine the uncompounded to be established, without perfect cognition, and not momentary.

original: la las ni dngos po med pa'i gzugs 'dus ma byas pa byas pa'o zhes don dam pa'i bden par rtog ste /
analyzed: la las ni dngos po med pa'i gzugs 'dus ma byas pa byas pa'o zhes don dam pa'i bden par rtog ste /
translated: Some imagine ultimate reality to be the uncompounded form of non-entity, which is produced.

original: de 'di ni rtag pa'ang yin la dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'di ni rtag pa'ang yin la dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is permanent and also not a non-thing.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As it says in the S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni ston pas brtags pa'o zhes pa ste 'dus byas pa'am 'dus ma byas par tha snyad do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni ston pas brtags pa'o zhes pa ste 'dus byas pa'am 'dus ma byas par tha snyad do //
translated: Son of noble family, the words ‚Äòconditioned‚Äô and ‚Äòunconditioned‚Äô are imputations made by the Teacher.

original: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang de ma byas pas na des na 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang de ma byas pas na des na 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: It is unconditioned because no one, such as the faculties, has created it.

original: chos kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba /
translated: The suchness that is the true nature of phenomena is naturally luminous.

original: yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid yongs kyis gnas pa de ni skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'dus byas pa brjod du med pa'i mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid du mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid yongs kyis gnas pa de ni skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'dus byas pa brjod du med pa'i mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid du mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: The true nature of the phenomena of perfect awareness is completely stable. It is connected to the unconditioned, which is the inexpressible, nondual wisdom that is the ultimate truth, the true nature that is free from duality.

original: sa dang sa'i mtshan nyid rang gi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi don du snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: sa dang sa'i mtshan nyid rang gi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi don du snang ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The characteristics of the stages and the characteristics of the stage are the connection of the attachment to one‚Äôs concepts. Since the characteristics of the yogins and yoginƒ´s are different, they appear for the benefit of self and other.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrang gi rnam par rtog pa mngon @185a * //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro // rang gi rnam par rtog pa mngon @185a * //
translated: The connection of the stages and the characteristics of the stages with one's own conceptual thoughts is the appearance of the differences of the yogis' own characteristics as different, and the appearance of the differences of the samadhis with and without appearance.

original: par rtogs pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni sems can rnams kyi rtog pa sna tshogs ji bzhin ba de bzhin du sgra'i don rnams kyi don du mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: par rtogs pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni sems can rnams kyi rtog pa sna tshogs ji bzhin ba de bzhin du sgra'i don rnams kyi don du mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: The connection of one's own conceptual thoughts with realization is the connection of the various conceptual thoughts of sentient beings with the meaning of the words as they are.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni cung zad cig 'ga' zhig la yod pa dang / de cung zad cig med pa zhes te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni cung zad cig 'ga' zhig la yod pa dang / de cung zad cig med pa zhes te /
translated: The connection of existence and non-existence is saying that something exists for some, and that something does not exist for some.

original: ji ltar smra ba po rnams la gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par 'byed par yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar smra ba po rnams la gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par 'byed par yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: Just as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.

original: ji ltar gnyis su smra ba po rnams la rmi lam gyi dus na ni gzugs med /üîΩgnyid ma log pa'i dus na ni yod do zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis su smra ba po rnams la rmi lam gyi dus na ni gzugs med / gnyid ma log pa'i dus na ni yod do zhes so //
translated: Just as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.

original: mi gnyis par smra ba po rnams la chud pa ni yod do //üîΩchud par bya ba ni med do zhes 'di ni yod /üîΩ'di ni med do zhes smra ba bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa mang pos byis pa rnams la yang yod pa dang med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba po rnams la chud pa ni yod do // chud par bya ba ni med do zhes 'di ni yod / 'di ni med do zhes smra ba bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa mang pos byis pa rnams la yang yod pa dang med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'i tha snyad do //
translated: Just as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.

original: gnyis su smra ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa'i yul yod do zhes mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su smra ba'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyang phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa'i yul yod do zhes mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Just as for the dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence, so too for the non-dualists, there is the distinction of existence and non-existence.üîΩJust as for the dual

original: de'i chud pa kun du 'khrugs nas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs tha dad pa rnams so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i chud pa kun du 'khrugs nas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa sna tshogs tha dad pa rnams so sor snang ngo //
translated: Just as when the water is disturbed, the various forms and so on appear separately, so also when the mind is disturbed, the various forms and so on appear separately.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When, by means of wisdom,

original: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig cing mi dmigs pa de ni mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam par stong par chud cing yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa /
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig cing mi dmigs pa de ni mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam par stong par chud cing yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa /
translated: the gross and subtle are destroyed and not perceived, then the non-dualists understand the emptiness of duality, free from the concepts of existence and non-existence, without thought, without appearance,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa gnas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa gnas so //
translated: the ultimate truth, the perfect knowledge, the abode.

original: kha cig gis ni skyes pas na rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa rang bzhin du med do zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni skyes pas na rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa rang bzhin du med do zhes smra ba ste /
translated: Some say that because it arises, like a dream, an illusion, and so on, it does not exist essentially.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam la ni rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa lta bu ni gcig par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam la ni rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa lta bu ni gcig par mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not reasonable that the various aspects are one, like the consciousness of a dream and so on.

original: mi gnyis pa la ni gnod pa med pas na rang bzhin gcig cing yang dag par rig pa grub pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes bshad par bya ba mang po la ni lan du mar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa la ni gnod pa med pas na rang bzhin gcig cing yang dag par rig pa grub pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes bshad par bya ba mang po la ni lan du mar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The second person is not harmed, so it is said that the one nature is the ultimate truth, which is the establishment of perfect cognition. This has been explained many times in the scriptures.

original: theg pa gsum dang / theg pa gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum dang / theg pa gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes nas 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: The connection between the three vehicles and the one vehicle is as follows: Having cognized impermanence, suffering, and the nature of ugliness, one becomes free from attachment.

original: bral nas kyang 'khor bar rgyun 'brel pa'i las mi byed do //
analyzed: bral nas kyang 'khor bar rgyun 'brel pa'i las mi byed do //
translated: Having become free, one does not create karma that perpetuates the continuity of cyclic existence.

original: des na zhi ba phyogs @185b gcig tu 'dod chags dang bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: des na zhi ba phyogs @185b gcig tu 'dod chags dang bral bar gnas te /
translated: Therefore, one abides in the one-sided freedom from attachment of peace.

original: de de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis su gdags so //
analyzed: de de ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis su gdags so //
translated: Thus, the two vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are designated.

original: snying rje'i bag chags kyis sad de /
analyzed: snying rje'i bag chags kyis sad de /
translated: Awakened by the latent tendencies of compassion,

original: bag chags dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i mnyam par mi 'jog pa la sogs pa nyes pa spangs te phan pa thams cad spyod pa thams cad mkhyen cing sangs rgyas nyid ni theg pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i mnyam par mi 'jog pa la sogs pa nyes pa spangs te phan pa thams cad spyod pa thams cad mkhyen cing sangs rgyas nyid ni theg pa gsum mo //
translated: The Buddha, who is omniscient and has abandoned all faults such as not entering into equipoise due to the ignorance that is not afflicted but has residual impressions, and so on, is the three vehicles.

original: de de ltar mtshams sbyor pa tha dad pa ni mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar mtshams sbyor pa tha dad pa ni mtha' med pa ste /
translated: Thus, the different types of connections are infinite.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa'i sgra'i don tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa'i sgra'i don tha snyad du'o //
translated: The meaning of the term is the intention of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis bstan pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis bstan pa /
translated: In the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´'s Teaching,

original: chos thams cad mi 'jug par bshad pa las klog pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'chi ba'i dus na sems can dmyal bar skye ba mthong ngo zhes pa dang / bzod pa thob na ngan song 'gro ba med //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'jug par bshad pa las klog pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'chi ba'i dus na sems can dmyal bar skye ba mthong ngo zhes pa dang / bzod pa thob na ngan song 'gro ba med //
translated: in the explanation of the non-engagement of all phenomena, it is said that one who reads without interest in the Buddha's teachings sees at the time of death that one will be born in hell, and that one who has attained acceptance has no rebirth in the lower realms.

original: ce na / de ji lta bur 'gyur /
analyzed: ce na / de ji lta bur 'gyur /
translated: If one asks, How is that?

original: der ni mtshams sbyor ba dgongs pa'i don brtags te /
analyzed: der ni mtshams sbyor ba dgongs pa'i don brtags te /
translated: There, the meaning of the intention of the connection is examined.

original: phyi rol ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa la mos pa med pa rnams la de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa la mos pa med pa rnams la de skad du gsungs so //
translated: This is stated for those who are free from the attachment of the desire realm, but who are not free from the attachment of the higher realms, who are not free from the attachment of the desire realm, but who are not interested in the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and who are outsiders.

original: gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni 'jam dpal sangs rgyas su gzud par nus so //
analyzed: gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni 'jam dpal sangs rgyas su gzud par nus so //
translated: Those who have the seed of compassion can be led to buddhahood, O Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.

original: chos bcu pa las /
analyzed: chos bcu pa las /
translated: The Da≈õadharmaka S≈´tra says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phan pa'i rigs kyi bu lhas byin rnam par thar pa thob pas sprul pa ston pa dang / gang de bzhin gshegs pa la gnod pa de'i 'gro ba de lta bu'o zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phan pa'i rigs kyi bu lhas byin rnam par thar pa thob pas sprul pa ston pa dang / gang de bzhin gshegs pa la gnod pa de'i 'gro ba de lta bu'o zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúDevadatta, a son of a good family who is a friend of the TathƒÅgata, having attained liberation, displays emanations, and those who harm the TathƒÅgata have such a destiny.‚Äù

original: zhi ba phyogs gcig gis 'dod chags dang bral ba gnas so zhes pa des na mdo sde rnams su mtshams sbyor ba tha dad pa mtha' med de /
analyzed: zhi ba phyogs gcig gis 'dod chags dang bral ba gnas so zhes pa des na mdo sde rnams su mtshams sbyor ba tha dad pa mtha' med de /
translated: Those who are free from attachment through the one-sided peace of the ≈õrƒÅvakas abide there. Thus, there are limitless different connections in the s≈´tras.

original: ji ltar gtsug tor gyi sngags kyis yungs kar la sogs pa la sngags btab ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gtsug tor gyi sngags kyis yungs kar la sogs pa la sngags btab ste /
translated: Just as the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a mantra is recited over mustard seeds and so on,

original: shi ba'i lus la gtor na mtho ris su skye'o zhes der de'i smon lam gyi bsod nams su btab pa ste /
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la gtor na mtho ris su skye'o zhes der de'i smon lam gyi bsod nams su btab pa ste /
translated: If the body of a dead person is sprinkled with it, he will be reborn in the higher realms.

original: sngags brjod pas lha'i yon tan rjes su dran pa'i bsod nams te /
analyzed: sngags brjod pas lha'i yon tan rjes su dran pa'i bsod nams te /
translated: By reciting the mantra, one recollects the good qualities of the gods, and by that merit,

original: yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur bas thams cad du sdig pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur bas thams cad du sdig pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: all sins are exhausted, because the good qualities will arise.

original: de de ltar dam pa'i chos kyi mtshams sbyor ba mtha' med do //
analyzed: de de ltar dam pa'i chos kyi mtshams sbyor ba mtha' med do //
translated: Thus, the connection with the holy Dharma is endless.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mtshams sbyor ba de dag la mtshams sbyor nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing zhen pas so sor @186a * //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mtshams sbyor ba de dag la mtshams sbyor nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing zhen pas so sor @186a * //
translated: Foolish ordinary beings, having been connected to those connections, are attached to the characteristics of the connection between existence and non-existence, and

original: snang ba rtog cing /
analyzed: snang ba rtog cing /
translated: conceive of the individual appearances.

original: dar gyi srin bu bzhin du rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba mtshams sbyor ba 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba mtshams sbyor ba'i skud pas bdag dang gzhan la yongs su 'khri'o zhes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu bzhin du rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba mtshams sbyor ba 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba mtshams sbyor ba'i skud pas bdag dang gzhan la yongs su 'khri'o zhes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang
translated: Like silkworms, they wrap themselves in the thread of their own views, which they spin out of their own thoughts, and they wrap themselves around others as well.

original: / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gcig pa dang / du ma dang / phyi rol gyi bar rnam pa sna tshogs su mngon par zhen pa'i rang gi las kyi skud pas dar gyi srin bu bzhin du dkris pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dngos po dang /
analyzed: / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gcig pa dang / du ma dang / phyi rol gyi bar rnam pa sna tshogs su mngon par zhen pa'i rang gi las kyi skud pas dar gyi srin bu bzhin du dkris pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams dngos po dang /
translated: They are like silkworms, wrapped up in the thread of their own karma, which is the various ways they cling to the idea of a permanent, single, and multiple self, and to the idea of an external world.

original: dngos po med pas mngon par chags pas zhen cing /
analyzed: dngos po med pas mngon par chags pas zhen cing /
translated: They are attached to things and nonthings.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pas sdug bsngal myong ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pas sdug bsngal myong ba yin no //
translated: They are attached to the idea of a self, permanence, pleasure, and purity, and so they experience suffering.

original: gang gi tshe na yang shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yang shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: But when they examine things with wisdom,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong par shes pa de'i tshe dben pa mthong bas sdug bsngal ldog go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas ston par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong par shes pa de'i tshe dben pa mthong bas sdug bsngal ldog go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas ston par mdzad pas na /
translated: When one understands that all phenomena are impermanent, suffering, and empty, one sees their voidness and turns away from suffering.üîΩThus, Mahamati, since all phenomena are seen to be void, there is no connection with them or any characteristic of such a connection.

original: blo gros chen po chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong bas 'di la mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la dben par lta zhing gnas so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong bas 'di la mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la dben par lta zhing gnas so zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, Mahamati, in order to prevent conceptualization, bodhisattvas view and abide in the voidness of all phenomena.

original: rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i chud pa'i chos thams cad la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam par dben par mthong ba'i phyir rin po che dang / gser la sogs pa dben pa bzhin du blo bur gyi nyes pa yongs su zad nas dngos po dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i chud pa'i chos thams cad la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam par dben par mthong ba'i phyir rin po che dang / gser la sogs pa dben pa bzhin du blo bur gyi nyes pa yongs su zad nas dngos po dang /
translated: Because they see that all phenomena, which are by nature clear light, are void of the concepts of perceiver and perceived, they are like jewels, gold, and so forth.

original: dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa kho na ste /
translated: Because it is free from all the stains of conceptual thoughts of non-entities, it is only stainless.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas, without thoughts and without appearances, will see the non-dual, ultimate truth, which is the perfect knowledge.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med par rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med par rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing /
translated: Moreover, MahƒÅmati, having understood that external things are non-existent, the characteristics of the appearances of one's own mind,

original: snang ba med pa rang gi sems tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po thams cad la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba rab tu dben par mthong bas chos thams cad la mtshams sbyor ba yang med /
analyzed: snang ba med pa rang gi sems tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po thams cad la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba rab tu dben par mthong bas chos thams cad la mtshams sbyor ba yang med /
translated: following only one's own mind, which is without appearances, and seeing the complete seclusion from the connection with all conceptual thoughts of existent and non-existent things, one does not connect with any phenomena,

original: @186b mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: @186b mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
translated: and there is also no characteristic of connection.

original: blo gros chen po 'di la yang 'ching ba yang med 'grol ba yang med de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di la yang 'ching ba yang med 'grol ba yang med de /
translated: MahƒÅmati, here there is also no bondage and no liberation.

original: gzhan du na log par ltung ba'i blos bcings pa dang / thar par shes so zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na log par ltung ba'i blos bcings pa dang / thar par shes so zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med ces bya ba'am /
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to say that the mind is bound by wrong views and liberated by right views.

original: lan mang por bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: lan mang por bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is stated many times in the scriptures,

original: mdo sde gzhan dag las ni phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag las ni phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: and in other sutras it is said that the aggregates are not permanent and not destroyed.üîΩThe commentary on all the holy Dharma

original: dam pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'grel bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'grel bar bshad pa ni /
translated: says:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is the analysis of atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //üîΩzhes so // ji ltar khyad par can la sogs pas yan lag can gyi rdzas kun brtags pa btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs par tha dad par dbye ba ni gcig par mi rung ba ni khang pa dang /
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste // zhes so // ji ltar khyad par can la sogs pas yan lag can gyi rdzas kun brtags pa btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs par tha dad par dbye ba ni gcig par mi rung ba ni khang pa dang /
translated: Atoms have no parts.

original: sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and others imagine that wholes are real substances, they are differentiated as cooked and uncooked, moving and unmoving, covered and uncovered, and so on, and it is not possible for them to be one, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa rdul phra mo rnams las cha med par kun brtags pa dang / bla 'og tu chags par mi rung ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa rdul phra mo rnams las cha med par kun brtags pa dang / bla 'og tu chags par mi rung ste /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle is imagined to be partless, like atoms, and is not suitable to be connected to the higher vehicles.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the mind and mental factors.

original: gang gi tshe na yang de ltar rang gi sems tsam khong du ma chud pa'i phyir 'khor ba ni mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam par so sor snang ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yang de ltar rang gi sems tsam khong du ma chud pa'i phyir 'khor ba ni mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam par so sor snang ba ste /
translated: When one has not understood that the world is only one‚Äôs own mind, the world appears in various different ways, like a spinning firebrand, fainting, and so on.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams mi sbyor ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams mi sbyor ba gang yang med de /
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom and does not observe anything, then there is neither connection nor disconnection.

original: snang ba med pa'i ye shes la 'ching ba yang med 'grol ba yang med do //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ye shes la 'ching ba yang med 'grol ba yang med do //
translated: In nonappearing wisdom, there is neither bondage nor liberation.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'ching ba dang 'grol ba so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'ching ba dang 'grol ba so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: From the concepts of existence and nonexistence, the concepts of bondage and liberation appear separately to the cognition that has the aspect of duality.

original: bsam pa med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa rang gi rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun la ni rnam par rtog pa med na shes par bya ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par 'gyur ba lta ga la zhig
analyzed: bsam pa med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa rang gi rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun la ni rnam par rtog pa med na shes par bya ba'i rnam pa 'dzin par 'gyur ba lta ga la zhig
translated: If there is no thought in the continuum of the ultimate truth, which is inexpressible and has the characteristic of being known by oneself, how could there be the apprehension of aspects of objects of knowledge?

original: / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na /
analyzed: / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na /
translated: When abiding in the samadhi of the pure worldly appearances,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos stong pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos stong pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: the Dharma of omniscience, which is emptiness, also arises.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩchos thams cad la yod pa dang / med pa las mtshams sbyor ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gnyis ka yang yod par dus @187a * //üîΩmtshungs pa'i phyir yul dang yul can gyi dngos po med pa dang / phan pa dang phan par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / chos thams cad la yod pa dang / med pa las mtshams sbyor ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gnyis ka yang yod par dus @187a * // mtshungs pa'i phyir yul dang yul can gyi dngos po med pa dang / phan pa dang phan par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩBecause the connection between existence and nonexistence in all phenomena is not observed.

original: des na yod pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: des na yod pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Since both exist at the same time, there is no object and subject, and there is no benefit or beneficiary. Therefore, existence is not observed.

original: med pa yang ci la mi dmigs te yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang ci la mi dmigs te yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How could it not be observed? Because there is no object.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu shes pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu shes pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: After the former, there is only consciousness.

original: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa la dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa la dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is observed in the form of various different aspects, like the dizziness and fainting, etc.

original: der phyi rol gyi don yod pa la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: der phyi rol gyi don yod pa la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du rjes su dpag go //
translated: It is not the observation of an external object that exists there. This is the meaning of the Omniscient One's intention, and it is inferred.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i skad cig pa mi dmigs pas na rtag pa yang yul dang / yul can gyi dngos por mi rung ba ni bde blag ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i skad cig pa mi dmigs pas na rtag pa yang yul dang / yul can gyi dngos por mi rung ba ni bde blag ste /
translated: It is easy to understand that a permanent thing cannot be a subject or object, because it is not observed as either existent or nonexistent in successive moments.

original: rang bzhin la khyad par du bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la khyad par du bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no modification of the nature.

original: skye ba'i yul 'byung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i lta ba po bdag gi khyad par yul 'dzin pa ste 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: skye ba'i yul 'byung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i lta ba po bdag gi khyad par yul 'dzin pa ste 'byung ba med do //
translated: The arising of the object and the grasping of the view of the self are not the arising of the object.

original: des na skad cig pa yod pa dang / skad cig pa med pa ma yin pa las kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: des na skad cig pa yod pa dang / skad cig pa med pa ma yin pa las kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not observed as either existent or nonexistent in successive moments.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, there are three kinds of connections for the ordinary, ignorant people.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yin te /
translated: They are desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang srid pa can gyi sred pa dang zhes pa ni 'dod chags de nyid kyi nang du gtogs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa yang srid pa can gyi sred pa dang zhes pa ni 'dod chags de nyid kyi nang du gtogs par gsungs pa /
translated: Desire is said to be included in that very desire, as in the statement, ‚ÄúEndowed with the desire of delight, with the craving for existence.‚Äù

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with the desire of delight‚Äù means

original: sred pa dang / 'dod chags gnyis ka yang chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang / 'dod chags gnyis ka yang chags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: both craving and desire have the characteristic of attachment.

original: gti mug thog mar byas nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'byung ste /
analyzed: gti mug thog mar byas nas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'byung ste /
translated: Anger and desire arise after ignorance has come first,

original: rmongs pa med na gzhan du mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa med na gzhan du mi skye'o zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because without delusion, they do not arise elsewhere.

original: rtag pa dang bdag tu chags shing bslad pa ni gti mug go //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag tu chags shing bslad pa ni gti mug go //
translated: Attachment to permanence and self is delusion.

original: de dag las 'gro ba rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las 'gro ba rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba 'byung ngo //
translated: From them, the connections of beings arise.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mtshams sbyong ba las 'gro ba lngar mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas mtshams sbyong ba las 'gro ba lngar mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is reborn in the five destinies due to the connection of the afflictions such as desire.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba chad nas ni srid pa'i mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba chad nas ni srid pa'i mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the connection of the afflictions is severed, there is no connection to existence.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po gsum 'dus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang gsum 'dus pa las srid pa'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po gsum 'dus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang gsum 'dus pa las srid pa'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the connection of the three‚Äîignorance, craving, and grasping‚Äîleads to the connection to existence.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa bzlog pa ni srid pa yang @187b ldog go //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa bzlog pa ni srid pa yang @187b ldog go //
translated: When ignorance and so forth are reversed, existence is also reversed.

original: btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pa'i lugs ni rnam par thar pa gsum mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pa'i lugs ni rnam par thar pa gsum mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The noble Maitreya's system, O Venerable One, is due to seeing the three gates of liberation.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa dang ldan pa nas mtshams sbyor ba thams cad ldog go zhes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa dang ldan pa nas mtshams sbyor ba thams cad ldog go zhes so //
translated: Possessing the liberations of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, all connections are reversed.

original: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / bde bar khong du chud pa'i don du bsdu ba'i tshigs bcad kyi don gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / bde bar khong du chud pa'i don du bsdu ba'i tshigs bcad kyi don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the verses of summary is stated for the purpose of holding, retaining, and easily understanding the meaning.

original: yang dag ma yin yongs rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin yongs rtog ni //
translated: The false imagination

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: The non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of all dharmas is the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of all dharmas.üîΩHow is it that the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of all dharmas is the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of all dharmas?

analyzed: zhes pa'o // thams cad mkhyen pas kyang 'dir ston par mdzad pa /üîΩphyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
translated: The non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of all dharmas is the non-apprehension of the non-apprehension of

original: shes pa tsam la 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa tsam la 'jug pa ni //

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
translated: is the practice of the middle way

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //

original: zhes so // btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas bshad pa ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i lugs so //
analyzed: zhes so // btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas bshad pa ni 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i lugs so //
translated: The explanation of the noble Maitreya, the foremost of the venerable ones, is the system of the noble Lankavatara and the Samdhinirmocana.

original: dngos por shes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas //
analyzed: dngos por shes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas //
translated: By grasping the sound of the knowledge of entities,

original: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu bzhin //
translated: just like a silkworm in a cocoon,

original: byis @188a * //üîΩpa mtshams sbyor mi mkhas pa //
analyzed: byis @188a * // pa mtshams sbyor mi mkhas pa //
translated: the childish

original: rang gi rnam par rtog bas 'ching //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog bas 'ching //

original: zhes pa ni rang gi sems mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis byis pa rnams srid par 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi sems mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis byis pa rnams srid par 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ignorance of not settling the mind in meditative equipoise binds the childish to existence by means of the conceptual thoughts of the error of entities as permanent, a self, blissful, and pure.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa yongs su shes pas grol lo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa yongs su shes pas grol lo //
translated: By thoroughly knowing impermanence, suffering, impurity, and emptiness, one is liberated.

original: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: MahƒÅmati said:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis dngos po gang dang gang rnam par brtags pa de dag ni kun brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis dngos po gang dang gang rnam par brtags pa de dag ni kun brtags pa nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄòWhatever things are imagined by whatever conceptualization, they are just imagined.

original: de dag la yang rang bzhin med do zhes bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag la yang rang bzhin med do zhes bka' stsal pa /
translated: They also have no intrinsic nature.‚Äô

original: bcom ldan 'das de gal te kun brtags pa nyid lags te dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi rig na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de gal te kun brtags pa nyid lags te dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi rig na /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, if they are just imagined, the characteristics of the intrinsic nature of things are not known.

original: bcom ldan 'das de skad du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de skad du bka' stsal pa /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, if you say that,üîΩthen since all phenomena would be imagined, things that are afflicted and purified would not exist.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po yang ma mchis par yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sgra dang don du sgro btags pa'i rnam par don dam pa'i rtog pa ste zhes blo gros chen pos gsol par thugs dogs nas lan du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po yang ma mchis par yang 'gyur ro zhes pa ni sgra dang don du sgro btags pa'i rnam par don dam pa'i rtog pa ste zhes blo gros chen pos gsol par thugs dogs nas lan du gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is the ultimate conceptualization of superimposing words and meanings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: blo gros chen po de de bzhin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de de bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, it is so,

original: ji ltar smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar smras pa bzhin no //
translated: just as you have said.

original: blo gros chen po ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa de lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gros chen po ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa de lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is not as things are imagined by foolish ordinary beings.

original: de ni kun tu brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni kun tu brtags pa nyid de /
translated: That is just imagination.

original: blo gros chen po dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi rig go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi rig go zhes pa ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, they do not know the characteristic of the nature of things.

original: byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar rnam par rtog pa de ltar don dam pa de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar rnam par rtog pa de ltar don dam pa de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: The ultimate suchness is not as it is imagined by the foolish.

original: blo gros chen po 'on kyang 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar rtog pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'on kyang 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar rtog pa zhes pa ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, however, the noble ones conceive of the nature of things.

original: ji ltar na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa yin te /
translated: How is it that they are absorbed in what is naturally luminous?

original: don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba yang dag pa rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba yang dag pa rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate is free from all conceptualization, the nature of correct knowledge.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin de de bzhin du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis mngon sum du myong ngo //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin de de bzhin du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis mngon sum du myong ngo //
translated: The ultimate truth, which is the nature of the correct understanding of non-duality, is experienced in the same way by the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs @188b pa ni brjod du med pa skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung ba ni byis pa rnams rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por ji ltar phyin ci log pa de bsal ba'i phyir des na ston to //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs @188b pa ni brjod du med pa skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung ba ni byis pa rnams rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por ji ltar phyin ci log pa de bsal ba'i phyir des na ston to //
translated: The omniscience that abides in the pure worldly samƒÅdhi is inexpressible and arises in a continuous stream of moments. This is taught in order to dispel the misconceptions of childish beings regarding permanence, self, bliss, and purity.

original: 'phags pa rnams la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par ston pa ste /
translated: For the noble ones, it is taught as impermanent, suffering, unattractive, and empty.

original: des na byis pa'i shes pa las 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes la khyad par yod do //
analyzed: des na byis pa'i shes pa las 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes la khyad par yod do //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the noble ones is superior to the cognition of childish beings.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When analyzed with wisdom,

original: shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig cing mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa 'phags pa rnams kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i dngos por chud pa ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig cing mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa 'phags pa rnams kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i dngos por chud pa ste /
translated: When the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge are destroyed and not perceived, then the ultimate truth, which is non-conceptual, non-apparent, and non-dual, is realized by the noble ones as the naturally luminous entity.

original: de ltar na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is non-conceptual regarding entities and non-entities.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med par mnyam pa kho na ni rang bzhin du klog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med par mnyam pa kho na ni rang bzhin du klog pa'o //
translated: The equality of entities and non-entities is indeed the nature.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las mtshams sbyor pa'i le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las mtshams sbyor pa'i le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the ninth chapter of the glorious wisdom-possessor's commentary on the noble Journey to Lanka, called The Connection.

original: // / blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: // / blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: MahƒÅmati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de gal te 'phags pa rnams kyi 'phrul dang sha'i mig gis ma lags kyi ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de gal te 'phags pa rnams kyi 'phrul dang sha'i mig gis ma lags kyi ;
translated: Blessed One, if it is not by the noble ones' magical or fleshly eyes,

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher te /
translated: The meaning of the passage from the noble MahƒÅyƒÅnasa·πÉgraha is as follows:

original: de ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur zhes pa der ci dgos she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur zhes pa der ci dgos she na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the point of saying that the conceptualization of the foolish ordinary beings is stopped?‚Äù

original: 'phags pa blo gos  chen pos gsungs pa'i don ji bzhin pa las brtags na 'phags pa dang byis pa'i shes pa gnyis ka yang rang gi yul du zhugs pas na byis pa'i shes pa ji ltar na rnam par ldog par 'gyur zhes glengs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gos  chen pos gsungs pa'i don ji bzhin pa las brtags na 'phags pa dang byis pa'i shes pa gnyis ka yang rang gi yul du zhugs pas na byis pa'i shes pa ji ltar na rnam par ldog par 'gyur zhes glengs pa'o //
translated: When one examines the meaning just as it is taught by the noble Asanga, both the cognition of the noble and the cognition of the foolish enter their own objects. Therefore, how is it that the cognition of the foolish is stopped?

original: 'phags pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba'i khong du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba'i khong du ma chud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they do not understand the nature of the noble‚Äù means that they do not understand what is to be known by the cognition of the noble.

original: 'phrul gyi mig gis ni lha dang de las gzhan pas ni sha'i mig gis te /
analyzed: 'phrul gyi mig gis ni lha dang de las gzhan pas ni sha'i mig gis te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe divine eye‚Äù is the divine eye, and ‚Äúthe other‚Äù is the fleshly eye.

original: de dag gis ni khong du mi chud pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ni khong du mi chud pa'o //
translated: They do not understand this.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag ni phyin ci log kyang ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag ni phyin ci log kyang ma lags /
translated: Blessed One, they are not mistaken,

original: phyin ci ma log pa yang ma lags so zhes pa ni @189a * //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yang ma lags so zhes pa ni @189a * //
translated: nor are they unmistaken.

original: rang gi yul la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they understand their own objects.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin khong du chud pa'i slad du'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin khong du chud pa'i slad du'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Because they understand the essence of the nature of the noble ones.

original: rang gi rtog pa ni de dag gi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa ni de dag gi tshad ma'o //
translated: One's own understanding is their valid cognition.

original: gzhan gyi rtog pa ni tshad mar gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtog pa ni tshad mar gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The understanding of others is not valid cognition,

original: mngon par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have supernormal knowledge.üîΩBecause they see the reversal of the characteristics of existence and non-existence.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid las ldog par mthong ba'i slad du'o zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa dag gzhan btsal ba'i sgra dang don ni spyir rnam par rtog pa'i don du sgro btags te phan tshun du ni ldog pa nyid do
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid las ldog par mthong ba'i slad du'o zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa dag gzhan btsal ba'i sgra dang don ni spyir rnam par rtog pa'i don du sgro btags te phan tshun du ni ldog pa nyid do
translated: The words and meanings of searching for other things and non-things are generally superimposed as the meaning of conceptualization, but they are mutually reversed.

original: // ji ltar bar ti ka las 'byung ba /
analyzed: // ji ltar bar ti ka las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Vartika:

original: sgro btags cha ni ji snyed pa ;
analyzed: sgro btags cha ni ji snyed pa ;
translated: To the extent that there is a part of superimposition,

original: / de bsal phyir ni gdon mi za //
analyzed: / de bsal phyir ni gdon mi za //
translated: to that extent there is a need to eliminate it.

original: de snyed de ltar sgra rnams kyang //
analyzed: de snyed de ltar sgra rnams kyang //
translated: To that extent, there are also words.

original: de bas de dag tha dad yul //
analyzed: de bas de dag tha dad yul //
translated: Therefore, they are different objects.

original: thog ma med pa bag chags las //
analyzed: thog ma med pa bag chags las //
translated: Arising from beginningless latent tendencies,

original: rnam par rtog byung la gnas pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog byung la gnas pa //
translated: abiding in conceptualization,

original: sgra don rnam pa gsum gyi chos //
analyzed: sgra don rnam pa gsum gyi chos //
translated: the three aspects of word and meaning

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis ka'i gnas //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis ka'i gnas //
translated: are the basis of both entity and non-entity.

original: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po rnams ji ltar rnam par brtags pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la spyod yul ma lags pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po rnams ji ltar rnam par brtags pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la spyod yul ma lags pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, because the noble ones do not engage in the objects of their own characteristics as they are imagined, it is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid de yang rgyu ma bstan pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid snang ngo zhes pa la rnam par rtog pa pa sgra'i don spyi'i rnam pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid de yang rgyu ma bstan pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid snang ngo zhes pa la rnam par rtog pa pa sgra'i don spyi'i rnam pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yul ma yin no //
translated: The imagined nature is not perceived because the specific characteristic of the essential nature of those is not taught.

original: de yid ches pa'i rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de yid ches pa'i rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa ma bstan pa ste /
translated: That is not taught as the cause or non-cause of conviction.

original: sgra'i don gyis spyi'i rgyu bstan pa ma mchis la /
analyzed: sgra'i don gyis spyi'i rgyu bstan pa ma mchis la /
translated: The cause of the meaning of the word is not taught.

original: brjod du med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig gi rgyun la bstan pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis skad cig gi rgyun la bstan pa ma mchis so //
translated: The cause of the moment-series is not taught by the inexpressible specific characteristic.

original: de ltar 'phags pa rnams la yang rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa rnams la yang rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, even for the noble ones, conceptualization does not occur.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'phags pa rnams la sgra dang don la spyir rgyu sgro 'dogs pa dang / byis pa rnams la yang me la sogs pa rang gi myong ba la sgra dang don spyi'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la sgra dang don la spyir rgyu sgro 'dogs pa dang / byis pa rnams la yang me la sogs pa rang gi myong ba la sgra dang don spyi'i tha snyad do //
translated: For the noble ones, the superimposition of the cause of the word and meaning in general, and for the childish, the conventional expression of the word and meaning in their own experience of fire, etc.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid la lta bar ltung bas zhes pa ni byis pa rnams la sgra dang don spyir 'dug pa yang dngos por sgro btags te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid la lta bar ltung bas zhes pa ni byis pa rnams la sgra dang don spyir 'dug pa yang dngos por sgro btags te /
translated: The phrase because of falling into the view of the characteristics of entities means that childish beings superimpose entities on the mere generalities of terms and meanings.

original: lta bar ltung ba 'phags pa rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lta bar ltung ba 'phags pa rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: And also for the noble ones, it is the same.

original: byis pa rnams la yang rang gi yul la dngos por rnam par brtags te sgro 'dogs pas na su'i dngos po yin pa ma nges pas thug pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos @189b glengs pa la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang lanüîΩdu bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la yang rang gi yul la dngos por rnam par brtags te sgro 'dogs pas na su'i dngos po yin pa ma nges pas thug pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos @189b glengs pa la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang lan du bka' stsal pa /
translated: Since childish beings also superimpose their own objects by conceptually imputing entities, it would be endless because it is uncertain whose entities they are. The noble one MahƒÅmati raised this point, and the Omniscient One also replied:

original: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni ma byas mod kyi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni ma byas mod kyi zhes pa ste /
translated: The Buddha said, I have not taught the nature of entities.

original: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa po dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed pa po la sogs pa'i chos su sgro btags pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa po dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed pa po la sogs pa'i chos su sgro btags pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to superimposing phenomena such as the apprehender, the apprehended, the expression, the expresser, the action, the agent, the produced, and the producer, and so on.

original: 'on kyang dpen pa bstan pa nyid dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba yang dag pa rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dpen pa bstan pa nyid dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba yang dag pa rig pa'i ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'o //
translated: However, the teaching of emptiness is itself free from the conceptualization of entity and non-entity, and is the essence of the reality of right knowledge, which is naturally luminous.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa la skrag pa'i sems can rnams la bshad cing stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa la skrag pa'i sems can rnams la bshad cing stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ston par byed do //
translated: In the same way, for beings who are afraid of the non-dual ultimate truth, it is taught and the door of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is shown.

original: des ni mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid gzhol bar 'gyur ba ste bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: des ni mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid gzhol bar 'gyur ba ste bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: By that, one proceeds to the non-dual reality, which is the condensed meaning.

original: yan lag gi don ni mdor bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni mdor bshad par bya ste /
translated: The branch meaning should be explained in brief.

original: brtags pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid rang bzhin gzhan pa dag / gzhan pa dag gi spyod yul du 'gyur ro zhes de skad du blo gros chen pos glengs pa /
analyzed: brtags pa dang rang gi mtshan nyid rang bzhin gzhan pa dag / gzhan pa dag gi spyod yul du 'gyur ro zhes de skad du blo gros chen pos glengs pa /
translated: The imagined and the nature of the characteristics are different, and they become the sphere of others. Thus it was asked by MahƒÅmati.

original: bcom ldan 'das so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan la /
translated: The Blessed One said, MahƒÅmati, the characteristic of individual conceptualization is one thing,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
translated: The characteristic of the nature of things is different.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i don gyi mtshan nyid ni spyi'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i don gyi mtshan nyid ni spyi'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the object of conceptualization is a universal aspect.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu'i skad cig pa skye nus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu'i skad cig pa skye nus pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the nature of things is the ability to produce the momentary effect.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mi mthun pa zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa'i rgyu ni gsal ba'i don rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyi rgyu mi mthun pa zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi shes pa'i rgyu ni gsal ba'i don rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Blessed One said that the causes of conceptualization and the nature of things are incompatible. The cause of conceptualization is the aspect of superimposition. The cause of the knowledge of the nature of things is the non-conceptual object of clarity.

original: des na don dam pa'i rang bzhin rnams brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: des na don dam pa'i rang bzhin rnams brjod du med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the natures of ultimate reality are inexpressible.

original: ji ltar bar ti ka las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar bar ti ka las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Vartika:

original: sbyor ba dang ni tha dad med //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ni tha dad med //
translated: It is not different from the connection.üîΩThat ultimate reality

original: don dam de ni bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: don dam de ni bdag nyid kyis //
translated: Is by its own nature

original: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma zhes //
analyzed: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma zhes //
translated: Form is one or many,

original: de ni blo yi 'khrul ba'o //
analyzed: de ni blo yi 'khrul ba'o //
translated: That is the error of the mind.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Similarly, others say:

original: gzhan ni dbang po don nyid la //
analyzed: gzhan ni dbang po don nyid la //
translated: The other is the object of the sense faculties.

original: gzhan ni sgra yi spyod yul te //
analyzed: gzhan ni sgra yi spyod yul te //
translated: The other is the domain of sound.

original: mig med sgra las mthong gyur kyang //
analyzed: mig med sgra las mthong gyur kyang //
translated: Even though one sees without eyes, from sound,

original: mngon sum du ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: mngon sum du ni mthong ba med //
translated: one does not see in a direct perception.

original: gzhan du me dang 'brel pas ni //
analyzed: gzhan du me dang 'brel pas ni //
translated: In another case, through the connection with fire,

original: bdag tshig ces ni sems pa ste //
analyzed: bdag tshig ces ni sems pa ste //
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄúI am burned.‚Äù

original: gzhan par tshig pa'i sgra yis ni //
analyzed: gzhan par tshig pa'i sgra yis ni //
translated: In another case, through the sound of being burned,

original: tshig pa'i don ni shes par bya //üîΩzhes pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / @190a * //
analyzed: tshig pa'i don ni shes par bya // zhes pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / @190a * //
translated: one understands the meaning of being burned.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yul dang yul can gyi rang bzhin gyis de dag byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phan tshun du brtags pa ni ji ltar de bzhin du mi 'gyur zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yul dang yul can gyi rang bzhin gyis de dag byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phan tshun du brtags pa ni ji ltar de bzhin du mi 'gyur zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, the conceptual and nonconceptual, which have the nature of objects and subjects, are mutually imputed by childish ordinary beings.üîΩHow could they be as they are?

original: de dag phan tshun du rnam par ldog pa'i phyir ji ltar na de bzhin du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun du rnam par ldog pa'i phyir ji ltar na de bzhin du mi 'gyur /
translated: Since they mutually exclude each other, how could they be as they are?

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i slad du dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi yul la mngon par chags pa yod par dgod dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i slad du dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi yul la mngon par chags pa yod par dgod dam /
translated: In this way, in order to reverse the conceptions of sentient beings, [the Buddha] set forth the attachment to the nature of things and the attachment to the object that is the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones.üîΩOr, should the teaching of the Dharma of complete isolation by relying on the nature of the entities of the wisdom of the noble ones be eliminated?

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po bsten pas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa ma mchis par bgyi 'am zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa las dgongs pa 'di lta bur brtags te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po bsten pas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa ma mchis par bgyi 'am zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa las dgongs pa 'di lta bur brtags te /
translated: In this way, the noble MahƒÅmati imagined this intention and said,

original: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi rang bzhin 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par byed pa de ltar byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin ma lags te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi rang bzhin 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs par byed pa de ltar byis pa rnams kyis brtags pa'i rang bzhin ma lags te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the noble ones is not the nature imagined by the childish, but is realized by the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: de ltar na phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na phan tshun du mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is clearly taught that the natures are mutually incompatible.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin bstan pas rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na lta ba dgod dam bgyi 'am zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin bstan pas rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na lta ba dgod dam bgyi 'am zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is whether the view is to be set forth by teaching the nature, which is non-conceptual alone.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin bstan pas dben pa'i dngos po ma mchis par ston par mdzad dam zhes de skad du dogs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin bstan pas dben pa'i dngos po ma mchis par ston par mdzad dam zhes de skad du dogs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord, thinking that it might be suspected that he teaches the non-existence of the isolated thing by teaching the nature, says,

original: blo gros chen po dben pa'i chos bstan pa med par bya ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dben pa'i chos bstan pa med par bya ba yang ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the teaching of the isolated dharma is not for the purpose of making it non-existent,

original: yod par lta ba dgod pa yang ma yin gyi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yod par lta ba dgod pa yang ma yin gyi zhes pa ste /
translated: nor is it for the purpose of setting forth the view of existence.‚Äù
