original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba las dben pas na gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams par mi rtog pa'i chud pa'i dngos po bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba las dben pas na gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnams par mi rtog pa'i chud pa'i dngos po bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since it is isolated from the grasped and grasper, the meaning of non-duality, the ultimate truth, which is naturally luminous, should be taught as the thing that is immersed in non-conceptuality.

original: yod par lta ba dgod pa yang ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yod par lta ba dgod pa yang ma yin pa ni /
translated: Nor is it for the purpose of setting forth the view of existence.üîΩAs it is said,

original: ji ltar byis pa rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa rnam rtog pa //
translated: As it is imagined by the childish,

original: de ltar dngos po yod pa min //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po yod pa min //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: Things do not exist in that way.

original: rtag pa dang bdag dang / phyi rol gyi spom po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis 'phags pa rnams la ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag dang / phyi rol gyi spom po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis 'phags pa rnams la ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But the noble ones are not so, because of their concepts of permanence, self, and gross external things.

original: rang bzhin bstan pas dben pa'i chos bstan pas bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin bstan pas dben pa'i chos bstan pas bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma should be done by means of the teaching of the nature of things, which is free from those.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas log pa'i bag chags kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i byis pa rnams la ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bden pa'i chos bstan pa dngos po de dag gis skag pa bsal bar bya'i byis pa rnams la
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas log pa'i bag chags kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i byis pa rnams la ni 'phags pa rnams kyis bden pa'i chos bstan pa dngos po de dag gis skag pa bsal bar bya'i byis pa rnams la
translated: For the childish, who from beginningless time have been attached to things and non-things due to false imprints, the noble ones should teach the true Dharma by means of those things in order to remove their attachment.

original: yod pa dang / med pa'i lta ba @190b dgod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa'i lta ba @190b dgod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the view of existence and non-existence should not be taught to the childish.

original: dngos pa dang dngos po med pas dben pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos bstan pa ni gnyis su med pas brjod du med pa'i yang dag par rig pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa las dben par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos pa dang dngos po med pas dben pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos bstan pa ni gnyis su med pas brjod du med pa'i yang dag par rig pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa las dben par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Because of the emptiness of things and non-things, the teaching of the noble ones' own nature of things should be taught as free from duality, as the inexpressible perfect knowledge, which is free from the aspects of duality.

original: byis pa rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa las dngos por mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa las dngos por mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: The childish are attached to things as having the aspect of duality.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan bzhin du'o //
translated: Like a dream, a magical creation, a visual distortion, and a reflection.

original: gnyis su med pa la ni de dag dngos po med par mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la ni de dag dngos po med par mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: In the absence of duality, they are attached to the non-existence of things.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na ni gzugs med /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na ni gzugs med /
translated: In the dream state, there is no form.üîΩIn the state of being awake from sleep, there is form.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni gzugs yod do zhes kha cig lta ba de dag la 'phags pa'i chud pa dag pa rang bzhin du bstan pas skad cig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni gzugs yod do zhes kha cig lta ba de dag la 'phags pa'i chud pa dag pa rang bzhin du bstan pas skad cig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who have this view, the teaching of the noble truth of purification as having a nature does not become momentary.

original: thams cad stong ngo zhes pa ni skrag go //
analyzed: thams cad stong ngo zhes pa ni skrag go //
translated: They are afraid of the statement ‚ÄúEverything is empty.‚Äù

original: thams cad yod do zhes na ni dngos po la chags pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod do zhes na ni dngos po la chags pa ste /
translated: If they are told ‚ÄúEverything exists,‚Äù they are attached to things.

original: de bas na dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i don dam pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i don dam pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the ultimate, which is free from the characteristics of things and non-things, should be taught.

original: de ltar na blo gros chen po sems can rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na blo gros chen po sems can rnams 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, MahƒÅmati, sentient beings will engage.

original: de bzhin du yang dbung mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las klog pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dbung mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las klog pa /
translated: Likewise, the Paricched√¢nta says:

original: stong pa ma yin mi stong min /
analyzed: stong pa ma yin mi stong min /
translated: Not empty, not non-empty,

original: de bas thams cad bshad par bya //
analyzed: de bas thams cad bshad par bya //
translated: therefore all is explained.

original: yod dang med dang yod pa las //
analyzed: yod dang med dang yod pa las //
translated: From existence, non-existence, and existence,

original: de ni dbu ma'i nan tan te ;
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i nan tan te ;
translated: that is the middle way practice.

original: / zhes pa la yod pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: / zhes pa la yod pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do //
translated: Here, existence is just the mere representation.

original: med pa ni phyi rol gyi don no //
analyzed: med pa ni phyi rol gyi don no //
translated: Non-existence is the external object.

original: yod pa yang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa yang zhes pa ni /
translated: Existence again is

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba nyid kyis stong pa nyid de de ni chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i nan tan no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba nyid kyis stong pa nyid de de ni chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i nan tan no //
translated: emptiness by being free from the aspect of duality. That is the middle way practice of phenomena.üîΩAlthough I have not taught the nature of things,

original: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin ni bstan par ma byas mod kyi zhes pa ni yang dag par rig pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin brjod du med pas na ji ltar na ston zhe na /
analyzed: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin ni bstan par ma byas mod kyi zhes pa ni yang dag par rig pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin brjod du med pas na ji ltar na ston zhe na /
translated: since the nature of the continuum of moments of right cognition is inexpressible, how is it taught?

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyi'i rnam par bshad pa de lta bur ston to //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyi'i rnam par bshad pa de lta bur ston to //
translated: It is taught in that way by the pure worldly concentration with appearance, as the general explanation of omniscience.

original: nor pa la mtshan ma med pa mthong bas zhes bya ba ni sbom po dang / phra mor snang ba shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa na med de /
analyzed: nor pa la mtshan ma med pa mthong bas zhes bya ba ni sbom po dang / phra mor snang ba shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad pa na med de /
translated: The line seeing the non-existence of signs in error means that when the appearance of gross and subtle [objects] is analyzed with wisdom, it does not exist.

original: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chud pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams la bdag nyid kyis de kho na nyid shes so //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du chud pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams la bdag nyid kyis de kho na nyid shes so //
translated: The line penetrating things as they are means that because of attaining the liberation of emptiness and so forth, one knows suchness for oneself with regard to the nature of things.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos @191a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos @191a * //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvasüîΩshould not make assertions such as all phenomena are unborn, and so forth.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i sems can rnams kyi skrag pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir 'phags
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i sems can rnams kyi skrag pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir 'phags
translated: This is because, in order to completely eliminate the fear of sentient beings who are attached to existence and non-existence through omniscience, the noble ones

original: pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po bstan pas dben par mdzad pa ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid ces zhes par ro //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po bstan pas dben par mdzad pa ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid ces zhes par ro //
translated: The reality of nonduality is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: ji ltar lang kar gsungs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i tshul dang / btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa'i don de lta bur 'grel bar btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa khyab pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩtshul dang 'brel bar bstan pa gsungs pa ni gnyis kyi char gang snang ba de ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du skyes pa dang / skad cig pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar lang kar gsungs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i tshul dang / btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa'i don de lta bur 'grel bar btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa khyab pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bar bya'o // tshul dang 'brel bar bstan pa gsungs pa ni gnyis kyi char gang snang ba de ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi gzugs dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du skyes pa dang / skad cig pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
translated: The noble bodhisattvas should apply this explanation in the manner of an inference with pervasion, as it is taught in the La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra, in the manner of the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention, and in the meaning taught by the noble Maitreya, the foremost of the venerable ones.

original: mi gtsang ba'o zhes dngos po bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'o zhes dngos po bstan par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the connection with the method is as follows: Whatever appears as the two parts is like a dream, an illusion, a form seen by someone with an eye disease, a reflection, and so on. It is taught that one should teach reality as follows: ‚ÄúIt is produced, momentary, selfless, and impure.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gang yod pa de skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang yod pa de skad cig pa ste /
translated: Likewise, whatever exists is momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a finger snap, a waterfall, and so on.

original: 'gro ba gnyis kyi char snang ba yang yod pa dang / byas pa dang / skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis kyi char snang ba yang yod pa dang / byas pa dang / skyes pa'o //
translated: It is also seen to be of two types: existent and produced.

original: des na chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes sngar dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes sngar dam bca' bar mi bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One intended that one should not first formulate the thesis, ‚ÄúAll things are unproduced.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos spyir khyab par 'brel pa'i tshul gyis phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba byas pas rgyus bsgrub pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos spyir khyab par 'brel pa'i tshul gyis phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba byas pas rgyus bsgrub pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The proof of the probandum is established by the inclusion of the property of the subject through the mode of the relation of pervasion.

original: de'i phyir na cis na thog mar dam bca' bar bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir na cis na thog mar dam bca' bar bya /
translated: Therefore, why should one first formulate a thesis?

original: rab tu bya bar bstan pa nyid las rtogs par 'gyur pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu bya bar bstan pa nyid las rtogs par 'gyur pa ni /
translated: One should understand from the very teaching of the procedure.

original: 'di ci rtag gam mi rtag ces rtsod pa brtsams pa na gang smra bar bya ba gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ci rtag gam mi rtag ces rtsod pa brtsams pa na gang smra bar bya ba gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: When a dispute is begun, ‚ÄúIs this permanent or impermanent?‚Äù then whatever is to be spoken is impermanent,

original: bum pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bum pa lta bu ste /
translated: like a pot,

original: sgra yang byas pa'o //
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa'o //
translated: and sound is produced.

original: rang bzhin gyi chos dang de ltar 'brel ba'i phyir byis pa mi rtag pa dang tha mi dad par chud par byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi chos dang de ltar 'brel ba'i phyir byis pa mi rtag pa dang tha mi dad par chud par byed do //
translated: Because of the natural connection with the property, the child is made to understand that impermanence is not different.

original: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i tshul la yang gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa las mi dmigs pas na de 'di na med de ri bong gi mgo la rva bzhin du 'dir bum pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i tshul la yang gang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid thob pa las mi dmigs pas na de 'di na med de ri bong gi mgo la rva bzhin du 'dir bum pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: In the same way, in the case of non-apprehension, when something is not apprehended by the attainment of the characteristic of apprehension, it is not here, like a horn on the head of a rabbit. Here, a pot is not apprehended.

original: de yod na ni phyogs kyi rang bzhin dben par dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de yod na ni phyogs kyi rang bzhin dben par dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were, then the absence of the nature of the place would not be apprehended.

original: ji lta ba @191b bzhin du gzhan la btsal bas mi dmigs par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba @191b bzhin du gzhan la btsal bas mi dmigs par sbyor ba'o //
translated: But it is just as it is. The non-apprehension is applied by searching for something else.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu yang gang na dud pa yod pa de na me ste tshang bang na lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yang gang na dud pa yod pa de na me ste tshang bang na lta bu ste /
translated: As for the effect-cause, where there is smoke there is fire, like in a kitchen.

original: 'dir yang dud pa yod de 'bras bu ni rgyu la rag lus pa'i rang bzhin bas na 'brel pa las mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang dud pa yod de 'bras bu ni rgyu la rag lus pa'i rang bzhin bas na 'brel pa las mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here also, there is smoke because the effect is dependent on the cause. Therefore, it is not different from the connection.

original: des na dam bca' bar byed pa yang 'dir me yod do zhes rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: des na dam bca' bar byed pa yang 'dir me yod do zhes rtogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, the proposition is made here: ‚ÄúThere is fire.‚Äù

original: rgyu gsum dang 'brel bas bsgrub pa 'grub pas na dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gsum dang 'brel bas bsgrub pa 'grub pas na dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Since accomplishment is related to the three causes, one should not make assertions.

original: gal te yang chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar bya na skyon cir 'gyur zhes thams cad mkhyen pas kyang de skad du dogs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gal te yang chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar bya na skyon cir 'gyur zhes thams cad mkhyen pas kyang de skad du dogs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: If one were to make the assertion that all phenomena are unarisen, what would be the problem? The Omniscient One, fearing that this might be thought, said:

original: dam bca' ba yang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bca' ba yang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because assertions are included among all things.

original: de'i rgyus 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ni dam bca' ba de las rgyu'i mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes pa ni dam bca' ba de las rgyu'i mtshan nyid 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The reason is that from that assertion, the characteristic of engagement as a cause would follow.

original: de med na ni rgyu yang med par 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de med na ni rgyu yang med par 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis bsam pa'o //
translated: If that does not exist, then the cause would not exist.

original: dam bcas pa de ma skyes pa ni zhes pa ni dam thog mar bya ste ;
analyzed: dam bcas pa de ma skyes pa ni zhes pa ni dam thog mar bya ste ;
translated: That assertion is unarisen.

original: gang brtsad pa de ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang brtsad pa de ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is disputed is undermined.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dam bca' bar yang ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dam bca' bar yang ma skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the assertion is also unarisen.

original: bsgrub pa gzhan gyis bsgrub pa dogs pas de bas na phyogs ma yin pa nas log ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa gzhan gyis bsgrub pa dogs pas de bas na phyogs ma yin pa nas log ste /
translated: Since one fears that what is to be accomplished will be accomplished by another, therefore, one turns away from the wrong side.

original: phyogs dang bcas par bsgrub pa gang phyir bsgrub pa dang mi 'bral bar khyab par 'brel pa'i tshul rab tu grub pa de de lta bur sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang bcas par bsgrub pa gang phyir bsgrub pa dang mi 'bral bar khyab par 'brel pa'i tshul rab tu grub pa de de lta bur sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should apply this method of establishing the pervasion of the proof by the property of the position in such a way that the proof is not separated from the property of the position, having turned away from the non-position.

original: dam bca' bas kyang skyon mang po thob par byed pa /
analyzed: dam bca' bas kyang skyon mang po thob par byed pa /
translated: The thesis also brings about many faults.

original: bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa cir khyab pa'i tshul du ni yon tan mang po 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa cir khyab pa'i tshul du ni yon tan mang po 'gyur pa ste /
translated: The method of pervasion of the proof by the property of the position brings about many good qualities.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du skye'o zhes rang gi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du skye'o zhes rang gi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir skrag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not be afraid, because the appearance of the two aspects is taught to be one's own entity, like a dream and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam pa sna tshogs rnams ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes so zhes tshad mar khyab pa'i tshul gyis don gcig pa nyid yin yang dngos po med par bstan pas skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam pa sna tshogs rnams ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes so zhes tshad mar khyab pa'i tshul gyis don gcig pa nyid yin yang dngos po med par bstan pas skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: One should be afraid, because the various dependent aspects are taught to be non-existent, like a dream and so on, by the method of pervasion of valid cognition.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du gsungs pa /üîΩrtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du gsungs pa / rtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: As this very s≈´tra teaches:üîΩBy nature, all things are unarisen,

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
translated: Because they are not arisen from themselves,

original: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //üîΩmi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su // mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
translated: From another, or from both,üîΩOr by way of any of the four extremes.üîΩThe conception of things as real

original: rnam par rtog pas rnam spangs te //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rnam spangs te //
translated: Arises in dependence upon the dependent nature.

original: gang tshe gzhan dbang dag pa ni //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan dbang dag pa ni //
translated: When the dependent nature is purified,

original: grub pa de bzhin nyid ces smras //
analyzed: grub pa de bzhin nyid ces smras //
translated: It is said to be the perfected nature.

original: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bshad do //üîΩji ltar dgongs @192a * //
analyzed: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bshad do // ji ltar dgongs @192a * //
translated: I have explained the s≈´tras to be s≈´tras,üîΩAnd I have explained the tantras to be tantras.

original: pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, there are three types of naturelessness:

original: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The naturelessness of characteristics, the naturelessness of production, and the ultimate naturelessness.‚Äù

original: de la mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa ni mtshan nyid gang dag gi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / sbom po dang phra mo dang / phyi rol gyi rdul du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de dag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin du ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa ni mtshan nyid gang dag gi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / sbom po dang phra mo dang / phyi rol gyi rdul du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de dag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin du ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the absence of intrinsic reality is that it is not produced as the intrinsic reality of those characteristics which are imagined to be permanent, a self, gross, subtle, or external particles.

original: skye ba rang bzhin med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam pa sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba rang bzhin med pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam pa sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The production of the absence of intrinsic reality is that the dependent nature is not produced as the intrinsic reality of the production of aspects such as blue, yellow, and so on, like a dream, an optical illusion, and so on.

original: don dam pa rang bzhin med pa ni grub pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa rang bzhin med pa ni grub pa ste /
translated: The ultimate of the absence of intrinsic reality is established.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is emptiness in terms of duality.

original: de de ltar lang kar gshegs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po'i tshul bshad pa la 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar lang kar gshegs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po'i tshul bshad pa la 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory to explain the way of the MahƒÅyƒÅna according to the La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra and the Unraveling the Intention s≈´tras.

original: gang dag yang rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du grub pa yang med do zhes rnam par rtog par rtogs pa de dag gis chos kyi gnod pa bskyed pa sgrub par byed do zhes dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la klog go //
analyzed: gang dag yang rtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du grub pa yang med do zhes rnam par rtog par rtogs pa de dag gis chos kyi gnod pa bskyed pa sgrub par byed do zhes dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la klog go //
translated: Those who imagine that it is established as permanent and as the other-dependent are said to generate the harm of the Dharma, according to the Definitive Explanation of the Intention.

original: yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes so zhes bya ba ni yod pa thang cig skye bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes so zhes bya ba ni yod pa thang cig skye bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not arisen from existence and nonexistence means that it is not suitable to arise from momentary existence.

original: yod pa'i phyir de la bya ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir de la bya ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What activity is there in that, since it exists?

original: med pa yang mi rung ste de la bya ba yang ci yod de /
analyzed: med pa yang mi rung ste de la bya ba yang ci yod de /
translated: Nor is it suitable to arise from nonexistence, since what activity is there in that?

original: med pa'i dngos po med ces pas na ci yang mi byed de /
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po med ces pas na ci yang mi byed de /
translated: Since a nonexistent thing does not exist, it does not do anything at all.

original: byed pa dgag par byed par 'gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa dgag par byed par 'gyur pa nyid do //
translated: It would be the negation of activity.

original: ji ltar s'a lu ljang ba'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bdag gis ma byas /
analyzed: ji ltar s'a lu ljang ba'i mdo sde las 'byung ba bdag gis ma byas /
translated: As it is said in the Rice Seedling S≈´tra, ‚ÄúIt is not produced by self,

original: gzhan gyis ma byas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas /
translated: not produced by other,

original: gnyis kas kyang rten cing 'brel pa ste 'byung ba ma byas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kas kyang rten cing 'brel pa ste 'byung ba ma byas zhes pa'o //
translated: not produced by both, and not produced by ƒ™≈õvara.‚Äù

original: bdag gis ni rgyu med par mi rung bas so //
analyzed: bdag gis ni rgyu med par mi rung bas so //
translated: Since it is not suitable to be without a cause, it is not produced by self.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byed pa dang byed pa po dang 'brel pas kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byed pa dang byed pa po dang 'brel pas kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Nor is it tenable that it is related to an agent and action by another.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa po rnams rtog par byed pa po ni rang dbang can no //üîΩbyed pa pos 'dod pa'i mchog ni las so //
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa po rnams rtog par byed pa po ni rang dbang can no // byed pa pos 'dod pa'i mchog ni las so //
translated: As the seers declare: ‚ÄúThe agent is independent.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe supreme desire of the agent is action.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa'i mchog ni byed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i mchog ni byed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe supreme instrument is the agent.‚Äù

original: de nas 'di byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa dang bya ba mngon par 'brel bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de nas 'di byed pa po dang / las dang byed pa dang bya ba mngon par 'brel bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that this is related to an agent, action, and instrument.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis po med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis po med de /
translated: When one moment exists, the second moment does not exist.

original: su gang dang yang mi 'brel to //
analyzed: su gang dang yang mi 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is not related to anything.

original: yon tan mi 'pho ba ni lhan @192b cig tu mi gnas pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mi 'pho ba ni lhan @192b cig tu mi gnas pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality does not move because it does not endure simultaneously and because the nature of cause and effect is not similar.

original: rang bzhin las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from its own nature.

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: Because appearance and nonappearance have different characteristics, like a tree and ashes,

original: gcig pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: they are not the same.

original: dbang po las kyang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las kyang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not dependent origination from the sense faculties,

original: dag pa ni gzhan gyi mya ngan gyis sdug bsngal ci nas byed /
analyzed: dag pa ni gzhan gyi mya ngan gyis sdug bsngal ci nas byed /
translated: because the pure do not make suffering from the sorrow of others,

original: ma dag pa ni de'i mi shes pa yang sus byas /
analyzed: ma dag pa ni de'i mi shes pa yang sus byas /
translated: and the impure do not make the ignorance of that.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa la sogs par mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa la sogs par mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon no //
translated: Similarly, for the nondualists such as Brahmans, there is the error that the liberated, the unliberated, the rich, the poor, and so on are the same.

original: rtag pa las kyang ma yin zhes pa ni rtag pa ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa las kyang ma yin zhes pa ni rtag pa ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Also, it is not from the permanent, because the permanent is unarisen.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa'o //
translated: Because it is unarisen, it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: cig car dang rim gyis don byed par 'gal ba na rtag pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du mi srid do //
analyzed: cig car dang rim gyis don byed par 'gal ba na rtag pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du mi srid do //
translated: Since it is contradictory for the permanent to perform a function either simultaneously or successively, the permanent is impossible, like the horn of a donkey and so on.

original: chad pa las kyang ma yin zhes pa ni rgyu med pa las ma yin no //üîΩdran bzhin pa ste sngon myong ba'i rgyu las byung la /
analyzed: chad pa las kyang ma yin zhes pa ni rgyu med pa las ma yin no // dran bzhin pa ste sngon myong ba'i rgyu las byung la /
translated: Nor is it from a cause that is interrupted, that is, from a cause that is not a homogeneous immediate antecedent.üîΩIt is from a cause that is remembered, that is, from a cause that is a homogeneous immediate antecedent.

original: rgyud la ltos te skyes ma thag pa'i dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan rtog pa'i phyir sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: rgyud la ltos te skyes ma thag pa'i dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan rtog pa'i phyir sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: The pleasure, pain, etc., that arise in a continuum are inferred from the prior habit.

original: blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal sgrub par gdon mi za bar sngar yod pa'i phyir byis pa'ang yul rnams su bde ba dang / sdug bsngal sgrub cing dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal sgrub par gdon mi za bar sngar yod pa'i phyir byis pa'ang yul rnams su bde ba dang / sdug bsngal sgrub cing dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the ideas of accepting, rejecting, and indifference are certainly established on the basis of pleasure and pain, the child, too, establishes pleasure and pain in regard to objects and experiences joy and sorrow, etc.

original: de de ltar na snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod ces bya ba'i rten cing 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: de de ltar na snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod ces bya ba'i rten cing 'brel ba ste /
translated: Thus, since this exists when that exists, this arises from the arising of that.

original: skye ba la sogs pa gzhan lhag ma ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa gzhan lhag ma ni mi rung ngo //
translated: The remaining members, such as birth, are not tenable.

original: des na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni 'byung ba ma yin no zhes lan mang por bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni 'byung ba ma yin no zhes lan mang por bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it has been explained many times that dependent origination is not origination.

original: de de ltar mi 'byung bar 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'byung ba la 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa skye ba la sogs par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar mi 'byung bar 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'byung ba la 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa skye ba la sogs par brtags pa'o //
translated: When a similar instant does not arise in that way, the characteristics of the signs of error arise, such as the imputation of origination.

original: rtag pa dang gcig par sgro 'dogs pa'i gnas tha dad par brtags te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang gcig par sgro 'dogs pa'i gnas tha dad par brtags te /
translated: The basis of the superimposition of permanence and singularity is imagined to be different.

original: byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel par phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mor sgro btags nas gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel par phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mor sgro btags nas gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: The connection between the agent and action is superimposed as external gross and subtle objects, and one engages in the aspects of duality due to other-dependence.

original: bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs par brtags shing rtag pa rnams ni khang pa dang sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par phye ba na dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs par brtags shing rtag pa rnams ni khang pa dang sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par phye ba na dben pa nyid do //
translated: When imagined things such as pots, cloth, and so on are analyzed, they are empty like houses, armies, forests, and so on.

original: de bzhin du gnyis kyi @193a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis kyi @193a * //
translated: Similarly, the two,

original: rnam pas stong ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i chud pas dngos por bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pas stong ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i chud pas dngos por bstan par bya ste /
translated: The nature of things is empty of aspects, naturally luminous, and ultimate truth, which is not divided into two.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa dngos pa dang dngos po med pas rnam par mi rtog cing brjod du med pa skad cig pa'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa ji bzhin pa ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa rnams kyis mkhyen pa
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa dngos pa dang dngos po med pas rnam par mi rtog cing brjod du med pa skad cig pa'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin yang dag pa ji bzhin pa ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa rnams kyis mkhyen pa
translated: It is taught to be a thing because it is known by those who abide in meditative concentration, just as it is, the nature of correct knowledge, the continuum of moments, which is nonconceptual and inexpressible, without thought or appearance, neither a thing nor a nonthing.

original: ni de las gzhan pa'i nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ni de las gzhan pa'i nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not like the sense consciousnesses of those who are engaged in other activities, or the correct knowledge of those who hold their breath.

original: der ni dngos po dang dngos po med par bstan pa dang / skye ba dang / dam bca' ba dang / yan lag la sogs pa dang / tshad ma dang gzhal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: der ni dngos po dang dngos po med par bstan pa dang / skye ba dang / dam bca' ba dang / yan lag la sogs pa dang / tshad ma dang gzhal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: In that case, there is no conception of things or nonthings, arising, theses, branches, and so on, or valid knowledge, objects of comprehension, and so on.

original: 'on kyang snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa ni spyi'i rnam par sgra'i don ston to //
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa ni spyi'i rnam par sgra'i don ston to //
translated: However, the abiding of all the pure mundane wisdoms of samƒÅdhi along with appearances is taught by the general meaning of the term.

original: de la yan lag ces bya ba ni dam 'cha' ba dang / rgyu dang dpe dang / sgrub pa dang / bsdu bar byed pa ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pas btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la yan lag ces bya ba ni dam 'cha' ba dang / rgyu dang dpe dang / sgrub pa dang / bsdu bar byed pa ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pas btags pa'o //
translated: There, the so-called branches are designated by the terms ‚Äúpromise,‚Äù ‚Äúcause,‚Äù ‚Äúexample,‚Äù ‚Äúproof,‚Äù and ‚Äúconclusion.‚Äù

original: de la bsgrub par smos pa ni dam bca' pa'o //üîΩdpe dang mthun pa'i chos kyis bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la bsgrub par smos pa ni dam bca' pa'o // dpe dang mthun pa'i chos kyis bsgrub pa sgrub pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: Among those, the statement ‚ÄúI will prove‚Äù is the promise.üîΩThe proof that is established by a property in common with the example is the cause.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang mthun pas de'i chos su 'gyur ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang mthun pas de'i chos su 'gyur ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The property that is in common with the proof is the example.

original: ji ltar sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent

original: byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin du ste /
translated: because it is produced, like a pot.‚Äù

original: sgra yang byas pa po zhes bya ba ni bskrun pa'o //
analyzed: sgra yang byas pa po zhes bya ba ni bskrun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSound is produced‚Äù is the proof.

original: de bas na mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore it is impermanent‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: ne yi ya yi ka rnams kyis thog mar mngon sum du byas nas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka rnams kyis thog mar mngon sum du byas nas rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas posit three types of inference:

original: snga ma lta bu dang / lhag ma lta bu dang / spyir mthong ba zhes so //
analyzed: snga ma lta bu dang / lhag ma lta bu dang / spyir mthong ba zhes so //
translated: inference for oneself, inference for another, and inference based on general observation.

original: de la snga ma lta bu ni gang na rgyus 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: de la snga ma lta bu ni gang na rgyus 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference for oneself is the inference of an effect from its cause.

original: sprin byung bas char pa 'bab par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sprin byung bas char pa 'bab par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSince there are clouds, it will rain.‚Äù

original: lhag ma lta bus ni gang na 'bras bus rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma lta bus ni gang na 'bras bus rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Inference for another is the inference of a cause from its effect.

original: dud pas me lta bur ro //
analyzed: dud pas me lta bur ro //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSince there is smoke, there is fire.‚ÄùüîΩInference based on general observation is the inference of a specific effect from a general cause.

original: spyir rjes su dpag pa ni ji ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir rjes su dpag pa ni ji ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSince it is an action, it is impermanent.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni rang bzhin gsum pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni rang bzhin gsum pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The Buddhists posit a cause that is a property of the three times.

original: dpag bya de nas de mtshungs la //üîΩdngos po med pa'ang med par nges //
analyzed: dpag bya de nas de mtshungs la // dngos po med pa'ang med par nges //
translated: The object of inference is similar to that.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The absence of a thing is ascertained as absent.

original: de la rjes su dpag par bya ba ni shes par 'dod pa khyad par gyi chos can no //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag par bya ba ni shes par 'dod pa khyad par gyi chos can no //
translated: The object of inference is the specific property possessor that is desired to be known.

original: sgrub pa'i chos dang spyir don mtshungs pa ni phyogs dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos dang spyir don mtshungs pa ni phyogs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The property to be established and the general meaning are the same.

original: gang na @193b bsgrub pa chos su mi 'jug pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gang na @193b bsgrub pa chos su mi 'jug pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The property that is not engaged in the property to be established is the counter-position.

original: des na bdag nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yan lag gsum gyi rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yan lag gsum gyi rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to be understood by oneself, there is inference with three parts.

original: gzhan gyi don du yang gzhan gyis khong du ma chud pa la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu 'byung bar 'brel bar khyab pa'i tshul de la sgrar brjod cing smra bas stong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du yang gzhan gyis khong du ma chud pa la rang bzhin dang 'bras bu 'byung bar 'brel bar khyab pa'i tshul de la sgrar brjod cing smra bas stong du chud par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of others, when others do not understand, the connection of nature and effect should be expressed in words and explained.

original: de ltar na 'brel pa khyab pa'i tshul gyis smra bar bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'brel pa khyab pa'i tshul gyis smra bar bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in the expression of the connection by the method of pervasion,

original: gang na bsgrub pa 'di yod pa de bsgrub par bya ba de dang dngos po mi 'bral ba ste /
analyzed: gang na bsgrub pa 'di yod pa de bsgrub par bya ba de dang dngos po mi 'bral ba ste /
translated: wherever this property to be established exists, that which is to be established is inseparable from that entity.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la byas pa yod par mi rtag pa kho na'i dngos po dang mi 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la byas pa yod par mi rtag pa kho na'i dngos po dang mi 'bral ba'o //
translated: Just as, for example, whatever has production is necessarily impermanent, and whatever is impermanent is necessarily produced.

original: tshad bang la sogs par yang dud pa ni me'i dngos po dang mi 'bral ba de bzhin du sgra 'di la byas pa dang / ri dang ri brags la sogs pa la dud pa'o //
analyzed: tshad bang la sogs par yang dud pa ni me'i dngos po dang mi 'bral ba de bzhin du sgra 'di la byas pa dang / ri dang ri brags la sogs pa la dud pa'o //
translated: The smoke in a chimney is not separate from the thing that is fire.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa yang ri bong gi mgo la rva bzhin du sa gzhi bum pas dben pa'i dngos dang mi 'bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa yang ri bong gi mgo la rva bzhin du sa gzhi bum pas dben pa'i dngos dang mi 'bral ba ste /
translated: In the same way, non-apprehension is not separate from the thing that is the absence of a pot on the ground.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas yan lag bstan pa la rgyu gsum dang 'brel bar dgongs pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas yan lag bstan pa la rgyu gsum dang 'brel bar dgongs pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: In this way, one infers the intention of the Omniscient One in teaching the members, in connection with the three causes.

original: gang gi tshe na dam 'cha' ba ma skyes pa de'i tshe na bdag nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i phyir phyi ma'i yan lag dang 'brel pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na dam 'cha' ba ma skyes pa de'i tshe na bdag nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i phyir phyi ma'i yan lag dang 'brel pa mi rung ste /
translated: When the vow is not yet arisen, at that time, because of the non-existence of the thing itself, the connection with the subsequent member is not possible.

original: dam 'cha' ba la sogs pa'i yan lag tu smra ba rnams la nyes pa de yod do //
analyzed: dam 'cha' ba la sogs pa'i yan lag tu smra ba rnams la nyes pa de yod do //
translated: This fault is present for those who speak of the members such as the vow.

original: mi shes pa gang dag gis dam 'cha' bar byed pa de dag gis ma skyes pas na de'i phyir na mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa gang dag gis dam 'cha' bar byed pa de dag gis ma skyes pas na de'i phyir na mi bya'o //
translated: Those who do not know how to make the vow, because of its non-arisen state, should not do it.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po med pas na yan lag rnams kyi phan tshun du rgyu'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po med pas na yan lag rnams kyi phan tshun du rgyu'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: Since the thing to be established does not exist, the characteristics of the cause are not the same in the mutual relationship of the parts.

original: yan lag rnams ltos pa dang bcas pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ltos pa dang bcas pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the parts are produced in dependence.

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhin snang bar phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid can du spom po yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig rdul phra mo las brtsams par ji ltar kun rtog pa de ltar rnam par phye ba na khang
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa bzhin snang bar phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid can du spom po yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig rdul phra mo las brtsams par ji ltar kun rtog pa de ltar rnam par phye ba na khang
translated: Just as one imagines a whole substance with the characteristic of being visible or invisible, etc., beginning with the subtle atom, in the same way, when it is analyzed, the pot, cloth, etc.

original: ba dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: are empty like a house, an army, a forest, etc.

original: cha med pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyang bla 'og tu gnas par mi rung ste /
analyzed: cha med pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyang bla 'og tu gnas par mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, the subtle atoms without parts are not suitable to abide above and below,üîΩlike mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no zhes lan du mar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no zhes lan du mar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is established many times.

original: de bas na nang 'khrugs pa'i mthu las @194a * //
analyzed: de bas na nang 'khrugs pa'i mthu las @194a * //
translated: Therefore, by the power of internal agitation,

original: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba dang / blo slu bar byed pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du lta ba dang / blo slu bar byed pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs so sor snang ngo //
translated: like the appearance of blue, etc., which deceive the eye and the mind.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na mi dmigs pa de ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa nyid las dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na mi dmigs pa de ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa nyid las dben pa nyid do //
translated: When, through the examination by wisdom, the gross and subtle are distinguished, and it is not perceived, then it is the very knowledge of the absence of thought and appearance, which is isolation.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis glengs nas thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan mang po bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis glengs nas thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan mang po bshad pa yin no //
translated: When, through the influence of the latent impressions of compassion, he enters into the concentration of the knowledge of all things together with appearance, then the teaching of the Dharma occurs. This has been explained many times.

original: de nas thams cad mkhyen pas tshig gi don mtha' dag ston pa yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten thams cad kyi dus gsum gyi sems kyi rgyud skad cig rang bzhin spyi'i rnam par ston to //
analyzed: de nas thams cad mkhyen pas tshig gi don mtha' dag ston pa yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten thams cad kyi dus gsum gyi sems kyi rgyud skad cig rang bzhin spyi'i rnam par ston to //
translated: Then, the knowledge of all things, which teaches all the meanings of the words, manifests the stream of the minds of all the inexpressible worlds of the three times in the nature of an instant, in a general way.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mi gnyis pa gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa la yang snang ba dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / gleng ba dang bcas par dus gsum yid ches par ston par mdzad pa ni pra se na las 'byung ba'i dus gsum gyi tshig gi don du yid ches par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mi gnyis pa gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa la yang snang ba dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa dang / gleng ba dang bcas par dus gsum yid ches par ston par mdzad pa ni pra se na las 'byung ba'i dus gsum gyi tshig gi don du yid ches par byed pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the three times as having appearance, having signs, and having expression, in the aspect of the non-dual, non-dual nature of natural luminosity, is the conviction of the meaning of the words of the three times that arise from prasena.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas tshig gi don thams cad thugs su chud cing yid ches par ston pa ni lan du mar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas tshig gi don thams cad thugs su chud cing yid ches par ston pa ni lan du mar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The teaching of the omniscient one, who has understood and is convinced of all the meanings of the words, is taught many times.

original: des na gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i chos bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pa la rigs so //
analyzed: des na gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i chos bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pa la rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the teaching of the dual and non-dual is for the omniscient one.

original: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa /üîΩrang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa / rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
translated: The summarizing verse:üîΩNo nature, no consciousness,

original: dngos po med cing kun gzhi med //üîΩ'di dag ro bzhin byis pa yis //
analyzed: dngos po med cing kun gzhi med // 'di dag ro bzhin byis pa yis //
translated: No entity, no foundation consciousness,üîΩThese are imagined by the childish,

original: log pa'i rtog pa can gyis brtags //
analyzed: log pa'i rtog pa can gyis brtags //
translated: With false conceptions, like a corpse.

original: zhes pa ste gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa yang dngos po med do //
analyzed: zhes pa ste gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa yang dngos po med do //
translated: Because of the non-existence of entities as the nature of the apprehended, the representations also do not exist.

original: phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na stong pa nyid de /
translated: Because of the non-existence of the abiding of the aggregates and the non-existence of the destruction of the aggregates, the distinction between the gross and the subtle is emptiness.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba phyi rol gyi phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dngos po mi 'jig pa yang med do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba phyi rol gyi phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i dngos po mi 'jig pa yang med do //
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom: ‚ÄúThere is no abiding of the external aggregates and there is no destruction of the entity that is grasped as permanent, as a self, and so on.‚Äù

original: de la 'di snyam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, one might think as follows:

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the abode

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise from the all-base.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, the eight and the nine

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: are like the waves of the ocean.

original: zhes de skad du thugs @194b dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes de skad du thugs @194b dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thinking this, the Omniscient One said:

original: kun gzhi med ces pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi med ces pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no all-base.‚Äù

original: rmi lam gyi dus na yang lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig po so sor snang ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na yang lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig po so sor snang ba ste /
translated: Even in dreams, the single foundation consciousness appears as the body, possessions, and abode.

original: bslab pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su smin pa'i mthu las sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: bslab pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su smin pa'i mthu las sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa so sor snang ngo //
translated: And due to the power of the full maturation of various kinds of training, the various different aspects of consciousness appear individually.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na yang mtsho la sogs pa la khrus la sogs pas slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad mar nges so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na yang mtsho la sogs pa la khrus la sogs pas slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad mar nges so //
translated: Even in dreams, the water in a mirage and so on is ascertained as valid because it does not deceive by washing and so on.

original: mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa'i chus slu bar byed par nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa'i chus slu bar byed par nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But it is not valid because it is certain to deceive by the water in a mirage and so on of sorrow.

original: de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang slu ba dang slu ba med par gdon mi za bas gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba tha dad par snang ba tsam la gzhal ba dang / tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa der mtshungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang slu ba dang slu ba med par gdon mi za bas gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba tha dad par snang ba tsam la gzhal ba dang / tshad ma rnam par gzhag pa der mtshungs so //
translated: In the same way, even at the time of not being asleep, the presentation of valid knowledge and the establishment of valid knowledge are the same in terms of the mere appearance of the difference of the proponents of the two and non-two, which undoubtedly are deceptive and non-deceptive.

original: phyi rol gyi don kyang med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don kyang med de /
translated: External objects also do not exist.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa dag ma skyes pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa dag ma skyes pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: like a dream, an illusion, a mirage, an echo, a reflection, a city of gandharvas, a mirage, a visual distortion, and so on.

original: des na lus dang / longs spyod dang / sa la sogs pa sbom po dang phra mo shes rab kyis dpyad pa de gzhigs nas khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi lus la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis byis pa log par ltung ba blun pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na lus dang / longs spyod dang / sa la sogs pa sbom po dang phra mo shes rab kyis dpyad pa de gzhigs nas khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi lus la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis byis pa log par ltung ba blun pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes with wisdom the coarse and subtle body, enjoyments, earth, and so on, and when one does not observe them, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on, then the external body and so on are imagined by childish, fallen, and ignorant beings. This is the meaning of the Omniscient One‚Äôs intention.

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes par //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes par //
translated: All phenomena are unborn.

original: mu stegs kun la bsgrags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mu stegs kun la bsgrags pa'i phyir //
translated: Because this is proclaimed to all tƒ´rthikas,

original: dngos po rkyen dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: dngos po rkyen dang ldan pa ni //
translated: Things that possess conditions

original: su la'ang skyes pa yod med do //
analyzed: su la'ang skyes pa yod med do //
translated: are not born for anyone.

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes par //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes par //
translated: All things are unarisen,

original: dam 'cha' ba la mi rtag ste //
analyzed: dam 'cha' ba la mi rtag ste //
translated: because they are impermanent.

original: zhes pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gud na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i chos gud na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is because arising and so on do not exist as separate things.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na gnyis po med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na gnyis po med de /
translated: When one instant exists, the second does not exist.

original: des na dngos po dang rkyen dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos po dang rkyen dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore things that possess conditions do not exist.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa pa rnams rtog par byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa pa rnams rtog par byed pa /
translated: As the LokƒÅyatas imagine,

original: byed ba po ni rang dbang can dang / byed par 'dod pa'i mchog ni las dang / sgrub par byed pa'i gtso ni byed pa po zhes pa de lta bur byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / @195a * //
analyzed: byed ba po ni rang dbang can dang / byed par 'dod pa'i mchog ni las dang / sgrub par byed pa'i gtso ni byed pa po zhes pa de lta bur byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / @195a * //
translated: the agent is independent, the supreme agent is the object, and the principal agent is the action.

original: bya ba dang / byed pa po gang mngon par 'brel te skye ba med do //
analyzed: bya ba dang / byed pa po gang mngon par 'brel te skye ba med do //
translated: The agent, object, action, and the agent‚Äôs connection to the action do not arise.

original: des na mu stegs thams cad la bsgrags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na mu stegs thams cad la bsgrags pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because this is proclaimed to all tƒ´rthikas,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa ste /
translated: all phenomena are unarisen.

original: mu stegs byed rnams thams cad ni rtag ba dang bdag tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams thams cad ni rtag ba dang bdag tu smra ba'o //
translated: All tƒ´rthikas propound permanence and a self.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams ni bdag med par smra ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams ni bdag med par smra ba ste /
translated: Buddhists are proponents of selflessness.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi /
translated: Therefore, they say:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can they be unstable and not momentary?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: Whatever arises is just that which is arising.

original: byed pa por yang der brjod do //
analyzed: byed pa por yang der brjod do //
translated: It is also called the agent.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis snang ba'i chos rnams la yang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis snang ba'i chos rnams la yang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: With regard to phenomena that appear through dependence, like dreams, magical illusions, and eye diseases, they have no nature of arising.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bdag dang / rtag pa la sogs pa brtag pa rnams mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pas na mi skye'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las bdag dang / rtag pa la sogs pa brtag pa rnams mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pas na mi skye'o //
translated: As the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention says, ‚ÄúJust as the son of a barren woman does not arise, so all phenomena do not arise.‚Äù

original: don dam pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa skad cig la rgyun kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: don dam pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa skad cig la rgyun kyang brjod du med pa'i phyir snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Also, because the ultimate, nondual, correct knowledge is inexpressible in a continuum of moments, it is said that ‚Äúafter the previous one ceases, this one arises.‚Äù

original: brtag pa'i skye bo la sogs pa lhag pa rnams chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brtag pa'i skye bo la sogs pa lhag pa rnams chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The remaining [terms] such as ‚Äúinvestigated‚Äù do not exist in the two types of selflessness of phenomena and persons.

original: gang gis skad cig pa rnams rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin pa des na chos thams cad ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis skad cig pa rnams rkyen dang ldan pa ma yin pa des na chos thams cad ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Since the momentary are not endowed with conditions, all phenomena are unarisen.

original: skad cig ma gang la rgyu'i skad cig pa yod pa de la 'bras bu'i skad cig pa med de /
analyzed: skad cig ma gang la rgyu'i skad cig pa yod pa de la 'bras bu'i skad cig pa med de /
translated: In whatever moment the cause exists, in that moment the effect does not exist.

original: des na dngos po rnams rkyen dang mi ldan pa ni zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams rkyen dang mi ldan pa ni zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the Omniscient One‚Äôs intention is that things are not endowed with conditions.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med par dam 'cha' ba mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa ci'i slad du zhes bya ba dang / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med par dam 'cha' ba mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa ci'i slad du zhes bya ba dang / de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The promise that all phenomena are unarisen is ‚Äúimpermanent,‚Äù and so on. Why?

original: rgyu de dang ni ldan pa'i phyir //üîΩ'grub blo de nyams de dag 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu de dang ni ldan pa'i phyir // 'grub blo de nyams de dag 'gyur //
translated: Because of possessing that cause,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: the mind that establishes that degenerates.

original: rgyu de dang ni ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu de dang ni ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of possessing that cause

original: zhes bya ba ni dam 'cha' ba'i rgyu dang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dam 'cha' ba'i rgyu dang ngo //
translated: is the cause of the promise.

original: 'grub blo de nyams de dag 'gyur //
analyzed: 'grub blo de nyams de dag 'gyur //
translated: The thought of accomplishment and the accomplishment itself are destroyed.

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir dam 'cha' ba ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi nang du 'du ba'i phyir dam 'cha' ba ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Since all dharmas are included in the vow, the vow is unborn.

original: dam 'cha' ba la sogs pa sgrub pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: dam 'cha' ba la sogs pa sgrub pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba yang mi 'grub po //
translated: Since the accomplishment of the vow, etc. is nonexistent, the object to be accomplished is not accomplished.

original: 'on te dam 'cha' ba na skyes na ni des chos thams cad kyang skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te dam 'cha' ba na skyes na ni des chos thams cad kyang skyes pa'o //
translated: But if the vow is born, then by that all dharmas are born.

original: de'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rmi lam la sogs par dngos por bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rmi lam la sogs par dngos por bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as explained above, all dharmas should be taught as things in dreams, etc.

original: stong pa dang rang bzhin med @195b pa la sogs pa dam 'cha' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa dang rang bzhin med @195b pa la sogs pa dam 'cha' bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not make a vow about emptiness, essencelessness, etc.

original: 'on kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs so zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs so zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: But one should say, ‚ÄúAll dharmas are empty, essenceless, like a dream, an optical illusion, a mirage, an echo, a reflection of the moon in water, a magical creation, and external form.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa'i chud pa thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin bslad pa las 'byung bar thams cad mkhyen pa bdag nyid kyis sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chud pa thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin bslad pa las 'byung bar thams cad mkhyen pa bdag nyid kyis sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One himself has established that all worldly perceptions arise from the contamination of the nature of subject and object.üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar log pa skra shad 'dzings //
analyzed: ji ltar log pa skra shad 'dzings //
translated: The false hair seen by one with an eye disease

original: skye bo ri rab cang yis mthong //
analyzed: skye bo ri rab cang yis mthong //
translated: Is not seen by one with healthy eyes.

original: de bzhin dngos por rnam rtog 'di //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos por rnam rtog 'di //
translated: Likewise, this conceptualization of entities

original: log par byis pa rnam par brtags //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: log par byis pa rnam par brtags // zhes pa ste /
translated: Is falsely imagined by the childish.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las skyes pa mnyam par mi 'jog cing nang glongs pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba dang / rab rib la sogs pa lta bur 'dzings pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po la gdon mi za zhing /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las skyes pa mnyam par mi 'jog cing nang glongs pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba dang / rab rib la sogs pa lta bur 'dzings pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po la gdon mi za zhing /
translated: The perceptions that arise from one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mindstreams are not posited as equipoise. They are like the perceptions of one who is spinning, fainting, or suffering from blurred vision. They are entangled and are definitely not real things.

original: der nongs pa rnams la dngos por 'dzin to //
analyzed: der nongs pa rnams la dngos por 'dzin to //
translated: However, those who are mistaken apprehend them as real things.

original: ji ltar na yang byis pa rnams kyis dngos po ji lta bur mthong ba de lta bu med ces pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas rigs pa gzhan bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang byis pa rnams kyis dngos po ji lta bur mthong ba de lta bu med ces pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas rigs pa gzhan bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has established other reasons as to why the things that are seen by the childish do not exist as they appear.

original: srid pa gsum ni rtag pa tsam //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni rtag pa tsam //
translated: The three worlds are merely permanent.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod med de //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod med de //
translated: The nature of entities is neither existent nor non-existent.

original: brtags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
translated: The nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is neither existent nor non-existent.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.

original: rtog pa can rnams rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtog pa can rnams rtog par 'gyur //
translated: The nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.
