original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can /
translated: The nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.

original: btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs par rnam par phye ba dang / yan lag las 'dus shing brtags pas rnam pa tha dad pa phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas phye ba na khang pa dang /
analyzed: btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs par rnam par phye ba dang / yan lag las 'dus shing brtags pas rnam pa tha dad pa phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas phye ba na khang pa dang /
translated: The nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.

original: sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs gcig par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs gcig par mi rigs so //
translated: The nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers.üîΩThe nature of entities is imagined by the imaginers

original: phra mo'i gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa 'dus pa la snam bu dang bum pa la sogs par gdags par bya na /
analyzed: phra mo'i gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa 'dus pa la snam bu dang bum pa la sogs par gdags par bya na /
translated: A cloth, a vase, etc. are designated in the aggregation of subtle forms, tastes, smells, and tactile sensations.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyang phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas dbye ba na stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyang phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas dbye ba na stong pa nyid de /
translated: But the subtle particles of form, etc. are also empty, when they are divided into different directional parts.

original: dngos po'i rnag bzhin yod med do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnag bzhin yod med do //
translated: The nature of entities is neither existent nor non-existent.

original: @196a * // gang la 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po de lta bu'i rnam pa can med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: @196a * // gang la 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po de lta bu'i rnam pa can med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: One should understand that the Omniscient One intends that the entities of the apprehender and the apprehended do not exist in the way that they appear.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: In the same way, the BhagavƒÅn has taught:üîΩFrom the movement of the mind,

original: mtshan dang dngos po rnam rig dang // yid kyi rnam par g-yos pa las //
analyzed: mtshan dang dngos po rnam rig dang // yid kyi rnam par g-yos pa las //
translated: which is the cognition of characteristics and entities,

original: nga yi sras rnams 'das nas ni //
analyzed: nga yi sras rnams 'das nas ni //
translated: my sons will pass beyond

original: de dag rnam par mi rtog spyod //
analyzed: de dag rnam par mi rtog spyod //
translated: the conduct of non-conceptuality.

original: smig rgyu ba la ji lta bur //
analyzed: smig rgyu ba la ji lta bur //
translated: Just as in a mirage

original: chu med pa la chur 'dzin pa //
analyzed: chu med pa la chur 'dzin pa //
translated: there is no water, but water is apprehended,

original: snang la byis pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: snang la byis pa de bzhin te //
translated: so it is for the childish,

original: 'phags pa rnams ni khyad par ldan //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni khyad par ldan //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: but the noble ones are different.

original: de la mtshan ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The signs are form, etc.

original: der rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: der rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the perception of those.

original: de las de ma thag tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de las de ma thag tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Immediately after that, there is the mental consciousness,

original: sbom po dang / phra mo la sogs pa rnam par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo la sogs pa rnam par brtags pa'o //
translated: which is the discrimination of gross, subtle, etc.

original: gang gis shes rab kyis dpyad de de rnam par gzhigs nas mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mtshan ma thams cad las 'das nas rnam par mi rtog par spyod cing gnas so //
analyzed: gang gis shes rab kyis dpyad de de rnam par gzhigs nas mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mtshan ma thams cad las 'das nas rnam par mi rtog par spyod cing gnas so //
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, one does not perceive those signs, then, having transcended all signs, one abides in the practice of non-discrimination.

original: ji ltar na gzugs la sogs pa med par yang de dag la mngon par chags par 'gyur zhes thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs la sogs pa med par yang de dag la mngon par chags par 'gyur zhes thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: How can one be attached to those, form, etc., when they do not exist?

original: chu med pa la chur 'dzin pa de bzhin du nang glongs nas snang ba la phyi rol gyi bar mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: chu med pa la chur 'dzin pa de bzhin du nang glongs nas snang ba la phyi rol gyi bar mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Just as one grasps at water where there is no water, so too, one is attached to external objects, which appear internally.

original: snang ba tsam la dag pa dang ma dag par rnam par shes pa'i phyir 'phags pa dang byis pa rnams la de bzhin te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam la dag pa dang ma dag par rnam par shes pa'i phyir 'phags pa dang byis pa rnams la de bzhin te /
translated: Because of the consciousness of mere appearance as pure or impure, the noble ones and the childish are just like that.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang stong par ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang stong par ro //
translated: The knowledge of the noble ones is of the impermanent, the painful, the inauspicious, and the empty.

original: byis pa rnams kyi ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log par ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log par ro //
translated: The knowledge of the foolish is of the opposite, of the permanent, the pleasant, the pure, and the self.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa ni byis pa'i shes pa las 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par thar pa gsum gyi dag pa ye shes khyad par can no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa ni byis pa'i shes pa las 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par thar pa gsum gyi dag pa ye shes khyad par can no //
translated: The knowledge of the noble ones is superior, for it is the pure knowledge of the three liberations which is superior to the knowledge of the foolish.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de skad du gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has said this:

original: 'phags pa'i mthong ba dag pa ste //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i mthong ba dag pa ste //
translated: The vision of the noble ones is pure,

original: rnam par thar pa gsum las skyes //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum las skyes //
translated: arising from the three liberations.

original: skye dang 'jig las rnam grol ba //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig las rnam grol ba //
translated: Free from origination and destruction,

original: snang med rab tu spyod rnams kyis //
analyzed: snang med rab tu spyod rnams kyis //
translated: the bodhisattvas, who practice the non-appearance,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: have attained the highest perfection.

original: 'phags pa dang byis pa gnyis kyis mthong ba'i dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang byis pa gnyis kyis mthong ba'i dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
translated: The vision of the noble ones and the vision of the foolish are pure and impure, respectively.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni rnam par thar pa gsum las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi ni rnam par thar pa gsum las 'byung ngo //
translated: The vision of the noble ones arises from the three liberations.

original: byis pa rnams kyi ni nang glongs pa mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi ni nang glongs pa mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: The ignorance of childish beings is the non-apprehension of the equality of the inner and outer.

original: mgo 'khor ba dang / @196b brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor bar snang ba sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang / @196b brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor bar snang ba sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of the variety of appearances in cyclic existence is produced from the maturation of karma, like the appearances in a dream.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad cing shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ste mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa thams cad dang / rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad cing shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ste mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa thams cad dang / rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang /
translated: When, through the wisdom of analysis, the coarse and subtle are distinguished and not apprehended, then all things with the aspect of duality, existence and non-existence, permanence and annihilation,

original: bdag dang las dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsalüîΩbar gnas so //
analyzed: bdag dang las dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gnas so //
translated: Because the noble ones do not observe phenomena that are different from the characteristics of arising, ceasing, and so forth, which are related to the self, karma, the agent, and the action, the wisdom of the noble ones is the ultimate truth, which is nonconceptual, free from appearances, and nondual. It is naturally luminous.

original: ji ltar btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas dgongs pa byed pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas dgongs pa byed pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the noble Maitreya‚Äôs thoughts expressed in the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes:

original: de ste nyon mongs de ma gyur //
analyzed: de ste nyon mongs de ma gyur //
translated: If the afflictions were not transformed,

original: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus can thams cad grol bar 'gyur //
translated: all embodied beings would be liberated.

original: de ste rnam dag de mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ste rnam dag de mi 'gyur //
translated: If the purity were not transformed,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur //üîΩnyon mongs pa dang rnam dag pa //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur // nyon mongs pa dang rnam dag pa //
translated: effort would be fruitless.üîΩAfflictions and purity

original: drir bcas dri ma med pa'ang de'o //
analyzed: drir bcas dri ma med pa'ang de'o //
translated: are like a soiled cloth and the cloth when it is clean.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: The water element, gold, and space

original: dag pa bzhin du dag pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: are pure in the same way.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na stong par mthong bas na mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / sems kyis mi smon pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na stong par mthong bas na mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / sems kyis mi smon pa ste /
translated: Therefore, one does not apprehend signs and one does not wish for anything with the mind.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum gong nas gong du snang ba med par spyod pa'i 'phags pa de dag gi mi gnyis pa'i ye shes des na dbung mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las bshad pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum gong nas gong du snang ba med par spyod pa'i 'phags pa de dag gi mi gnyis pa'i ye shes des na dbung mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las bshad pa /
translated: The pristine wisdom of nonduality of those ƒÅryas who practice the three gates of liberation in an increasingly nonapparent way is explained in the Analysis of the Extremes:

original: chu'i khams dang / gser dang / nam mkha'i khams lta bur dag pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / gser dang / nam mkha'i khams lta bur dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure like the water element, gold, and the space element.

original: ji ltar na yang 'phags pa rnams kyi chud pa'i rang bzhin snang ba thams cad las grol ba lags zhes thams cad mkhyen pas de skad du thugs dogs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang 'phags pa rnams kyi chud pa'i rang bzhin snang ba thams cad las grol ba lags zhes thams cad mkhyen pas de skad du thugs dogs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: How is it that the nature of the water element of the ƒÅryas is free from all appearances? The Omniscient One, having wondered about this, said:

original: dngos po rnams ni snang med de //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni snang med de //
translated: Things are not apparent.

original: rnal 'byor can la med pa'ang med //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can la med pa'ang med //
translated: For the yogi, nonexistence does not exist.

original: dngos dang dngos med mnyam pas ni //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mnyam pas ni //
translated: By the sameness of things and nonthings,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: the result of the ƒÅryas is born.

original: de la snang ba med pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de la snang ba med pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi don dam pa ste /
translated: The absence of appearance there is the ultimate of all things.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the aspects of subject and object.

original: de ji ltar na rtog par 'gyur zhes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas ston to //üîΩde ni yang dag par rig pas @197a * //
analyzed: de ji ltar na rtog par 'gyur zhes pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pas ston to // de ni yang dag par rig pas @197a * //
translated: How can that be imagined? The Omniscient One teaches.

original: rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ste /
translated: That is to be realized by right knowledge.

original: de lta bur rnam pa can ni rnal 'byor can gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: de lta bur rnam pa can ni rnal 'byor can gyi dngos po'o //
translated: The one who has that kind of aspect is the yogi.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: der rtogs pa can te nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pas myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: der rtogs pa can te nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pas myong ba bzhin no //
translated: Like the experience of the sense consciousness that definitely engages it.

original: dgongs pa la ltos te sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa la ltos te sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: In terms of intention, the conceptual thoughts of all sentient beings arise.

original: nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa rnams ni yud tsam du gnas so //
analyzed: nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa rnams ni yud tsam du gnas so //
translated: The sense consciousnesses that definitely engage it last only a moment.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med par yang dag par rig pa ni yun ring por ro //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med par yang dag par rig pa ni yun ring por ro //
translated: The right knowledge that is free from intention and appearance lasts a long time.

original: dbugs thub pa ni yang dag par rig pa tsam gnas so //
analyzed: dbugs thub pa ni yang dag par rig pa tsam gnas so //
translated: The right knowledge that is mere abiding lasts as long as one can hold one's breath.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu dngos po dang / dngos po med par mnyam pas skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu dngos po dang / dngos po med par mnyam pas skye ba ste /
translated: The noble ones are equal with respect to the result, which is a thing and a non-thing.üîΩAs it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos pos mngon par rtogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos pos mngon par rtogs pa ma yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not realize the perfection of wisdom through a thing,

original: dngos po med pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor through a non-thing.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pas mnyam pas so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pas mnyam pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThrough the equality of thing and non-thing.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIn order to abandon the conceptualization of thing and non-thing.‚Äù

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya pa de'i bshad pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya pa de'i bshad pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the explanation. One should understand that this is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: ji ltar yang mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yang mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: And as it is said in this s≈´tra:üîΩ‚ÄúI do not attain nirvana through characteristics, actions,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //
translated: and things.

original: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
translated: When conceptual consciousness is reversed,

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o // yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: I attain nirvana.üîΩNon-existence is implied by existence,

original: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
analyzed: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
translated: and existence is implied by non-existence.‚Äù

original: de bas med par shes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par shes mi bya //
translated: Therefore, one should not understand it as non-existent.

original: yod par yang ni mi brtag go //
analyzed: yod par yang ni mi brtag go //
translated: Nor should one imagine it as existent.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam zhing rnam par mi rtog pa ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin no //üîΩji ltar na dngos po med pas dngos po rnams mnyam pa nyid du med ces de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam zhing rnam par mi rtog pa ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin no // ji ltar na dngos po med pas dngos po rnams mnyam pa nyid du med ces de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The middle meditative absorption is the equality of things and non-things, and the absence of conceptual elaboration.

original: ji ltar dngos med dngos po rnams //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos med dngos po rnams //
translated: How is it that things are equal to non-things?üîΩThe Omniscient One has said this in order to remove doubts:üîΩHow can non-things

original: mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar byed //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar byed //
translated: be equal to things?üîΩWhen the mind does not know

original: phyi dang nang gi g-yo ba rnams //üîΩnam zhig sems kyis mi shes na //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi g-yo ba rnams // nam zhig sems kyis mi shes na //
translated: the movements of the outer and inner,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: then the equality of things is achieved.

original: nam zhig sems kyis 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos por mi shes pa de na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mi gnyis par rnam par chud pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam zhig sems kyis 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos por mi shes pa de na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mi gnyis par rnam par chud pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind does not know the movements of the outer and inner, and does not know the apprehending subject and the apprehended object, then the equality of things with the appearance of duality is achieved by those who are naturally radiant and who are absorbed in non-duality.

original: phyi nang gi g-yo ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skad cig pa yang @197b dag par rig pa la 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis phyi rol gyi gzung par rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi g-yo ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skad cig pa yang @197b dag par rig pa la 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyis phyi rol gyi gzung par rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The inner and outer movements and so on refer to the non-conceptualization of external objects by the nature of the apprehension of the correct knowledge of momentariness.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems kyang mi rgyun yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems kyang mi rgyun yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos /
translated: In that way, the nature of the correct knowledge of the non-dual ultimate truth is not conceptualized as the entity of the object of knowledge or the knower, let alone as a continuum, words, or sounds.

original: des na yang dag par rig pa gnyis kyi dngos po med pa 'jig par mi byed do //
analyzed: des na yang dag par rig pa gnyis kyi dngos po med pa 'jig par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, the non-existence of the entity of the two correct knowledges is not destroyed.

original: de bzhin du yang btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas gsungs pa /
translated: Similarly, the noble Maitreya also said:

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa yis //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa yis //
translated: By the non-existence of duality,

original: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness of entities.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it appears in the Sa·πÉdhinirmocana S≈´tra:

original: gnyis kyi rnam pas don dam pa la rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pas don dam pa la rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the absence of intrinsic nature in the aspect of duality.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i stong pa nyid du 'dir smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i stong pa nyid du 'dir smras pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is said to be emptiness, which is naturally luminous.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dpyad pa'i le'u phran bcu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dpyad pa'i le'u phran bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes chapter ten of the third section of the Bodhisattvayogacaropadesa, called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Direct Perception and Inference.‚Äù

original: // / blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: // / blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Mahamati said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nam dmigs par bya ba'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa de ni rnam par rig pa'i gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nam dmigs par bya ba'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa de ni rnam par rig pa'i gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavan, you have said, ‚ÄòWhen the object of perception is known not to be perceived, there is no apprehending subject because there is no perceived object.

original: de 'dzin pa med pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi 'jug go zhes gsungs na zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa byams pas bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa med pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi 'jug go zhes gsungs na zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa byams pas bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: When there is no apprehending subject, the consciousness that is proclaimed to be conceptual does not operate either.‚Äô

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba rab tu skye ba ni //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba rab tu skye ba ni //
translated: The appearance of objects, sentient beings, and the self is the arising of perception.

original: rnam par rig pa'o de'i don med //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'o de'i don med //
translated: It is perception, but it does not have an object.

original: de med pas na de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med //
translated: And since that does not exist, this also does not exist.

original: ces bya ba 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs su gnas pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs su gnas pa ste /
translated: This is the position of the Omniscient One.

original: dmigs bya dmigs dang bral bar ni //
analyzed: dmigs bya dmigs dang bral bar ni //
translated: When the object of observation is free from the object of observation,

original: gang tshe 'dus byas mthong bar ni //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dus byas mthong bar ni //
translated: At that time, the compounded is seen.

original: mnyam nyid sems su mthong ba ni //
analyzed: mnyam nyid sems su mthong ba ni //
translated: When the mind is seen as equality,

original: de tshe 'jig par mi byed do //üîΩzhes par ro //
analyzed: de tshe 'jig par mi byed do // zhes par ro //
translated: At that time, it is not destroyed.

original: nam sbom po dang phra mo rnam par dpyad de /
analyzed: nam sbom po dang phra mo rnam par dpyad de /
translated: When the coarse and the subtle are analyzed and distinguished,

original: rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du med de stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du med de stong pa nyid do //
translated: they do not exist like a house, an army, a forest, and so forth. They are empty.

original: cha med pa rnams kyang bla 'og gi tshogs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: cha med pa rnams kyang bla 'og gi tshogs su mi rung ste /
translated: Also, the partless are not suitable as a collection of above and below,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: like the mind and mental factors.

original: kun mkhyen dam chos 'dzin pa 'grel pa ni //
analyzed: kun mkhyen dam chos 'dzin pa 'grel pa ni //
translated: The commentary that upholds the holy Dharma of the Omniscient One

original: bdag med grub mtha' tshul ni rgyas pa la //
analyzed: bdag med grub mtha' tshul ni rgyas pa la //
translated: is the extensive method of the tenets of selflessness.

original: @198a * // ngas gang 'di yi rnam dpyad 'dir byas pa //
analyzed: @198a * // ngas gang 'di yi rnam dpyad 'dir byas pa //
translated: The analysis that I have done here

original: gang na snga ma'i klus bos gnyen rnams kyis //
analyzed: gang na snga ma'i klus bos gnyen rnams kyis //
translated: is for the friends who were called by the nƒÅga of the past.

original: 'grel pa ma byas bdag gis byas nas ni //
analyzed: 'grel pa ma byas bdag gis byas nas ni //
translated: I have composed this commentary,

original: tshad ma lung dang rigs pa sbyar nas su //
analyzed: tshad ma lung dang rigs pa sbyar nas su //
translated: applying logic, scripture, and reasoning.

original: 'on kyang 'dir ni legs bshad pa yi ci //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir ni legs bshad pa yi ci //
translated: But what is there to explain here?

original: log pa'i smon lam nyid ni btab pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i smon lam nyid ni btab pa'o //
translated: I have only made a false aspiration.

original: zhes pa'o // phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyis rdul phra mol cha med par khas len pa de dag ni phyogs kyi tha dad par dbye ba na gcig par mi rigs so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyis rdul phra mol cha med par khas len pa de dag ni phyogs kyi tha dad par dbye ba na gcig par mi rigs so //
translated: Those who assert partless subtle particles as external objects cannot reasonably be divided into directional parts.

original: des na phyi rol gyi gzung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i dngos po yang med do //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi gzung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i dngos po yang med do //
translated: Therefore, since external apprehended entities do not exist, the apprehending entities also do not exist.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When, through wisdom, the coarse and subtle objects of cognition are not observed,

original: shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa de na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mnyam pa nyid yang dag par rig par gnas so //
analyzed: shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa de na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mnyam pa nyid yang dag par rig par gnas so //
translated: then, without thought and without appearance, one abides in the knowledge of the ultimate truth, the nondual equality of entities and nonentities.

original: des ni nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa lta bu'i bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa la 'jig par mi byed do //
analyzed: des ni nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa lta bu'i bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa la 'jig par mi byed do //
translated: By this, one does not destroy the ultimate truth, which is nondual, free from thought and appearance, and inexpressible, such as the sense perception that definitely engages, and the correct understanding of the exhalation of breath.

original: glongs pa'i mthu nyid kyis lus la sems can du nges so //
analyzed: glongs pa'i mthu nyid kyis lus la sems can du nges so //
translated: By the power of being released, one conceives of the body as a sentient being.

original: sems kyi rgyud la rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang / bdag tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang / bdag tu 'dzin to //
translated: In the continuum of the mind, one conceives of it as permanent, singular, and a self.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la byed pa'i las su rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la byed pa'i las su rnam par rtog ste /
translated: One conceives of the eye consciousness and so forth as the agent of action.

original: sems can la sogs pa'i tshogs kyis don thams cad gzung ba'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa'i tshogs kyis don thams cad gzung ba'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa mi 'jug go //
translated: Because the collection of sentient beings and so forth are not the entities that apprehend all objects, consciousness does not engage.

original: de la 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa ni shes pa'i shes par bya ba ji lta bur na yongs su mi shes na ci rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su mi shes sam /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa ni shes pa'i shes par bya ba ji lta bur na yongs su mi shes na ci rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su mi shes sam /
translated: Regarding that, the noble MahƒÅmati's inquiry is: If consciousness is not fully understood as the object of consciousness, then is the specific and general characteristics not fully understood?

original: ci gzhan gyis zil du brlag gam /
analyzed: ci gzhan gyis zil du brlag gam /
translated: Is it because of being overwhelmed by others?

original: ci bsgribs pas sam /üîΩci ring bas sam /
analyzed: ci bsgribs pas sam / ci ring bas sam /
translated: Is it because of being obscured?üîΩIs it because of being distant?

original: ci ha cang nye bas sam /
analyzed: ci ha cang nye bas sam /
translated: Is it because of being too close?

original: phra ba'i dngos pos sam /
analyzed: phra ba'i dngos pos sam /
translated: Is it because of subtle things?

original: ci'i dbang po dang mi ldan pas sam /
analyzed: ci'i dbang po dang mi ldan pas sam /
translated: Is it because of not having a sense faculty?

original: ci yid bslad pas sam /
analyzed: ci yid bslad pas sam /
translated: Is it because of a corrupted mind?

original: de de bzhin du 'dres pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de de bzhin du 'dres pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Is it because of being mixed up like that?

original: grangs can la sogs pas rgol ba'i the tshom du bzlog / blo gros chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol pa /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pas rgol ba'i the tshom du bzlog / blo gros chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol pa /
translated: Mahamati asked the Omniscient One,

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud pa ni dogs pa las kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud pa ni dogs pa las kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who understand the characteristics of self and generality also arise from doubts.

original: de las thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyi ma'i phyogs ni ngas de la @198b dgongs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de las thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyi ma'i phyogs ni ngas de la @198b dgongs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Omniscient One's reply is from I will now explain that for you and so on.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de dmigs par bya ba'i don du shes pas mi dmigs pa de rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin no zhes bshad kyi yongs su mi shes pa tsam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de dmigs par bya ba'i don du shes pas mi dmigs pa de rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin no zhes bshad kyi yongs su mi shes pa tsam las ni ma yin no //
translated: When analyzed by wisdom and not observed as an object by consciousness, that is posited as mere representation-only, I have explained. It is not merely from complete non-understanding.

original: gnyid log pa dang / smyos pa dang / myos pa dang / blun pa dang / long ba dang / lkugs pa dang / byis pa dang / glen pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / zil du brlag pa dang / ring ba dang / phra ba dang /
analyzed: gnyid log pa dang / smyos pa dang / myos pa dang / blun pa dang / long ba dang / lkugs pa dang / byis pa dang / glen pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / zil du brlag pa dang / ring ba dang / phra ba dang /
translated: It is not because of the knowledge of sleep, insanity, intoxication, stupidity, blindness, muteness, childhood, foolishness, obscuration, suppression, distance, subtlety,

original: yongs su mi gsal ba dang / bslad pa dang / log pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag par bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mi gsal ba dang / bslad pa dang / log pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag par bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: unclarity, corruption, and various kinds of error that the establishment of consciousness only is explained.

original: der gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad par smra ba'i rnams ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: der gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad par smra ba'i rnams ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Those who speak of difference and non-difference, of the specific and general characteristics as different and non-different, are mistaken.

original: ji ltar ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams kyis spyi ni tha dad par rtog go //
analyzed: ji ltar ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams kyis spyi ni tha dad par rtog go //
translated: Just as the NaiyƒÅyikas and Vaisheshikas conceive of universals as different,

original: grangs can rnams kyis ni tha mi dad par ro //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyis ni tha mi dad par ro //
translated: the Samkhyas conceive of them as non-different.

original: ksha pa na ka dang dpyod pa can rnams ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang / gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rtog go //
analyzed: ksha pa na ka dang dpyod pa can rnams ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang / gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rtog go //
translated: The KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´yas and the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas imagine that the self has a nature that is neither different nor non-different from the characteristics of the general and particular.

original: sgra pa rnams ni bdag gi shes pa yod par ro //
analyzed: sgra pa rnams ni bdag gi shes pa yod par ro //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine that the self is the object of the knowledge of the self.

original: tshangs par smra ba rnams kyis ni gnyis su med par rtog go //
analyzed: tshangs par smra ba rnams kyis ni gnyis su med par rtog go //
translated: The BrahmavƒÅdins imagine that the self is non-dual.

original: zhi ba pa rnams ni 'jig rten ni zhib pa'i mthu can du rtog go //
analyzed: zhi ba pa rnams ni 'jig rten ni zhib pa'i mthu can du rtog go //
translated: The ≈öƒÅ·πÖkaras imagine that the self is the power of the subtle world.

original: gtogs 'dod pa rnams ni gtogs 'dod pa rnams kyi bar ro //
analyzed: gtogs 'dod pa rnams ni gtogs 'dod pa rnams kyi bar ro //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine that the self is the substance of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: gnyis su smra ba po de dag gi shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don du bslad pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su smra ba po de dag gi shes pa ni phyi rol gyi don du bslad pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of those who speak dualistically is the form of the self that is polluted by external objects.

original: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams ni 'jig rten mtha' dag gi chud pa rnams la rtag pa dang / gcig pu par sgro 'dogs so //
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams ni 'jig rten mtha' dag gi chud pa rnams la rtag pa dang / gcig pu par sgro 'dogs so //
translated: The non-dualists superimpose the self on all the parts of the world, imagining it to be permanent and unitary.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi khyad par ni sems can rnams kyi chud pa skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung zhing mang ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi khyad par ni sems can rnams kyi chud pa skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung zhing mang ba ste /
translated: The difference of the Buddhists is that the destruction of sentient beings occurs in a stream of instants, and is manifold.

original: 'khor ba dang / thar pa'i rim pas nor pa dang / nor pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / thar pa'i rim pas nor pa dang / nor pa med pa rnams so //
translated: [The difference] is due to the order of cyclic existence and liberation, and to error and non-error.

original: nam nang 'khrugs te mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba'i gzugs dang / rab rib kyi rang bzhin ltar thun mong du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nam nang 'khrugs te mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba'i gzugs dang / rab rib kyi rang bzhin ltar thun mong du skyes pa'o //
translated: [The difference] is like the common occurrence of internal disturbances, such as dizziness and fainting, and the nature of cataracts.

original: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo kun brtags pa khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par phye ba na de'i tshe bsam pa med cing @199a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo kun brtags pa khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par phye ba na de'i tshe bsam pa med cing @199a * //
translated: When the external is divided into gross and subtle, imagined as houses, armies, forests, and so on, then at that time, without thought,

original: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud yang dag par rig cing brjod du med pa gnyis kyi rnam par ma skyes kyang rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud yang dag par rig cing brjod du med pa gnyis kyi rnam par ma skyes kyang rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: without appearance, the ultimate truth, which is the characteristic of non-duality, is known and inexpressible. Although not born in two aspects, it is conceptualized.

original: der ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa dang / phyi rol dang / nang dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / brjod pa dang /
analyzed: der ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa dang / phyi rol dang / nang dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / brjod pa dang /
translated: There, the conventions of the two types, permanent and impermanent, produced and external, internal, apprehender, apprehended, action, agent, generated, generator, expression,

original: rjod pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad nyid mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rjod pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad nyid mi snang ngo //
translated: and expressed, and so on, do not appear.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi sbom po la sogs par don thams cad du rnam par rtog pa ni snang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi sbom po la sogs par don thams cad du rnam par rtog pa ni snang ngo //
translated: In the nonconceptual wisdom of things and nonthings, the conceptualization of all objects as permanent, single, self, external, gross, and so on appears.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis me tog pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi mdzes pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams phyi rol gyi dngos po gnyis kyi med pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis me tog pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi mdzes pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams phyi rol gyi dngos po gnyis kyi med pa la 'jug go //
translated: The conceptualizations of ≈õrƒÅvakas of flowers, suffering, ugliness, and so on engage external things as nondual.

original: des na rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams don dam pa mi gnyis pa la tha dad pa'i rnam par mi snang ngo //
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams don dam pa mi gnyis pa la tha dad pa'i rnam par mi snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the conceptual thoughts of permanence, impermanence, compounded, uncompounded, and so on do not appear as different in the ultimate nonduality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por ma skyes so //üîΩdes ni rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por ma skyes so // des ni rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: Also, the dependent nature is not produced as an entity of apprehender and apprehended because it lacks the nature of production, like a dream, an illusion, blurred vision, a reflection, and so on.üîΩTherefore it is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /üîΩ'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin / 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not impermanent.üîΩIt is not compounded.

original: 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin /üîΩskyes pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin / skyes pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not uncompounded.üîΩIt is not produced.

original: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not unproduced.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As it says in the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba de ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig go zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, ‚Äòcompounded‚Äô and ‚Äòuncompounded‚Äô are terms designated by the Teacher.‚Äù

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs ltar 'dus byas su dpyad pa'am /üîΩ'dus ma byas su yang rung ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs ltar 'dus byas su dpyad pa'am / 'dus ma byas su yang rung ste /
translated: It is like an illusory form, whether analyzed as compounded or uncompounded.

original: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not created by anyone, such as the sense faculties.üîΩWhether the TathƒÅgatas have appeared

original: de bzhin gshegs /üîΩpa rnams byung yang rung /üîΩma byung yang rung ste /üîΩde bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa yin no //üîΩdes na 'dus byas skad cig ma'i rgyun 'byung ba yang /üîΩdmigs bya dmigs dang bral bar ni //üîΩgang tshe @199b 'dus byas mthong ba na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs / pa rnams byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung ste / de bzhin nyid dang chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa yin no // des na 'dus byas skad cig ma'i rgyun 'byung ba yang / dmigs bya dmigs dang bral bar ni // gang tshe @199b 'dus byas mthong ba na //
translated: or not,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi sems mthong ba //üîΩde tshe 'jig par mi byed do //üîΩde bas na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes so zhes de skad du gsungs pa'o //üîΩgzhan pa dang gzhan ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis smra ba po rnams kyi ye shes mang ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi sems mthong ba //üîΩde tshe 'jig par mi byed do //üîΩde bas na de kho na nyid kyi ye shes so zhes de skad du gsungs pa'o //üîΩgzhan pa dang gzhan ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis smra ba po rnams kyi ye shes mang ste /

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de ci yang mi dmigs pa de na ngas rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag go zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de ci yang mi dmigs pa de na ngas rnam par rig pa tsam du rnam par gzhag go zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi yod pa dang / med pa'i yang gzung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir shes pas shin tu mi dmigs te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi yod pa dang / med pa'i yang gzung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir shes pas shin tu mi dmigs te /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúneither existent nor non-existent,‚Äù etc., external objects are not apprehended by consciousness, because the nature of the apprehended object does not exist.

original: shes pa dang shes par bya ba dus mnyam pas na phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes par bya ba dus mnyam pas na phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since consciousness and the object of consciousness are simultaneous, there is no object that is benefited and no object that benefits.

original: dus tha dad pa na yang 'brel pa med pas gang gi tshe na gcig yod pa de'i tshe na gnyis med na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po /
analyzed: dus tha dad pa na yang 'brel pa med pas gang gi tshe na gcig yod pa de'i tshe na gnyis med na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po /
translated: Since there is no relation when they are different, if one exists at a certain time, the other does not exist at that time. Therefore, the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject

original: su'i yin / des na bskyed pa dang / skyed pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
analyzed: su'i yin / des na bskyed pa dang / skyed pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
translated: is not tenable.

original: shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por mi rtog pas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dag gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por mi rtog pas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Since consciousness and the object of consciousness are not conceptualized as the entities of subject and object, they are not subject and object.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ste khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par mthong zhing mi dmigs pa de'i tshe stong pa nyid la mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ste khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par mthong zhing mi dmigs pa de'i tshe stong pa nyid la mtshan mar mi 'dzin te /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, the gross and subtle parts of the directions are distinguished, and the house, the army, the forest, etc. are seen as empty and not observed, then one does not grasp emptiness as a sign.

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas kyang sems kyis mi smon te /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas kyang sems kyis mi smon te /
translated: And since one does not grasp it as a sign, one does not wish for it with the mind.

original: de de bzhin du rnam par thar pa'i sgo la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de de bzhin du rnam par thar pa'i sgo la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Thus, one enters into the concentration of the door of liberation.

original: de bzhin du yang chos dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir chags pa med pa'i phyir 'dzungs pa spangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang chos dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir chags pa med pa'i phyir 'dzungs pa spangs te /
translated: Similarly, one enters into the concentration of the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons, and abandons the grasping of permanence, self, and mine, because one is free from attachment.

original: de sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir 'jug go //
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir 'jug go //
translated: One enters for the sake of the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis mchog gi rab tu dga' ba'i sa thob nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyis mchog gi rab tu dga' ba'i sa thob nas tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la gnas so //
translated: Having attained the stage of Supreme Joy through the accumulations of merit and wisdom, he abides in the stainless stage of the bodhisattva through the purity of the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par gyur pa dang / 'od byed pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems la bzod @200a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag par gyur pa dang / 'od byed pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa'i sems la bzod @200a * //
translated: Having become pure in the perfection of morality, he is patient with the intention to benefit all beings on the stage of Luminous,

original: cing chos mngon par rtogs pa'i mngon par shes pa la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: cing chos mngon par rtogs pa'i mngon par shes pa la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: and he engages in the superknowledges that are the realization of the Dharma.

original: 'od 'phro ba la ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag ste /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba la ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag ste /
translated: On the stage of Radiant, the perfection of effort is pure,

original: chos mngon par rtogs pa'i spro ba la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: chos mngon par rtogs pa'i spro ba la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: and he engages in the enthusiasm for realizing the Dharma.

original: shin tu dka' rgyal du ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa yongs su zad par bya ba'i don du bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: shin tu dka' rgyal du ni sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa yongs su zad par bya ba'i don du bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: On the stage of Difficult to Conquer, he enters the meditative absorptions for the sake of exhausting the afflictions in order to benefit all beings.

original: mngon du song ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad phye nas nam mi dmigs pa de na zab mo'i chos la 'jug pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la lugs dang lugs ma yin par 'jug go //
analyzed: mngon du song ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad phye nas nam mi dmigs pa de na zab mo'i chos la 'jug pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la lugs dang lugs ma yin par 'jug go //
translated: The stage of gone-afar is the stage of entering into the profound Dharma, because one enters into dependent origination in forward and reverse orders, having analyzed with wisdom and not observed any coarse or subtle aspects of things.

original: ring du song ba ni de bzhin du khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnams la snyoms par 'jug cing /üîΩthabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: ring du song ba ni de bzhin du khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos rnams la snyoms par 'jug cing / thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The stage of far-gone is the stage of entering into the Dharma of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, because one enters into the Dharma of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment in forward and reverse orders, having analyzed with wisdom and not observed any coarse or subtle aspects of things.

original: mi g-yo ba ni gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: The stage of immovable is the stage of perfecting the perfection of skillful means, because one perfects the perfection of skillful means for the sake of others.üîΩThe stage of excellent wisdom is the stage of perfecting the perfection of aspiration, because one perfects the perfection of aspiration for the sake of others.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar stong zhing bar du gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul lta bur gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba ni byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel pa med cing snga ma'i 'og tu gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma rgyun dngos po dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar stong zhing bar du gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul lta bur gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba ni byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel pa med cing snga ma'i 'og tu gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma rgyun dngos po dang /
translated: Dependent origination is empty of a beginning and end, and in the middle it is empty of the nature of duality. Like a dream or an illusion, it arises in the aspect of duality, but it is not related to an agent or an instrument.üîΩAfter the previous moment, the subsequent moment is not a thing or a non-thing. It is nonconceptual, inconceivable, and nonapparent. It is the nondual ultimate truth.

original: dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog cing bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog cing bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa la 'jug go //
translated: Awakening is the entry into the correct understanding of that.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs nas chos ston to //
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs nas chos ston to //
translated: Awakening is the arousing of the latent tendencies of compassion. It is the teaching of the Dharma by abiding in samƒÅdhi that is accompanied by appearances.

original: legs pa'i blo gros la ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba shes nas chos ston cing stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros la ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba shes nas chos ston cing stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: On the ground of Perfect Understanding, the bodhisattva attains the four kinds of perfect knowledge, and by teaching the Dharma in accordance with the dispositions and aspirations of beings, he perfects the paramita of strength.

original: chos kyi sprin du ni chos ma lus par rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin du ni chos ma lus par rdzogs pa ste /
translated: On the Cloud of Dharma ground, he perfects all the qualities of buddhahood.

original: chu chen po'i sprin lta bur sangs rgyas kyi chos bdud rtsi'i char pas 'jig rten sim par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pas dbang bskur zhing dar la srab mos g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i @200b dkyil 'khor mtha' dag shes te /
analyzed: chu chen po'i sprin lta bur sangs rgyas kyi chos bdud rtsi'i char pas 'jig rten sim par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pas dbang bskur zhing dar la srab mos g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i @200b dkyil 'khor mtha' dag shes te /
translated: Like a great rain cloud, he satisfies the world with the nectar rain of the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma. He is anointed with the water of omniscience and is clothed in the fine silk of the realization of the entire mandala of knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i bag chas mnyam par 'jog pa med pas sa bcur spong bar byas pa spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i bag chas mnyam par 'jog pa med pas sa bcur spong bar byas pa spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: And because he is free from the obscurations of the negative tendencies of the ignorance of the absence of afflictions and the absence of absorption, he has eliminated all the factors to be eliminated on the ten grounds.

original: thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has become omniscient.

original: mthong pa'i lam ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sar skye ste /
analyzed: mthong pa'i lam ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sar skye ste /
translated: The path of seeing arises in the stage of The Utterly Joyful One because one attains meditative stabilization in the no-self of phenomena and the no-self of persons.

original: 'dungs  pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs shing /
analyzed: 'dungs  pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs shing /
translated: One abandons the afflictions of the summit of existence and so forth,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na nyan thos rnams las khyad par du phye ba rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na nyan thos rnams las khyad par du phye ba rnams so //
translated: and one perfects the transcendent perfections of generosity and so forth.

original: tshul ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bstan pa'i tshul ni snang ba tsam gyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: tshul ni rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bstan pa'i tshul ni snang ba tsam gyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The way is twofold and so forth. The way of teaching is the pristine awareness that has the aspect of the two, appearance and emptiness.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sku dang / so sor snang ba mtshan nyid kyi cho 'phrul dang / dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don du 'byed pa'i sa'i khyad par tha dad pa'i thabs sna tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sku dang / so sor snang ba mtshan nyid kyi cho 'phrul dang / dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don du 'byed pa'i sa'i khyad par tha dad pa'i thabs sna tshogs pa dang /
translated: The way of practice is the accumulation of generosity and so forth, the body of meditative stabilization with appearance, the magical manifestation of the characteristics of individual appearance, the ma·πá·∏çala of sound, and the various methods of the different stages that are distinguished for the benefit of oneself and others.

original: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Likewise, the appearance of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, thirty-seven factors of awakening, ten powers, four forms of fearlessness, and so on, in dualistic form is the mode of teaching.

original: grub pa'i mtha' so sor bzhag pa'i tshul ni nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs nas mi dmigs pa de ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnal 'byor pa rnams la gnas so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' so sor bzhag pa'i tshul ni nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs nas mi dmigs pa de ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i byang chub rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rnal 'byor pa rnams la gnas so //
translated: The mode of positing the individual tenets is as follows: When analyzed by wisdom, the coarse and subtle are dissected and not observed. That is the inconceivable, non-appearing ultimate truth, non-dual awakening, naturally luminous, for the yogis.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa ni spyi'i rnam par de'i chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa ni spyi'i rnam par de'i chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The omniscient one dwelling in the samƒÅdhi with appearance generally teaches the Dharma in that form.

original: bde bar 'dzin cing chud par bya ba'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bde bar 'dzin cing chud par bya ba'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In order to hold and understand the bliss, the Omniscient One has summarized the teachings in verses.üîΩMy system is twofold:

original: nga yi tshul ni rnam gnyis te //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' dang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga yi tshul ni rnam gnyis te // grub pa'i mtha' dang bstan pa'o //
translated: The philosophical system and the teachings.

original: byis pa rnams la brjod pa bshad //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la brjod pa bshad //
translated: The teachings are explained to the childish,

original: rnal 'byor can la grub mtha'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can la grub mtha'o //
translated: The philosophical system to the yogis.

original: 'jug pa'i rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pas chos ston pa ni gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pas chos ston pa ni gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One teaches the Dharma through the stages of engagement, which are twofold: non-dual and dual.

original: gcig dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga @201a * //
analyzed: gcig dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga @201a * //
translated: The non-dual is free from the extremes of one, different, both, and neither.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: ma yin pa'i phyogs dang / bral ba zhes pa ni mu stegs can gnyis dang / mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa gcig pa kun rtog par byed pa ni ji ltar rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra bas /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyogs dang / bral ba zhes pa ni mu stegs can gnyis dang / mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa gcig pa kun rtog par byed pa ni ji ltar rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra bas /
translated: The non-dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.üîΩThe dual is free from the extremes of the two extremes of eternal

original: 'di thams cad tshangs pa zhi ba yin pas na bstan par bya'o zhes pa de dag la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad tshangs pa zhi ba yin pas na bstan par bya'o zhes pa de dag la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the error of sameness would follow for those who are liberated, those who are not liberated, the wealthy, the poor, and so on.

original: gzhan dag grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams kyis 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba tha dad pas gnyi gar 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams kyis 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba tha dad pas gnyi gar 'dod de /
translated: Others, such as the Samkhyas, the Aul≈´kyas, and the Vaisheshikas, assert both the apprehender and the apprehended to be different.

original: de dag gi de kho na nyid nyi shu lnga dang / tshig gi don bcu drug dang / drug yod do //
analyzed: de dag gi de kho na nyid nyi shu lnga dang / tshig gi don bcu drug dang / drug yod do //
translated: They have twenty-five principles, sixteen categories, and six categories.

original: gnyis pa ni ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can rnams tha dad pa dang / mi dad par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can rnams tha dad pa dang / mi dad par rtog par byed de /
translated: The second is the Kashmiri Vaisheshikas and the NaiyƒÅyikas, who conceive of difference and nondifference.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa thams cad rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa dang / des na gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa thams cad rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa dang / des na gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang /
translated: Because external things do not exist, all consciousnesses that have dualistic appearances are like dreams, illusions, cataracts, reflections, and so on. They are not produced. Therefore, they are not dual, nor are they nondual.

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par brtag go //
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par brtag go //
translated: Because external things do not exist, all consciousnesses that have the aspect of duality are like dreams, illusions, cataracts, reflections, and so on. They are not produced. Therefore, all conceptual thoughts, such as duality, nonduality, both, neither, production, nonproduction, and so on, are conceptualized in consciousness that has the aspect of duality.

original: sems can gang dag la bslad pa yod pa de dag thams cad 'jig rten rgyang pan par smra ba lhung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la bslad pa yod pa de dag thams cad 'jig rten rgyang pan par smra ba lhung ngo //
translated: All sentient beings who have this error fall into the teaching of the LokƒÅyatas.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni shes pa phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa ni shes pa phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: The LokƒÅyatas have a distorted understanding.

original: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa rnams la ma rig pa'i mthus sems can rnams rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por yongs su shes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa rnams la ma rig pa'i mthus sems can rnams rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por yongs su shes so //
translated: Through the power of ignorance, sentient beings understand things as permanent, a self, blissful, and pure, in regard to impermanence, selflessness, impurity, suffering, and emptiness.

original: des na mu stegs byed rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol dang / gnyis pa la sogs pa smra pa rnams kyis ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i log pa'i shes pa thams cad ston to //
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol dang / gnyis pa la sogs pa smra pa rnams kyis ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i log pa'i shes pa thams cad ston to //
translated: Therefore, all the wrong views of the LokƒÅyatas are taught by the tƒ´rthikas who propound permanence, unity, a self, external things, duality, and so on.

original: de'i phyir de dag la 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa /
translated: Therefore, the noble MahƒÅmati asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'jig rten rgyang pan nyid kyang ston tam zhes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang 'jig rten rgyang pan nyid kyang ston tam zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, do you also teach the LokƒÅyatas?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: blo gros chen po nga ni 'jig rten rgyang pan mi 'chad de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po nga ni 'jig rten rgyang pan mi 'chad de /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, I do not teach the LokƒÅyatas.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'du ba dang zad pa ma yin @201b gyi zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du ba dang zad pa ma yin @201b gyi zhes pa ste /
translated: Not in terms of accumulation and exhaustion.‚Äù

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la byed pa dang / byed pa po 'brel par rtogs pas 'du ba dang zad pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la byed pa dang / byed pa po 'brel par rtogs pas 'du ba dang zad pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan pa rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The cognition of the two aspects is the agent, and the cognition of the connection between the agent and the action is the conjunction. The cognition of the aspects of exhaustion and of the object of exhaustion is the cognition of the object of exhaustion. The cognition of the aspects of origination, duration, cessation, and so on is the cognition of other phenomena.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis mi gnyis pa brjod du med pa yang dag par rig pa la lung ston pa la sogs pa rtag pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos lhag pa rnams med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis mi gnyis pa brjod du med pa yang dag par rig pa la lung ston pa la sogs pa rtag pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos lhag pa rnams med do //
translated: But in the case of the inexpressible non-duality of the stream of moments, there is no other phenomenon such as origination, destruction, and so on, which is permanent.

original: de bas byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / mngon par 'bral ba dang bral bar byed pa med pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bas byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / mngon par 'bral ba dang bral bar byed pa med pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, dependent origination, which is devoid of agent, action, and object, does not occur.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod ces bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod ces bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is only said that this exists after that in the past.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni btags pa'i chos so //
translated: The so-called cause and effect are imputed phenomena.

original: mu stegs byed rnams kyi rtag pa ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa /
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams kyi rtag pa ni rgyu med pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa /
translated: The eternal of the tƒ´rthikas does not exist, like the son of a barren woman, because it has no cause.

original: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa rtag cing gcig pa rnams rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa rtag cing gcig pa rnams rgyu ma yin te /
translated: BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, etc., are not the cause of the eternal and one,

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not born, like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: dngos po med par yang rtag pa dang / gcig pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med par yang rtag pa dang / gcig pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: Also, the eternal and one are not tenable as non-things,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a donkey, etc.

original: gcig la du mar mi rigs te /
analyzed: gcig la du mar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that one is many,

original: gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / grang ba dang / me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / grang ba dang / me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like form, formlessness, cold, fire, etc.

original: gnyi gar smra bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnyi gar smra bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable to speak of both,

original: phyi rol gyi don med pas 'dzin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pas 'dzin pa med pa ste /
translated: because there is no apprehension without external objects.

original: des tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams kyis slu ba dang / slu ba med par nges par gzhag pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams kyis slu ba dang / slu ba med par nges par gzhag pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of deception and non-deception by the words of valid cognition, the cognized, etc., is like a dream, an illusion, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba'i tshig rnams rtag par yang shes pa so sor snang ba las ma gtogs pa dngos po med pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan par smra ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba'i tshig rnams rtag par yang shes pa so sor snang ba las ma gtogs pa dngos po med pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan par smra ba mi rung ngo //
translated: The words of the external elements are also not suitable to be the LokƒÅyata because they are not things that exist apart from the appearance of individual consciousnesses.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ni yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung ni yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind are real,üîΩand feelings arise from them.

original: de dag las tshor bar 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag las tshor bar 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: This is not suitable.

original: 'byung ba sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na /
analyzed: 'byung ba sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na /
