translated: When gross and subtle elements are distinguished,

original: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //üîΩkla pa na ka dang / dpyod pa pa rnams kyi tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par smra ba yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do // kla pa na ka dang / dpyod pa pa rnams kyi tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par smra ba yang mi rung ste /
translated: they are empty like houses, armies, forests, and so on.

original: rang bzhin gcig la rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir yod par @202a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig la rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir yod par @202a * //
translated: The LokƒÅyata‚Äôs assertion of difference and nondifference is also not suitable because two natures do not exist in a single nature.

original: gyur pa dang / med par gyur pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dag rang bzhin 'gal te /
analyzed: gyur pa dang / med par gyur pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dag rang bzhin 'gal te /
translated: That which exists, that which does not exist, things, and nonthings are mutually exclusive.

original: des na yod kyang yong la med kyang med pa dang / smra bar mi bya ba de dag kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na yod kyang yong la med kyang med pa dang / smra bar mi bya ba de dag kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: and it is not right to say that it is not to be spoken of.

original: de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis kar yang 'gal ba gcig tu smra bar mi bya ba'i rang bzhin yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis kar yang 'gal ba gcig tu smra bar mi bya ba'i rang bzhin yang mi rung ngo //
translated: In the same way, it is not right to say that it is both existent and nonexistent, because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive.

original: theg pa chen po la dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i don dam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i don dam pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate truth in the Mahayana, which is free from the conceptualization of existence and nonexistence?

original: de la byis pas dngos po dang / dngos por brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
analyzed: de la byis pas dngos po dang / dngos por brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
translated: The childlike, having abandoned the conceptualization of existence and the conceptualization of nonexistence,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa don dam pa rtogs nas de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas gnyis su med par spyi'i rnam par ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa don dam pa rtogs nas de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas gnyis su med par spyi'i rnam par ston pa mdzad do //
translated: realizes the ultimate truth, which is the natural luminosity of the mind, and in that way the Omniscient One teaches the nondual general characteristic.

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du bka' stsal pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: blo gros chen por ni mu stegs byed thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i nang du gtogs par mi 'chad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen por ni mu stegs byed thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i nang du gtogs par mi 'chad do zhes pa'o //
translated: Great intellect, I do not explain that [the Buddha] is included among the conceptualizations of all the tƒ´rthikas.

original: ji ltar na yang bde bar gshegs pa'i blo'i khyad par bya zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang bde bar gshegs pa'i blo'i khyad par bya zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: How then is the distinction of the Sugata's intellect to be expressed? Having had such doubts, the Omniscient One declared:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa la ma chags shing rang gi sems snang ba tsam la gnas pa dang / 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis su med par rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa dang / mtshan ma'i spyod yul med pa dang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa la ma chags shing rang gi sems snang ba tsam la gnas pa dang / 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis su med par rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa dang / mtshan ma'i spyod yul med pa dang /
translated: not attached to external things and non-things, abiding in mere appearances of one's own mind, the non-engagement of conceptualization in the non-duality of engagement, the absence of an objective domain of signs,

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go zhes pa ste /
translated: and the non-engagement of conceptualization in the mere appearance of one's own mind.

original: des na mu stegs byed gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par smra ba rnams las thams cad mkhyen pas rang gi blo'i khyad par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis par smra ba rnams las thams cad mkhyen pas rang gi blo'i khyad par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One declared the distinction of his own intellect from the non-dualists and the dualists among the tƒ´rthikas.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pas grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams las bde bar gshegs pa'i blo'i khyad par du phye ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pas grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams las bde bar gshegs pa'i blo'i khyad par du phye ba'o //
translated: The Sugata's mind is distinguished from the realists, the Samkhyas, the Ajivikas, the Vaisheshikas, the Kashyapa Sarvastivadins, the Naiyayikas, and the Lokayatas.

original: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par dbye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par dbye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur te /
translated: When gross external objects are divided into different directional parts, they become empty like a house, an army, a forest, etc.

original: des na phyi rol gyi don med do //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi don med do //
translated: Therefore, external objects do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe na dmigs par bya ba de mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rang gi sems nor pa las grol bas mi gnyis pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun yang @202b dag par khong du chud par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na dmigs par bya ba de mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rang gi sems nor pa las grol bas mi gnyis pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun yang @202b dag par khong du chud par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When the object of perception is not perceived, then, liberated from the error of mind, one realizes the continuum of the moments of non-duality.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin la rtag pa dang gcig pa dang / bdag de dag gi ngo bo nyid khong du chud par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin la rtag pa dang gcig pa dang / bdag de dag gi ngo bo nyid khong du chud par ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not understand the nature of all sentient beings as permanent and unitary.

original: de'i phyir mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyi grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyi grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, for the proponents of non-duality, the error would arise that liberation and non-liberation, wealth and poverty, etc. are the same.

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med pa'o //
translated: The permanent does not exist, like the son of a barren woman, because it is not produced.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung ba chud pa rnams ni mang ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung ba chud pa rnams ni mang ste /
translated: The Sugatas have many moments that arise in a stream.

original: dag pa'i dus na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: dag pa'i dus na dngos po dang dngos po med pa'am /
translated: In the pure state, they become things and non-things,

original: mi rtog cing bsam pa med pa snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtog cing bsam pa med pa snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: non-conceptual, non-imaginative, non-apparent, ultimate truths, and non-dual moments.

original: des na mu stegs byed rnams kyi ltar rtag pa dang / mi gcig par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed rnams kyi ltar rtag pa dang / mi gcig par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, like the tƒ´rthikas, it is not suitable to be permanent and non-unitary.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i chud pa rnams kyi khyad par ni 'khor ba'i dus su sdug bsngal tha dad pa du mas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i chud pa rnams kyi khyad par ni 'khor ba'i dus su sdug bsngal tha dad pa du mas phye ba yin no //
translated: The difference among the perfected Buddhas is due to the different varieties of suffering in the time of cyclic existence.

original: grol ba'i dus ni sdug bsngal zhi las grol zhing rab zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol ba'i dus ni sdug bsngal zhi las grol zhing rab zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis khyad par rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the time of liberation, they are liberated from the pacification of suffering and are distinguished by the samƒÅdhi of complete pacification.

original: de bzhin du yang gnas tha dad pa phye ba na shing dang / thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du gcig par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gnas tha dad pa phye ba na shing dang / thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du gcig par mi rung ngo //
translated: In the same way, when distinguished by different locations, they cannot be one, like a tree, ashes, and so on.

original: des na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i snang ba med pa'i sgo la zhugs pa gzhan gyi don du thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i snang ba med pa'i sgo la zhugs pa gzhan gyi don du thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, having entered the door of the signless, wishless, and empty gates of liberation, they abide in the samƒÅdhi of the omniscience of others, together with the appearance.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las grub pa'i mthar 'jug pa'i le'u phran bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las grub pa'i mthar 'jug pa'i le'u phran bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eleventh minor chapter in the glorious ‚ÄúEntry into Lanka‚Äù composed by the ƒÅrya, the glorious ≈ö≈´ra.

original: // / ngas mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa las dus gcig na 'jig rten rgyang pa na pas gsol pa ste /
analyzed: // / ngas mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa las dus gcig na 'jig rten rgyang pa na pas gsol pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning I, having directly perceived and so on is the question of the Lokayata to the Omniscient One.

original: kye goo'u ta ma thams cad ni byas pa'o //üîΩblo gros chen po ngas de la 'di skad ces byas so //
analyzed: kye goo'u ta ma thams cad ni byas pa'o // blo gros chen po ngas de la 'di skad ces byas so //
translated: O Gautama, all is created.

original: kye bram ze gal te thams cad byas she na ;
analyzed: kye bram ze gal te thams cad byas she na ;
translated: MahƒÅmati, I said to him, O Brahmin, if all is created,

original: 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang pan dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten rgyang pan dang po'o //
translated: this is the first Lokayata.

original: der thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa cir brtag ce na /
analyzed: der thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa cir brtag ce na /
translated: What is the intention of the Omniscient One in this regard?

original: 'jig rten du bya ba dang / byed pa la mngon par 'brel te /
analyzed: 'jig rten du bya ba dang / byed pa la mngon par 'brel te /
translated: In the world, action and agent are connected.

original: ye shes byas pa dang de las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: ye shes byas pa dang de las 'byung zhing /
translated: Knowledge is created and arises from that,

original: rtag pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: and arises from the permanent.

original: chos rnams ni sus kyang mi byed de /üîΩsnga ma'i @203a * //
analyzed: chos rnams ni sus kyang mi byed de / snga ma'i @203a * //
translated: No one creates phenomena.üîΩAfter the previous, this exists.

original: 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: This is merely said.

original: de chos su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de chos su brtags pa'o //
translated: That is the imputation of phenomena.

original: rgyu med cing ma byas pa'i rtag pa ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu med cing ma byas pa'i rtag pa ni mi rung ste /
translated: The permanent, which is causeless and uncreated, is not tenable.

original: dngos po med pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of things, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig pa la tha dad par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig pa la tha dad par mi rung ste /
translated: In the same way, it is not possible to distinguish impermanence and so on in momentary things.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa rnams klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa rnams klog pa /
translated: As the noble MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghikas recite:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can they be unstable and not creators?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: That which arises is the creator itself.

original: byed pa po yang der brjod do //
analyzed: byed pa po yang der brjod do //
translated: The creator is also said to be that.

original: ji ltar bar ti ka las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar bar ti ka las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the BƒÅrtikas:

original: de yi cung zad yod pa min //
analyzed: de yi cung zad yod pa min //
translated: It has no existence at all.

original: med par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ste //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ste //
translated: It is only nonexistence.

original: dngos po la de rnam rtog 'gyur //üîΩtshul ni dngos po rjes thogs phyir //
analyzed: dngos po la de rnam rtog 'gyur // tshul ni dngos po rjes thogs phyir //
translated: It is a conceptualization of things.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The method is because of the subsequent existence of things.

original: des na skad cig pa la skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa gzhan dag yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: des na skad cig pa la skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa gzhan dag yod par mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for other things such as arising and cessation to exist in momentary things.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs can gyi thams cad rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par zhes par rnam par rtog pa rnams ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs can gyi thams cad rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par zhes par rnam par rtog pa rnams ni mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô conceptual thoughts that everything is permanent, unitary, both, or neither are untenable.

original: de lta bur ni sngar bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur ni sngar bsal ba'o //
translated: That is refuted above.

original: thams cad bskyed pa dang skyed pa ma yin zhes pa ni brjod du med pa'i skad cig pa la skyed pa la sogs pa'i lhag pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: thams cad bskyed pa dang skyed pa ma yin zhes pa ni brjod du med pa'i skad cig pa la skyed pa la sogs pa'i lhag pa mi rigs te /
translated: ‚ÄúEverything is produced or not produced‚Äù is untenable as a remainder in the production of the inexpressible moment.

original: de de bzhin du byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag ma yin pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gnas ngan len pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las skyes pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rab tu 'jug gi / gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod
analyzed: de de bzhin du byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag ma yin pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa la sogs pa so sor snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gnas ngan len pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las skyes pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rab tu 'jug gi / gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod
translated: That is done in that way, not done in that way, permanent, impermanent, a self, not a self, momentary, not momentary, and so on. The conceptual thought that appears individually engages a consciousness that has a dualistic aspect that arises from the ripening of the latent tendencies of negative propensities.üîΩThe continuum of the nondual moment is expressed as ‚Äúeverything is produced or not produced.‚Äù

original: du med pa'i yang dag par rig pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du med pa'i yang dag par rig pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the correct knowledge of the ultimate, which is not manifold.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rang gis yang dag par rig pa der ni skad cig gi rnam par rtog pa ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rang gis yang dag par rig pa der ni skad cig gi rnam par rtog pa ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: In that correct knowledge of the own-character, the conceptualization of momentariness does not occur.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub par byed pa /
translated: As ƒÄcƒÅrya Dharmottara proves:

original: bde la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: bde la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: The nature of pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan du mi rten 'brel mi nus //
analyzed: gzhan du mi rten 'brel mi nus //
translated: cannot be related to something else, because it is not possible to be related to something else.

original: de phyir de dag rang rig ni //
analyzed: de phyir de dag rang rig ni //
translated: Therefore, their self-awareness

original: mngon par brjod dang 'brel pa med //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par brjod dang 'brel pa med // ces pa ste /
translated: is not related to verbalization.

original: des na rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma'i rgyun rnam par rtog pa yang dag par rig pa ni bstan mi nus te /
analyzed: des na rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma'i rgyun rnam par rtog pa yang dag par rig pa ni bstan mi nus te /
translated: Thus, the continuum of moments of the own-character cannot be taught, because the conceptualization of the correct knowledge is not possible.

original: spyi'i rnam par brtags pa'i don ni thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar song ba mngon du bya ste /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par brtags pa'i don ni thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar song ba mngon du bya ste /
translated: The object that is generally imagined is manifested as going to the end of the beginning and end.

original: skad cig pa la @203b sogs pa'i sgra yang 'jug gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig la ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa la @203b sogs pa'i sgra yang 'jug gi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig la ma yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúmomentary,‚Äù etc., are used, but not for the moment of the own-character.

original: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i thams cad skad cig pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa der bde bar gshegs pa dang bde bar gshegs pa ma yin pa mang po rnams nor par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i thams cad skad cig pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa der bde bar gshegs pa dang bde bar gshegs pa ma yin pa mang po rnams nor par zhugs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Lokayatas are mistaken in their belief that everything is momentary and that there is no omniscience.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pas ni skad cig mar 'jig pa'i dngos po med do zhes pa la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pas ni skad cig mar 'jig pa'i dngos po med do zhes pa la /
translated: Since things are essenceless, like reflections and so forth, there are no momentary things that disintegrate.

original: ji lta bur so sor snang ba la de ltar skad cig pa rnams te /
analyzed: ji lta bur so sor snang ba la de ltar skad cig pa rnams te /
translated: In accordance with the way in which things appear, they are momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra bzhin du snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus gnas tha dad pa bral ba yin te /
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra bzhin du snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus gnas tha dad pa bral ba yin te /
translated: Like the sound of a finger snap, they are devoid of a different location in the prior and subsequent moments.

original: sna tshogs pa ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gcig mi rigs te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gcig mi rigs te /
translated: Since they are manifold, like a house, an army, a forest, and so forth, it is not possible for them to be one.

original: de la gnyis kyi rnam pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi rnam pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are undermined by the two.

original: dngos po gcig pa la mi gnod pa'i phyir ji ltar na grub pa'i rang bzhin med /
analyzed: dngos po gcig pa la mi gnod pa'i phyir ji ltar na grub pa'i rang bzhin med /
translated: Since it is not undermined with respect to a single entity, how could it be established that it is essenceless?

original: der gnyis kyi rnam pa'i stong pa nyid yang dag par rig pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: der gnyis kyi rnam pa'i stong pa nyid yang dag par rig pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The emptiness of duality is the valid cognition of direct perception that is the awareness of reality.

original: gang mi gnyis pa de ni rtag pa zhes mu stegs can la las de ltar rtog pa de yang mi rung ste /üîΩ'khor ba'i dus na chud pa rgyun du sdug bsngal du mas tha dad pas phye ba ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
analyzed: gang mi gnyis pa de ni rtag pa zhes mu stegs can la las de ltar rtog pa de yang mi rung ste / 'khor ba'i dus na chud pa rgyun du sdug bsngal du mas tha dad pas phye ba ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas imagine that nonduality is permanent, but that is not correct.üîΩIf it were permanent, how could it be nondual?üîΩIf it were nondual, how could it be permanent?üîΩIf it were permanent, how could it be nondual?

original: dag pa'i dus na yang sdug bsngal las grol te gnas gzhan pa ste /üîΩde ltar na yang shing dang thal pa la sogs pa bzhin du rim par phye ba na /
analyzed: dag pa'i dus na yang sdug bsngal las grol te gnas gzhan pa ste / de ltar na yang shing dang thal pa la sogs pa bzhin du rim par phye ba na /
translated: If it were nondual, how could it be permanent?üîΩIf it were permanent, how could it be nondual?

original: ji ltar na gcig pu rung /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig pu rung /
translated: If it were nondual, how could it be permanent?

original: la las ni skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid du rtog par byed pa /
analyzed: la las ni skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid du rtog par byed pa /
translated: Some imagine that it is both momentary and not momentary.

original: grang ba dang mel sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gcig la dngos so gnyis zhes pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: grang ba dang mel sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gcig la dngos so gnyis zhes pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not correct to say that a single nature has two aspects, like heat and cold.

original: gzhan dag ni dngos po med pa'i phyir skad cig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dngos po med pa'i phyir skad cig pa yang ma yin /
translated: Others say that it is not momentary because it is not a thing.

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes pa 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes pa 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable to say that it is not momentary.

original: dngos po la ni skad cig pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po la ni skad cig pa med de /
translated: For an entity, there is no momentariness.

original: de'i rang bzhin rtag pa nyid ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rtag pa nyid ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is permanent because it is not a thing that is dual. It is a single nature.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bu'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bu'i 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Like a dream, an illusion, and so on, the conditioned and the unconditioned, the permanent and the impermanent, the momentary and the non-momentary, and the neither momentary nor non-momentary,

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin @204a * //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa yang ma yin @204a * //
translated: are not momentary.

original: pa rnam pa de lta bu ni rmi lam dang / rmi lam ma yin par dngos po tha dad par myong ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: pa rnam pa de lta bu ni rmi lam dang / rmi lam ma yin par dngos po tha dad par myong ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Such things as dreams and non-dreams do not have the nature of experiencing different things.

original: gang de lta bas na ma rig pas glongs te /
analyzed: gang de lta bas na ma rig pas glongs te /
translated: Therefore, due to ignorance,

original: 'khor ba'i dus kyi shes pa thams cad ni bden pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dus kyi shes pa thams cad ni bden pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: all consciousnesses at the time of sa·πÉsƒÅra are not true.

original: gang shes rab kyis dpyad de gnyis kyi rnam pas stong par mthong ba de ni bsam du med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyis dpyad de gnyis kyi rnam pas stong par mthong ba de ni bsam du med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: That which is seen by the wisdom that analyzes it as empty of the two is the inconceivable, the non-appearance, the ultimate truth, the non-dual, the perfectly known.

original: de yang skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa kho na gang gis nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa kho na gang gis nges par 'gyur /
translated: And how is it ascertained that it is momentary or not momentary?

original: mngon sum du myong bas so //
analyzed: mngon sum du myong bas so //
translated: By direct experience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad skad cig pa cis na zhal gyis mi bzhes /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad skad cig pa cis na zhal gyis mi bzhes /
translated: Why does the Omniscient One not accept that everything is momentary?

original: ma dgongs pa'i phyir ro dgongs pa tha dad pas mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni srid pa gzhan du skad cig ma'i mtshan mas sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: ma dgongs pa'i phyir ro dgongs pa tha dad pas mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni srid pa gzhan du skad cig ma'i mtshan mas sbyor ba med do //
translated: Because it is not intended. The eye consciousness, etc. are not connected with the mark of momentariness in another existence by a different intention.

original: sems ni skad cig pa'i rgyud kyis rgyun du srid pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sems ni skad cig pa'i rgyud kyis rgyun du srid pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The mind is connected with another existence by a continuum of moments.

original: se gol gyi sgra skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: The sound of a finger snap is not connected with another moment.

original: des na thams cad skad cig mar thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du mi rtag go //
analyzed: des na thams cad skad cig mar thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du mi rtag go //
translated: Therefore, all things are momentary, in the sense of being intended by the Omniscient One.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i tshul gyis 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i tshul gyis 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa lta bu ste /
translated: [The Buddha] taught the impermanence of all things in the manner of the Sandhinirmocana Sutra, which states that conditioned things are impermanent, and that unconditioned things are not impermanent.

original: chos nyid ye gnas pa de ni dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: chos nyid ye gnas pa de ni dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang mi byed de /
translated: The primordial abiding reality is not created by anyone, such as the sense faculties.

original: 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin pa ni skad cig pa'i rgyud du 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin pa ni skad cig pa'i rgyud du 'dus byas so //
translated: It is not unconditioned, but is conditioned in the continuum of moments.

original: de ltar na thams cad rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du rtag go //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du rtag go //
translated: Thus, all things are permanent, in the sense of being intended by the Omniscient One.

original: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la sgro btags pa'i don thams cad kyi tha snyad 'jug gi mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa rnam par mi rtog pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la sgro btags pa'i don thams cad kyi tha snyad 'jug gi mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa rnam par mi rtog pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: All conventional usage is based on the superimposition of external objects and the superimposition of a dualistic cognition. It is not based on the non-dualistic, momentary, non-conceptual cognition.

original: der spyi'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra'i don gyi tha snyad kyang 'jug go //
analyzed: der spyi'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra'i don gyi tha snyad kyang 'jug go //
translated: In that [non-conceptual cognition], the conventional usage of the term ‚Äúomniscience‚Äù is also based on a universal.

original: de bzhin du sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: In the same way, he practices.

original: kye bram ze nga ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len gyi rgyu las srid pa gsum skyes pas ston te /
analyzed: kye bram ze nga ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros par rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags gnas ngan len gyi rgyu las srid pa gsum skyes pas ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúO Brahmin, I teach that the three existences are born from the cause of the latent tendencies of conceptual thoughts of mental proliferation from beginningless time.

original: bram ze nga ni sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas rnam par rtog pa 'byung gi / phyi rol gyi dngos po dmigs pa las ni ma yin no zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze nga ni sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas rnam par rtog pa 'byung gi / phyi rol gyi dngos po dmigs pa las ni ma yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: O Brahmin, since I have not understood that appearances are mind only, conceptual thoughts arise, but not from the observation of external things.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi don la dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi don la dmigs pa med de /
translated: Apart from the aspect of consciousness, there is no observation of external objects.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las thog ma med pa'i @204b shes pa kun tu skyes pa nyid ni nang glongs shing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa rnam par smin pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis rnam par grol ba snang ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las thog ma med pa'i @204b shes pa kun tu skyes pa nyid ni nang glongs shing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa rnam par smin pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis rnam par grol ba snang ste /
translated: From the power of the ripening of ignorance, which is internal, not concentrated, and not understood, the consciousness that has arisen in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continuums from beginningless time appears as various kinds of liberation, such as dizziness and fainting.

original: de ni rang gi rnam pa la sems can rnams kyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: de ni rang gi rnam pa la sems can rnams kyi tha snyad do //
translated: The conventions of sentient beings are in their own aspects.

original: rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / byas pa dang ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / byas pa dang ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Permanence, oneness, self, mine, both, neither, created, uncreated, permanent, impermanent, momentary, not momentary,

original: skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: arisen, unarisen, and so on‚Äîthese conceptual thoughts engage with dualistic cognition.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi don sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ba na mi dmigs te /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi don sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ba na mi dmigs te /
translated: When analyzed with wisdom, if gross and subtle external objects are distinguished, they are not observed.

original: des na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: des na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: Therefore, without thought and without appearance, the ultimate truth is known nondually.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung yang rang gi mtshan nyid smra bar mi nus te der sgra'i don mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung yang rang gi mtshan nyid smra bar mi nus te der sgra'i don mi 'byung ste /
translated: Although it arises in a continuum of momentary nonconceptuality, it is unable to express its own characteristics, and the meaning of the term does not arise there.

original: de las gzhan pa tha snyad pa rnams kyi nges par 'jog pa rang gis rig pa dbang po'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa tha snyad pa rnams kyi nges par 'jog pa rang gis rig pa dbang po'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The other, conventional, ascertainment is like the cognition of the sense faculties.

original: 'on kyang brjod du med pa'i de kho na nyid la spyir sgro btags pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod du med pa'i de kho na nyid la spyir sgro btags pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: However, the conventional is a superimposition in general on inexpressible reality.

original: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: Everything that exists is momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog la sogs pa bzhin du thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas tha dad pa dang 'bral ba'i skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog la sogs pa bzhin du thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas tha dad pa dang 'bral ba'i skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like the sound of a finger snap, lightning, and so on, it is momentary because it is devoid of a different location at the beginning and end.

original: mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa ji ltar na rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa ji ltar na rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How can a momentary thing be understood without a second?

original: thams cad mkhyen pas yang dag par thugs su chud pa yang de las gzhan pa'i tha snyad pa rnams kyis ji ltar na rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas yang dag par thugs su chud pa yang de las gzhan pa'i tha snyad pa rnams kyis ji ltar na rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How can the conventional, which is the correct understanding of the omniscient one, be understood by others?

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang gis yang dag par rig pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyun ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas na kun gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rang gis yang dag par rig pa yang dag par rtogs pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyun ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas na kun gyis rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The continuum of moments of the correct understanding of the yogis is not understood by all, because it is divided into samƒÅdhi with appearance and without appearance.

original: 'khor ba pa rnams kyi skad cig pa ji ltar na rnam par gdon mi za bar so sor snang /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa rnams kyi skad cig pa ji ltar na rnam par gdon mi za bar so sor snang /
translated: How is it that the moments of the worldly are definitely seen individually?

original: de dag la rmi lam dang / rmi lam ma yin pa'i dus kyis so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rmi lam dang / rmi lam ma yin pa'i dus kyis so sor nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because for them there is no certainty of individual distinction between dream and non-dream time.

original: ji ltar se gol la sogs pa'i sgra tsam gyis rmi lam la zla ba dang / lo la sogs @205a * //
analyzed: ji ltar se gol la sogs pa'i sgra tsam gyis rmi lam la zla ba dang / lo la sogs @205a * //
translated: How is it that in a dream, the sound of a finger snap and so on is heard as the sound of the moon, a year, and so on?

original: pa kun du tshor ba de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang yin na 'khor ba'i dus na skad cig pa la sogs pa'i dus so sor ji ltar na des gang gi tshe na thung ba dang / ring ba la sogs pa'i skad cig pa la sogs pa'i dus su so sor nges pa med na /
analyzed: pa kun du tshor ba de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang yin na 'khor ba'i dus na skad cig pa la sogs pa'i dus so sor ji ltar na des gang gi tshe na thung ba dang / ring ba la sogs pa'i skad cig pa la sogs pa'i dus su so sor nges pa med na /
translated: Just as it is in the case of feeling, so it is in the case of the waking state.

original: de'i tshe dag pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyun la ji ltar na yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe dag pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyun la ji ltar na yang rjes su dpag par 'gyur /
translated: If there is no certainty of the duration of the moment, etc., in the case of the samsaric state, how can there be an inference of the pure continuum of moments?

original: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir dag pa dang ma dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rim pa yang gcig par mi rigs te /
analyzed: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir dag pa dang ma dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rim pa yang gcig par mi rigs te /
translated: Because of the difference in nature, like a tree and ashes, etc., and because of the pure and impure nature, it is not reasonable that the sequence be the same.

original: des na bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi skad cig mar 'jig par nges pa 'di ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul lta bu'i ma rig pas glongs pa'i snang ba ma gtogs par ro //
analyzed: des na bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi skad cig mar 'jig par nges pa 'di ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul lta bu'i ma rig pas glongs pa'i snang ba ma gtogs par ro //
translated: Therefore, this destruction of the moment of the Sugatas is certain, except for the appearance deluded by ignorance, like a dream and a magical illusion.

original: gnyis su med pa dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs pas de tha dad par dbye ba na tshangs pa dang / dbang po mi gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa lta bur rtag cing gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs pas de tha dad par dbye ba na tshangs pa dang / dbang po mi gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa lta bur rtag cing gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: When it is divided into different kinds, such as pure and impure, it is not permanent and single, like the idea of a creator god or of a nondual sense faculty.

original: des na mu stegs byed pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i blo gros zhan pa'o //
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i blo gros zhan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intellect of the followers of the Sugata is superior to that of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i khyad par can la sogs pa'i mu stegs byed pa bdag dang / dbang po dang / yid dang don du 'phrad pa las shes pa skye'o zhes rtog par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i khyad par can la sogs pa'i mu stegs byed pa bdag dang / dbang po dang / yid dang don du 'phrad pa las shes pa skye'o zhes rtog par byed do //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas, such as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas who assert external objects, imagine that consciousness arises from the contact of the self, the sense faculties, the mind, and objects.üîΩSince there are no external objects,

original: phyi rol gyi don med pas theg pa chen po la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pas theg pa chen po la /
translated: the MahƒÅyƒÅna

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: teaches that the body, enjoyments, and the appearances of the world

original: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //üîΩrnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: arise from the all-base.üîΩThe all-base is like

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: an ocean and the seven consciousnesses are like waves.

original: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus rnam pa sna tshogs bslad pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las phyi rol gyi don med par yang rnam par shes pa gcig bu nyid lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus rnam pa sna tshogs bslad pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las phyi rol gyi don med par yang rnam par shes pa gcig bu nyid lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su so sor snang ngo //
translated: Just as in a dream, due to the ripening of the latent tendencies of various contaminations, without external objects, a single consciousness appears separately as a body, enjoyments, and a place.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub pa mdzad pa lta bu nga'i ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub pa mdzad pa lta bu nga'i ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not like the omniscient one's accomplishment.

original: kye bram ze nga ni rgyur smra ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: kye bram ze nga ni rgyur smra ba yang ma yin /
translated: O Brahmin, I do not speak of causes,

original: rgyu med par smra ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba yang ma yin /
translated: nor do I speak of causelessness.

original: gzhan du na rnam par rtog pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po rab tu bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na rnam par rtog pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po rab tu bzhag pa ste /
translated: Rather, conceptualization itself is posited as the entity of apprehended and apprehender.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar bstan to zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bar bstan to zhes pa ste /
translated: It is taught as dependent origination.

original: rgyur smra ba rnams la ni phyi rol gyi don rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyur smra ba rnams la ni phyi rol gyi don rgyu ma yin te /
translated: For those who speak of causes, external objects are not the cause,

original: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par phye ba na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when distinguished as gross and subtle, they do not exist.

original: ji ltar mu stegs byed rnams @205b kyi bdag dang / dbang po dang / yid dang don 'phrad pa las shes pa skyes pa da ltar mu stegs can gyi brtags pa yid dang dbang po ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs byed rnams @205b kyi bdag dang / dbang po dang / yid dang don 'phrad pa las shes pa skyes pa da ltar mu stegs can gyi brtags pa yid dang dbang po ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as the tƒ´rthikas say that consciousness arises from the contact of self, sense faculty, mind, and object, the Buddhists do not say that mind and sense faculty are as imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: bslad pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa snang ngo //
analyzed: bslad pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam par shes pa snang ngo //
translated: Rather, consciousness appears as various different things due to the power of the ripening of tainted latent propensities.

original: de'i rgyu las yang byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel pa'i bya ba med de /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las yang byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel pa'i bya ba med de /
translated: In that case, there is no activity that is connected to an agent and action due to a cause.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is merely that if this exists, that exists in the aftermath of the former.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid ces pa ni spyir don du sgro btags par bzhag nas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid ces pa ni spyir don du sgro btags par bzhag nas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúImagination‚Äù means that in general, having posited the superimposition of an object, dependent origination is taught.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa 'dzin pa dang gzung pa'i dngos po ston gyi /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa 'dzin pa dang gzung pa'i dngos po ston gyi /
translated: It teaches the two aspects of consciousness, the apprehender and the apprehended.

original: gnyis su med cing brjod du med pas ma yin pa ni der dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing brjod du med pas ma yin pa ni der dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not nondual and inexpressible because there is no conceptualization of non-existence in that.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i skad cig pa rnams mngon sum gyis myong du zin kyang de lta bur rnam par rtog pa'i sgra'i don du tha snyad med do //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i skad cig pa rnams mngon sum gyis myong du zin kyang de lta bur rnam par rtog pa'i sgra'i don du tha snyad med do //
translated: Although the non-conceptual, non-apparent, nondual moments of correct cognition are directly experienced, there is no conventional expression in terms of the meaning of the words of such conceptualization.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po bzhag ste /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po bzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, having established the duality of apprehended and apprehender through conceptualization,

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ston to zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ston to zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: the Omniscient One teaches dependent origination. This is the intended meaning.

original: khyod lta bu dang gzhan dag gis mi rig go zhes pa ni skyes pa la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khyod lta bu dang gzhan dag gis mi rig go zhes pa ni skyes pa la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is not known by those like you or others refers to dependent origination free from the phenomena of arising and so forth.

original: byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel te 'byung bar mi rig pa ni nam skad cig pa gcig yod pa de na gnyis po ni med do //
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel te 'byung bar mi rig pa ni nam skad cig pa gcig yod pa de na gnyis po ni med do //
translated: The arising of the dependent nature is not known to be related to an agent and action, because when one moment exists, the other two do not exist.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de las gzhig / gang zag la bdag med pa la ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de las gzhig / gang zag la bdag med pa la ni /
translated: Since things and nonthings are not related, they are not the dependent nature.üîΩThe MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉgika ƒÄryas read:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow could they be unstable and not produced?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: That which arises is the very production.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //üîΩces 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa rnams kyis klog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod // ces 'phags pa dge 'dun chen po pa rnams kyis klog pa lta bu'o //
translated: That is also called the producer.

original: shin tu rgyas pa chos la bdag med par yang gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa chos la bdag med par yang gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams kyi skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: In the extensive teachings, the dependent nature is also said to be nondual, the nature of the absence of the arising of the aspects of the self of phenomena and the self of persons,

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang la skye ba yang med mi skye ba yang med /üîΩbyas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang la skye ba yang med mi skye ba yang med / byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: In that way, the dependent nature is neither produced nor unproduced.üîΩIt is not produced.

original: ma byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not unproduced.

original: rtag @206a * //
analyzed: rtag @206a * //
translated: Always.üîΩüîΩ

original: pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not impermanent.

original: dngos po ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin dngos po med pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not a thing, nor is it a non-thing.

original: skad cig pa ma yin skad cig pa ma yin pa kho na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin skad cig pa ma yin pa kho na yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not momentary, nor is it not just non-momentary.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pas rnam pa de lta bu khas blangs pa'i phyi rol gyi don med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pas rnam pa de lta bu khas blangs pa'i phyi rol gyi don med do //
translated: The external objects accepted by the LokƒÅyatas in this way do not exist.

original: mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par brtags pa ni sems kyi snang ba ma gtogs par byed do //
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par brtags pa ni sems kyi snang ba ma gtogs par byed do //
translated: All tƒ´rthikas imagine specific and general characteristics, except for the appearances of the mind.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid khyod lta bu'i phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags shing /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyud yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid khyod lta bu'i phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags shing /
translated: The ultimate truth, which is non-conceptual and non-appearing, is the characteristic of the nondual tantra of pure awareness. You, who are attached to external objects,

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan par smra ba gnas pas mi rig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan par smra ba gnas pas mi rig go //
translated: do not understand it because you abide in the teachings of the LokƒÅyatas.

original: des ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams de kho na nyid do zhes la /
analyzed: des ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams de kho na nyid do zhes la /
translated: They say that earth, water, fire, and wind are reality.

original: de dag las tshor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ra ro ba'i mthu bzhin la /
analyzed: de dag las tshor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ra ro ba'i mthu bzhin la /
translated: Among them, the consciousness of feeling is like the power of intoxication.

original: srog ni chu'i chu bur bzhin te /
analyzed: srog ni chu'i chu bur bzhin te /
translated: Life is like a water bubble.

original: de 'dus pa las lus dang / dbang po dang / blor 'du shes so ;
analyzed: de 'dus pa las lus dang / dbang po dang / blor 'du shes so ;
translated: From their aggregation, the body, the sense faculties, and the mind are conceptualized.

original: /'byung ba sna tshogs tha dad pa'i phyir 'gro ba yang sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: /'byung ba sna tshogs tha dad pa'i phyir 'gro ba yang sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: Since the elements are various and different, the world is also various,üîΩlike the patterns on a peacock‚Äôs tail.üîΩIn the LokƒÅyata S≈´tra, the non-Buddhists say to the Buddhists, ‚ÄúExternal objects do not exist.‚Äù

original: rma bya'i mdongs kyi ri mo bzhin no zhes pa 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i mdo las zhi ba pa rnams la phyi rol gyi don med par 'byung ba pa rnams dang / de la dag pa la tshor ba 'byung ba yang med do //
analyzed: rma bya'i mdongs kyi ri mo bzhin no zhes pa 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i mdo las zhi ba pa rnams la phyi rol gyi don med par 'byung ba pa rnams dang / de la dag pa la tshor ba 'byung ba yang med do //
translated: And, ‚ÄúFeeling does not arise from the elements.‚Äù

original: ye shes kyi gong ma'i khyad par gong dang gang yin pa de dang de ni thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa thog mar byas pa las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi gong ma'i khyad par gong dang gang yin pa de dang de ni thos pa dang sems pa la sogs pa thog mar byas pa las byung ba rnams te /
translated: The special qualities of higher wisdom that are higher than those are produced from the beginning by listening, reflection, and so on.

original: slob dpon gyi mkhas pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi mkhas pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: They are like the special qualities of a master scholar.

original: skyes ma thag pa rnams kyang shes rab dang / dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan dang / mi dga' pa la sogs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa bsgrub pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa rnams kyang shes rab dang / dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan dang / mi dga' pa la sogs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa bsgrub pa mthong ngo //
translated: We see that they have likes and dislikes, fear and sorrow, and so on.

original: des na sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //üîΩ'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs ni /
analyzed: des na sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go // 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs ni /
translated: Therefore, we infer that they have had previous practice.üîΩThe various kinds of living beings are not tenable if they are different.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pas na rgyu'i khyad par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pas na rgyu'i khyad par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, we infer that there is a difference in their causes.

original: 'byung ba las ni 'bras bu thams cad mthun par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'byung ba las ni 'bras bu thams cad mthun par 'gyur la /
translated: All effects would be similar if they were from the elements.

original: byung ba'i khyad par yang sus phyed /
analyzed: byung ba'i khyad par yang sus phyed /
translated: Who distinguishes the differences in the elements?

original: gang gis de dag khyad par du byed pa de dag dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las su gtogs so zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: gang gis de dag khyad par du byed pa de dag dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las su gtogs so zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs par brtag go //
translated: It is the intention of the Omniscient One that those who distinguish the elements are included among those who have virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: khyed lta bus mi rig go zhes pa dang / mu stegs can gzhan dag gis mi rig go zhes pa ni bdag @206b tu mngon par chags par lhung ba'i rgyud can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed lta bus mi rig go zhes pa dang / mu stegs can gzhan dag gis mi rig go zhes pa ni bdag @206b tu mngon par chags par lhung ba'i rgyud can gyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúYou do not know‚Äù and ‚Äúothers do not know‚Äù refer to those who have fallen into the stream of attachment to a self.

original: de la la la ni rtag pa dang gcig pa'i bdag tu mngon par chags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la la la ni rtag pa dang gcig pa'i bdag tu mngon par chags pa nyid do //
translated: Some of them are attached to a permanent and unitary self.

original: 'jig rten ji ltar zhi ba pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba pa rnams so //üîΩde dag la 'khor ba dang thar pa'i dus na sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal med pa la sogs pa tha dad pas phye ba'i phyir bdag ci ltar na rtag / tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir grol ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar zhi ba pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba pa rnams so // de dag la 'khor ba dang thar pa'i dus na sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal med pa la sogs pa tha dad pas phye ba'i phyir bdag ci ltar na rtag / tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir grol ba dang /
translated: The world is peaceful and the end is proclaimed by the holders of the Vedas.üîΩHow can the self be permanent, since it is differentiated by the presence or absence of suffering, etc., in the states of cyclic existence and liberation?

original: ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And how can it be unitary, since it is the nature of Brahma, Indra, etc., and is liberated and not liberated, rich and poor, etc.?

original: grangs can la sogs pa rnams kyi skyes bu yang mang ste /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa rnams kyi skyes bu yang mang ste /
translated: The purusha of the Samkhya, etc., is also manifold.

original: gang gi tshe yul kun du rig pa na bde ba dang // sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'byed pas phye ba de ni skyes bu rtag par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul kun du rig pa na bde ba dang // sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'byed pas phye ba de ni skyes bu rtag par yang mi rung ste /
translated: When it is aware of all objects, it is differentiated by the presence or absence of pleasure, pain, etc., but it is not tenable that the purusha is permanent.

original: des na bde bar gshegs pa'i tshul 'khor ba dang / thar par rnam par gnas pa mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis mi rig go //
analyzed: des na bde bar gshegs pa'i tshul 'khor ba dang / thar par rnam par gnas pa mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis mi rig go //
translated: Therefore, the way of the Sugata is not known by the tƒ´rthikas who are situated in sa·πÉsƒÅra and liberation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar bdun brgya pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar bdun brgya pa las 'byung ba /
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is as it is said in the SaptasatikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de nyid de /
translated: That very nirvƒÅ·πáaüîΩis this:

original: 'di lta ste bsam pa med pa nyid do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsam pa med pa nyid do zhes pa ste /
translated: the absence of thought.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog go zhes pa ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog go zhes pa ni thar pa'o //
translated: The absence of conceptualization of things and nonthings is liberation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor ma brtags pa ste /
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa, space, and non-analytical cessationüîΩare the three non-conceptual states.

original: 'gog pa rnams kyi gsum pa nyid rnam par mi rtog na 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'gog pa rnams kyi gsum pa nyid rnam par mi rtog na 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa lta ci smos /
translated: If even these three are non-conceptual, what need is there to mention conditioned and unconditioned phenomena?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the conceptualization of things and nonthings,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: One should understand that the Omniscient One has this intention in the Perfection of Wisdom: ‚ÄúOne should understand that the three realms are mind only.‚Äù

original: kye goo ta ma srid pa gsum po 'di mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rgyu las byung ngam /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma srid pa gsum po 'di mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rgyu las byung ngam /
translated: ‚ÄúO Gautama, do the three realms arise from the cause of ignorance, craving, and karma,

original: de ste rgyu med pas /
analyzed: de ste rgyu med pas /
translated: or are they without a cause?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúO Brahmin, both of these are LokƒÅyata.‚ÄùüîΩHow are both of these LokƒÅyata? What is the intention of the Omniscient One in this?

original: kye bram ze 'di gnyis ka yang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'o zhes pa gnyis ka yang ji ltar na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa yin zhing der thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ci zhig / ji bzhin du rgyu las byed pa po dang 'brel bar kun du rtog
analyzed: kye bram ze 'di gnyis ka yang 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'o zhes pa gnyis ka yang ji ltar na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa yin zhing der thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ci zhig / ji bzhin du rgyu las byed pa po dang 'brel bar kun du rtog
translated: Just as the agent is imagined to be related to the effect in accordance with the cause,

original: pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la las med pas mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rgyu las srid pa gsum 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la las med pas mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rgyu las srid pa gsum 'byung ba med do //
translated: in the same way, since all phenomena are without action, the three realms do not arise from the cause of ignorance, craving, and karma.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are also not without a cause.

original: bdag @207a * //
analyzed: bdag @207a * //
translated: From self

original: las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: and from other

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // zhes pa ste /
translated: Not from both, nor without cause.

original: 'on kyang snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes chos su btags pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes chos su btags pa ste /
translated: However, if this exists, then that is designated as a phenomenon,

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni 'byung ba med de skye ba la sogs pa'i chos skad cig pa las gud na med do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni 'byung ba med de skye ba la sogs pa'i chos skad cig pa las gud na med do //
translated: in the sense that dependent origination is not a real entity, but is not separate from momentary phenomena such as arising.

original: brjod du med cing gnyis su med pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyud la yang rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: brjod du med cing gnyis su med pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyud la yang rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go //
translated: Even in the continuum of the inexpressible and nondual moment, conceptual thought does not operate.

original: 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gnyis rnam pa la chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gnyis rnam pa la chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog par bya'o //
translated: The statement If this exists, then that exists is the conceptual thought that designates phenomena in the aspect of the two dependent natures.

original: dngos po thams cad rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du ltung ba'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi rgal ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du ltung ba'o zhes pa ni 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi rgal ba ste /
translated: The statement All entities fall into the characteristics of the individual and universal is the objection of the Lokayatas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas spong pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la phyi rol dang / nang gi dro ba dang / grang ba dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i dngos po rnam par brtag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas spong pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la phyi rol dang / nang gi dro ba dang / grang ba dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i dngos po rnam par brtag go //
translated: The Omniscient One has rejected the characteristics of universals and particulars in a cognition that has the aspect of both, and he has analyzed external and internal things that are hot, cold, permanent, and impermanent.

original: des na nor par sgro btags pa'i rnam pa thams cad la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: des na nor par sgro btags pa'i rnam pa thams cad la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad do //
translated: Therefore, all the aspects of mistaken superimposition are explained as universals and particulars.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las /
translated: As it says in the Madhyamaka:

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: If the characterized and the characteristic were different,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the characteristic would not exist in the characterized.

original: gcig na de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they were the same, those two would not be established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they were different, they would not be other.

original: ces pa'o // de ltar na nang dang phyi'i mtshan nyid med pa la rnam par rtog pa de'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan la khyab pa'i tshul thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces pa'o // de ltar na nang dang phyi'i mtshan nyid med pa la rnam par rtog pa de'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan la khyab pa'i tshul thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, because of the conception of the characteristics of the internal and the external that do not exist, the Omniscient One has taught the mode of pervasion of the LokƒÅyata:

original: bram ze ji tsam du yid las rnam par g-yos pa dang / phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags shing rnam par rtog pa tsam du 'jig rten rgyang pan no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bram ze ji tsam du yid las rnam par g-yos pa dang / phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags shing rnam par rtog pa tsam du 'jig rten rgyang pan no zhes pa ni /
translated: The brahmin, to the extent that he is disturbed in mind and is attached to external objects, is a Lokayata.

original: ji tsam du phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags shing 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa so sor snang ba'i shes pa ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags shing 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa so sor snang ba'i shes pa ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: To the extent that he is attached to external objects, and his consciousness appears as the individual conceptualization of the apprehended object, he has false knowledge.

original: yid la rnam par g-yos pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa de tsam du thams cad 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'o //
analyzed: yid la rnam par g-yos pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa de tsam du thams cad 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'o //
translated: To the extent that he is disturbed in mind, and his mind engages in the conceptualization of permanence, etc., he is a Lokayata.

original: gang yang don dam pa'i bden pa'i ye shes de ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa'i yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang don dam pa'i bden pa'i ye shes de ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa'i yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Moreover, that knowledge of ultimate reality is non-conceptual, non-apparent, non-dual, and is the correct knowledge of the conceptualization of existence and non-existence.

original: des ni gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad mi 'jug go //
analyzed: des ni gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad mi 'jug go //
translated: By it, all the aspects of the conceptualization of duality do not operate.

original: grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni bden bar gshegs pa'i yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni bden bar gshegs pa'i yin te /
translated: This tenet is that of the Sugata,

original: mu stegs @207b byed thams cad la ma gtogs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: mu stegs @207b byed thams cad la ma gtogs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and it is set forth as being excluded from all the tƒ´rthikas.

original: skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung bas na mu stegs byed pa'i rtag pa la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i chos ma yin no //üîΩphyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi 'byung ba'i rgyu las log cing rig par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung bas na mu stegs byed pa'i rtag pa la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i chos ma yin no // phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi 'byung ba'i rgyu las log cing rig par zhugs pa ste /
translated: It is not a doctrine that accords with the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô assertions of permanence and so on, because it arises as a momentary continuum.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi bag chags yongs su smin pa las skyes pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i tshogs la goms pa las skyes pa'i sems te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi bag chags yongs su smin pa las skyes pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i tshogs la goms pa las skyes pa'i sems te /
translated: It is the opposite of the LokƒÅyata assertion that external objects are the cause of the elements, because it is a mind that arises from the ripening of the latent tendencies of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and from the cultivation of the accumulations of wisdom and so on.

original: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan dgag pa bsgrub par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan dgag pa bsgrub par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore the refutation of LokƒÅyata is established by inference.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs nas gnyis su med pa ni dmigs su zin kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs nas gnyis su med pa ni dmigs su zin kyang /
translated: When coarse and subtle [phenomena] are analyzed by wisdom and dissected, the nondual [nature of reality] is apprehended.

original: 'on kyang bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun yang dag par rig pa ni de las gzhan pa nges par 'jug pa dbang po'i shes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin du mngon sum mo //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun yang dag par rig pa ni de las gzhan pa nges par 'jug pa dbang po'i shes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin du mngon sum mo //
translated: But the true knowledge of the stream of the non-dual characteristic, which is without thought and without appearance, is direct perception, like the true knowledge of the sense consciousnesses that definitely engages objects other than that.

original: grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni mu stegs can rnams kyi ma yin la 'jig rten rgyang pan la grags pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' 'di ni mu stegs can rnams kyi ma yin la 'jig rten rgyang pan la grags pa yang ma yin no //
translated: This tenet is not that of the tƒ´rthikas, nor is it known to the LokƒÅyatas.

original: grub pa 'di yang ston to zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa rgya cher bstan pa mdor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa 'di yang ston to zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa rgya cher bstan pa mdor rig par bya'o //
translated: This establishment is also taught, so the intention of the Omniscient One should be understood in brief as extensively explained.

original: phyi rol gyi 'byung bar sgro 'dogs pas rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'byung bar sgro 'dogs pas rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Imagination arises from superimposing external elements.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad pa de ni mi dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa ldog ste /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad pa de ni mi dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa ldog ste /
translated: When that is analyzed by wisdom, it is not observed and imagination ceases.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dug go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dug go //
translated: It abides in its own characteristic.

original: chud pa 'khrugs pa ni de 'khrug go //
analyzed: chud pa 'khrugs pa ni de 'khrug go //
translated: When the water is disturbed, it is disturbed.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pas nor pa ldog go //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pas nor pa ldog go //
translated: When analyzed by wisdom, error ceases.

original: chud pa gnas las byung ba na gzhan gyi dbang la brten pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug go //
analyzed: chud pa gnas las byung ba na gzhan gyi dbang la brten pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug go //
translated: When it is absorbed in the basis, the conceptualization of the two aspects based on the other-dependent occurs.

original: mtshan ma mi dmigs pa na rang gi gnas su chud pa tsam du 'dug go //
analyzed: mtshan ma mi dmigs pa na rang gi gnas su chud pa tsam du 'dug go //
translated: When the sign is not observed, it remains merely absorbed in its own basis.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis gsal bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis gsal bar bshad pa'o //
translated: That is the explanation of omniscience.

original: zang zing sdud pa ni sred pa sdud pa ste sdug bsngal gyi don to //
analyzed: zang zing sdud pa ni sred pa sdud pa ste sdug bsngal gyi don to //
translated: The accumulation of material things is the accumulation of craving, which is the meaning of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yongs su zad pa ni dag pa'i chos kyis thob par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su zad pa ni dag pa'i chos kyis thob par byed do //
translated: The complete exhaustion of suffering is accomplished by the pure Dharma.

original: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi smra ba yongs su spong zhing dag pa'i chos thob par brtson par bya'o zhes pa'o //üîΩ'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las 'jig rten rgyang pan dpyad pa'i le'u ste @208a * //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi smra ba yongs su spong zhing dag pa'i chos thob par brtson par bya'o zhes pa'o // 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las 'jig rten rgyang pan dpyad pa'i le'u ste @208a * //
translated: Therefore, one should completely abandon the teachings of LokƒÅyata and strive to attain the pure Dharma.üîΩThis concludes the twelfth chapter, on the analysis of LokƒÅyata, in the treatise Illuminating the Jewel of the Noble Land of India, composed by the great pa·πá·∏çit of Kashmir, ≈öƒÅkya≈õrƒ´ Bhadra, and the great editor and translator, the monk Kunga Gyaltsen Palsangpo.

original: bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: Chapter Thirteen: The Analysis of the Dharma

original: // / de la blo gros chen pos chos sdud pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / de la blo gros chen pos chos sdud pa gang zhe na /
translated: Great Being, what is the accumulation of the Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rang gi sems kyis chos bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la bdag med pa gnyis ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyis chos bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la bdag med pa gnyis ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
