translated: The two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: As this very scripture says:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is the analysis of atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //üîΩzhes par phung por gnas pa'i sdom po rnams phye zhing /
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste // zhes par phung por gnas pa'i sdom po rnams phye zhing /
translated: Atoms have no parts.üîΩThe aggregates, which are collections of those, are empty, like a collection of children.

original: btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs par phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs par phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the aggregates are divided into different directional parts, such as the front part, the back part, the upper part, the lower part, the cooked part, the uncooked part, the shaken part, the unshaken part, the covered part, and the uncovered part, they are empty, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: cha med pa'i rdul phra mo rnams ni bla 'og tu chags par mi rung ste /
analyzed: cha med pa'i rdul phra mo rnams ni bla 'og tu chags par mi rung ste /
translated: Partless atoms cannot be arranged in a hierarchy,üîΩlike the mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin bar lan du mar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin bar lan du mar bshad pa'o //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: gang zag la bdag med par yang gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par yang gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: All that exists in the absence of a self in the person is momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the sound of a finger snap, a waterfall, and so on.

original: smra ba gzhan dag gis brtags pa'i bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / rdul dang / gtso bo la sogs pa yod par khas len to //
analyzed: smra ba gzhan dag gis brtags pa'i bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / rdul dang / gtso bo la sogs pa yod par khas len to //
translated: Other philosophers believe in the existence of a self imagined by other philosophers, such as BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, atoms, primordial matter, and so on.

original: de dag gi blo dang rnam par rtog pas dngos po blangs pa med de /
analyzed: de dag gi blo dang rnam par rtog pas dngos po blangs pa med de /
translated: But their intellect and imagination do not grasp things as they are.

original: rtag pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa ni med pa ste /
translated: The permanent does not exist.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is not produced, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: rim dang cig car gyi don gyi bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rim dang cig car gyi don gyi bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa'o //
translated: It is not a thing, like the horn of an ass, because the activity of the object is contradictory in terms of sequence and simultaneity.

original: de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes shing shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes shing shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: Thus, having analyzed with wisdom the selflessness of the person,

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / bya ba dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / bya ba dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go //
translated: object, subject, and so on, do not occur.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As it says in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of not abiding in the aggregates and because of their disintegration, it is called ‚Äòinner emptiness‚Äô and so on.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang bdag gir chags pa med pa'i phyir 'jungs pa spangs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyi sa'i khyad @208b par gong nas gong
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang bdag gir chags pa med pa'i phyir 'jungs pa spangs nas sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyi sa'i khyad @208b par gong nas gong
translated: In the same way, because of the absence of attachment to self and to what is mine, having abandoned stinginess, the lords of yoga, through the accumulation of merit and wisdom of all the perfections such as generosity, attain the stages of the bodhisattva, which are superior to the stages of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: du yul la dbang zhing sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog go //
analyzed: du yul la dbang zhing sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ldog go //
translated: They attain mastery over the objects of the higher and higher stages, and the mind, mentation, and mental consciousness are reversed.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na dbang thob ces pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dbang bskur ba rtogs pa dang / thugs pa med pa'i gnas yongs su bzung ba dang / chos thams cad la lhun gyis grub pas dbang byed pa ni chos zhes bya'o zhes pa ste /üîΩsa bcu tha dad pas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnams kyis gong ma'i yang gong mar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su sbyor ba mchog tu dbang du gyur pas dbang dang gzhan gyi don du nus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: ji ltar na dbang thob ces pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes dbang bskur ba rtogs pa dang / thugs pa med pa'i gnas yongs su bzung ba dang / chos thams cad la lhun gyis grub pas dbang byed pa ni chos zhes bya'o zhes pa ste / sa bcu tha dad pas pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnams kyis gong ma'i yang gong mar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su sbyor ba mchog tu dbang du gyur pas dbang dang gzhan gyi don du nus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: It is said that they realize the consecration of the pristine awareness of all buddhas, they take hold of the state of nonconceptuality, and they exercise power over all phenomena by means of spontaneous accomplishment.üîΩBy means of the ten perfections, they apply themselves to the accumulation of merit and pristine awareness on the ten different levels, and they obtain the highest power over them.

original: nyid thob cing sems can la phan par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid thob cing sems can la phan par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they obtain the state of omniscience, the power of yoga, and they engage in benefiting sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa gnyis pa dad pa spyod pa las 'das te /
analyzed: de la sdom pa gnyis pa dad pa spyod pa las 'das te /
translated: Having gone beyond the stage of faithful practice,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ting nge 'dzin thob nas dbang thob pa ni 'khor ba las log pa yin /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ting nge 'dzin thob nas dbang thob pa ni 'khor ba las log pa yin /
translated: they obtain the power of concentration on the Joyous level and turn away from cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
translated: He is born into the family of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: mang du thos shing 'jigs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: mang du thos shing 'jigs pa med pa yin /
translated: He is learned and fearless.

original: de 'khor gyi nang du spa gong ba med pa yin /
analyzed: de 'khor gyi nang du spa gong ba med pa yin /
translated: He is not timid in the midst of the assembly.

original: de kun du 'tshe bas 'jigs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de kun du 'tshe bas 'jigs pa med pa yin /
translated: He is not afraid of being harmed.üîΩHe sees a hundred Buddhas.üîΩHe moves a hundred buddha-fields.

original: sangs rgyas brgya ni mthong /üîΩzhing brgya ni bskyod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas brgya ni mthong / zhing brgya ni bskyod /
translated: He manifests a hundred bodies.üîΩHe enters a hundred existences.üîΩHe illuminates a hundred worlds.üîΩHe shakes a hundred worlds.üîΩHe matures a hundred beings.

original: lus brgya ni ston /üîΩgnyis kyis 'khor los sgyur ba yin /
analyzed: lus brgya ni ston / gnyis kyis 'khor los sgyur ba yin /
translated: He remains for a hundred eons.üîΩHe enters a hundred meditative absorptions.üîΩHe opens a hundred doors of Dharma.üîΩHe manifests a hundred Nirmanakaya emanations.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam du sems can rnams dgod par byed /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam du sems can rnams dgod par byed /
translated: He manifests a hundred bodhisattvas as his retinue.üîΩHis wisdom, super-knowledges, and so forth become a hundred times more excellent than before.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred bodhisattva levels.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred miracles.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred emanations.üîΩHe is able to remain for a hundred eons.üîΩHe is able to enter a hundred eons into the past and future.üîΩHe is able to illuminate a hundred world systems.üîΩHe is able to shake a hundred world systems.üîΩHe is able to mature a hundred beings.üîΩHe is able to manifest a hundred bodies, each body manifesting a retinue of a hundred bodhisattvas.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred bodhisattva levels.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred miracles.

original: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa byin pa ni zas 'dod pa la ni zas sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rgya cher te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa byin pa ni zas 'dod pa la ni zas sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rgya cher te /
translated: He is able to manifest a hundred emanations.üîΩHe is able to remain for a hundred eons.üîΩHe is able to enter a hundred eons into the past and future.üîΩHe is able to illuminate a hundred world systems.üîΩHe is able to shake a hundred world systems.üîΩHe is able to mature a hundred beings.üîΩHe is able to manifest a hundred bodies, each body manifesting a retinue of a hundred bodhisattvas.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred bodhisattva levels.üîΩHe is able to demonstrate a hundred miracles.üîΩHe is able to manifest a hundred emanations.üîΩHe is able to remain for a hundred eons.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He is able to enter a hundred eons into the past and future.üîΩHe is able to illuminate a hundred world systems.üîΩHe is able to shake a hundred world systems.üîΩHe is able to mature a hundred beings.üîΩHe is able to manifest a hundred bodies, each body manifesting a retin

original: dri ma med par chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtog par 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i tshul khrims kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma med par chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtog par 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i tshul khrims kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the stainless, the perfection of morality predominates, because one is engaged in the morality of the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and in the concentration of non-apprehension of the two kinds of conceptualization of the apprehended.

original: 'od byed du mngon par shes pa dang / bzod pa thob pas 'od dang ldan pa'i phyir snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od byed du mngon par shes pa dang / bzod pa thob pas 'od dang ldan pa'i phyir snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the shining, the perfection of patience predominates, because one has attained the superknowledges and patience, and one is radiant with light.

original: 'od 'phror 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams rtogs par spro bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
analyzed: 'od 'phror 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams rtogs par spro bas brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
translated: On the radiant, the perfection of vigor predominates, because one is radiant with the light of the realization of mundane and supramundane qualities.

original: shin tu dka' rgyal du rgyal bar dka' ba'i nyon mongs pa las rgyal te sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par @209a * //
analyzed: shin tu dka' rgyal du rgyal bar dka' ba'i nyon mongs pa las rgyal te sems rtse gcig tu mnyam par @209a * //
translated: On the difficult to conquer, the perfection of meditation predominates, because one conquers the afflictions, which are difficult to conquer, and one is one-pointedly concentrated.

original: 'jog pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
analyzed: 'jog pas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
translated: On the manifest, the perfection of wisdom predominates, because one is engaged in the wisdom of the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: mngon du bar ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba las mthun pa dang / mi mthun par 'jug par spyod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
analyzed: mngon du bar ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba las mthun pa dang / mi mthun par 'jug par spyod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
translated: The sixth is the ground Gone Far Beyond, because one has gone far by means of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment.üîΩThe seventh is the ground of Immovability, because one is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.üîΩThe eighth is the ground of Presence, because the gnosis of the noble beings is present in the mind.

original: ring du song ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rtogs pa'i phyir ring du song ba ste /
analyzed: ring du song ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rtogs pa'i phyir ring du song ba ste /
translated: The ninth is the ground of Far-reaching, because it is the far-reaching culmination of the path of meditation.üîΩThe tenth is the ground of Immovability, because it is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.üîΩThe eleventh is the ground of Presence, because the gnosis of the noble beings is present in the mind.üîΩThe twelfth is the ground of Far-reaching, because it is the far-reaching culmination of the path of meditation.üîΩThe thirteenth is the ground of Immovability, because it is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yang snying rje gzhan gyi don thabs kyis byed de /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba yang snying rje gzhan gyi don thabs kyis byed de /
translated: The fourteenth is the ground of Presence, because the gnosis of the noble beings is present in the mind.

original: de ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
analyzed: de ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che'o //
translated: The fifteenth is the ground of Far-reaching, because it is the far-reaching culmination of the path of meditation.üîΩThe sixteenth is the ground of Immovability, because it is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.üîΩThe seventeenth is the ground of Presence, because the gnosis of the noble beings is present in the mind.üîΩThe eighteenth is the ground of Far-reaching, because it is the far-reaching culmination of the path of meditation.üîΩThe nineteenth is the ground of Immovability, because it is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.üîΩThe twentieth is the ground of Presence, because the gnosis of the noble beings is present in the mind.üîΩThe twenty-first is the ground of Far-reaching, because it is the far-reaching culmination of the path of meditation.

original: mi g-yo bar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba shes rab kyis dpyad pa'i stong pa nyid gnyis su med cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang zhing dag pa'i 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin so sor lta ba'i ye shes kyis
analyzed: mi g-yo bar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba shes rab kyis dpyad pa'i stong pa nyid gnyis su med cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang zhing dag pa'i 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin so sor lta ba'i ye shes kyis
translated: The twenty-second is the ground of Immovability, because it is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.üîΩThe twenty-third is the ground of Presence, because the gnosis of the noble beings is present in the mind.üîΩThe twenty-fourth is the ground of Far-reaching, because it is the far-reaching culmination of the path of meditation.üîΩThe twenty-fifth is the ground of Immovability, because it is unmoved by the two activities of the three worlds.üîΩThe twenty-sixth is the ground of Presence, because the g

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed cing gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed cing gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And he illuminates the world, and the perfection of prayer becomes predominant for the sake of others.

original: legs pa'i blo gros su ni so sor yang dag par rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin so sor lta ba'i ye shes bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba thams cad shes shing chos smra ba po'i chos bstan pa rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros su ni so sor yang dag par rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin so sor lta ba'i ye shes bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba thams cad shes shing chos smra ba po'i chos bstan pa rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: In the eighth, Good Mind, the concentration of the analytical knowledges, the knowledge of the individual harma, arises, and he becomes a Dharma teacher who knows all the inclinations and latent predispositions of all sentient beings.

original: de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the perfection of power becomes predominant for him.

original: chos kyi sprin du ni chos mtha' dag shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis dbang bskur te /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin du ni chos mtha' dag shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis dbang bskur te /
translated: In the tenth, Cloud of Dharma, he is empowered by all the Omniscient Ones because he knows all dharmas.

original: de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the perfection of knowledge becomes predominant for him.

original: sa bcur spong bar bya ba nyon mongs pa'i mi shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa des spong ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bcur spong bar bya ba nyon mongs pa'i mi shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa des spong ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And he becomes omniscient because he abandons the ignorance of the afflictions together with their instincts, which are to be abandoned on the ten grounds.

original: de ltar na yang de chos thams cad la dbang byed cing rnal 'byor thams cad kyi dbang po sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang de chos thams cad la dbang byed cing rnal 'byor thams cad kyi dbang po sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he is the master of all dharmas and the master of all yogas, and he becomes a Buddha.

original: lhun gyis grub pa med pa ni sa bdun gyi bar du ste sa brgyad kyi dbang po rnams kyis ni lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa med pa ni sa bdun gyi bar du ste sa brgyad kyi dbang po rnams kyis ni lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: The non-spontaneity of the faculties is up to the seventh stage. The faculties of the eighth stage are spontaneous.

original: sa dang po'i dbang po rnams kyis ye shes la dbang byed mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i dus su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang po'i dbang po rnams kyis ye shes la dbang byed mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i dus su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Although the faculties of the first stage do exercise mastery over intuition, nevertheless, they are perfected at the time of omniscience.

original: tshe'i dbang dang / yo byad kyi dbang dang / las kyi dbang thob pas na 'khor ba las log pa yin /
analyzed: tshe'i dbang dang / yo byad kyi dbang dang / las kyi dbang thob pas na 'khor ba las log pa yin /
translated: Since he has attained mastery over life, over resources, and over karma, he turns away from samsara.

original: de kun du 'tsho ba las 'jigs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de kun du 'tsho ba las 'jigs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He is not afraid of the danger of life, etc.

original: des na sa dang po nas brtsams te dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sa dang po nas brtsams te dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, beginning with the first stage, he exercises mastery.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: @209b tshe las yo byad mos pa dang // smon lam rdzu 'phrul skye dbang dang // chos sems de bzhin shas chen dang // dbang bcu 'di dag dbang pos 'thob //üîΩces pa ste /üîΩdes na dbang byed par 'gyur ro //üîΩsa bcu tha dad par phye ba na thams cad mkhyen pa kho na thob par byed do zhes 'phags pa sa bcu pa dang 'dra bar thams cad mkhyen pas 'dir bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: @209b tshe las yo byad mos pa dang // smon lam rdzu 'phrul skye dbang dang // chos sems de bzhin shas chen dang // dbang bcu 'di dag dbang pos 'thob // ces pa ste / des na dbang byed par 'gyur ro // sa bcu tha dad par phye ba na thams cad mkhyen pa kho na thob par byed do zhes 'phags pa sa bcu pa dang 'dra bar thams cad mkhyen pas 'dir bsnyad pa'o //
translated: 1. The ten controlling powers are: life, will, aspiration, miracle, birth, mind, faith, power, knowledge, and preeminence.üîΩüîΩThe ten controlling powers are:üîΩ1. life, 2. will, 3. aspiration, 4. miracle, 5. birth, 6. mind, 7. faith, 8. power, 9. knowledge, and 10. preeminence.üîΩüîΩThus, one becomes a controller.üîΩWhen the ten stages are differentiated, one attains omniscience itself.üîΩ

original: lta ba thams cad la spros pa la rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po mtha' gnyis su lhung bar byed pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs par lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad la spros pa la rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po mtha' gnyis su lhung bar byed pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs par lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /

original: rdul phra mo'i rang bzhin yod pa rtag pa'i gzugs dang / sbom po yan lag gi rdzas ni byed pa dang ldan pa nas yon tan dang ldan pa dang / 'du ba'i rgyu ba'i bar du rdzas yod la rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes so //
analyzed: rdul phra mo'i rang bzhin yod pa rtag pa'i gzugs dang / sbom po yan lag gi rdzas ni byed pa dang ldan pa nas yon tan dang ldan pa dang / 'du ba'i rgyu ba'i bar du rdzas yod la rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes so //
translated: The nature of subtle particles is permanent form, and the coarse substances of the limbs are substantially existent from being endowed with action up to being endowed with qualities and the cause of aggregation.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad nas /
translated: Having analyzed with wisdom,

original: gang gi tshe na sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te /
translated: when the coarse and subtle are dissected,

original: mi dmigs pa de'i tshe lta ba'i spros pa la rnam par rtog pa spong ngo //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de'i tshe lta ba'i spros pa la rnam par rtog pa spong ngo //
translated: at that time the conceptualization of the proliferation of views is abandoned.

original: mu stegs byed smra ba ni byis pa rnams phal cher rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / mtha' gnyis su lhung bar byed do //
analyzed: mu stegs byed smra ba ni byis pa rnams phal cher rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / mtha' gnyis su lhung bar byed do //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas' assertions cause most fools to fall into the two extremes of permanence and annihilation.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: The wise do not.üîΩThe assertion of causelessness is a view.

original: rgyu med par smra ba yongs su bzung bas rnam par lta bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni ji ltar khyad par can la sogs pa yod la /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba yongs su bzung bas rnam par lta bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni ji ltar khyad par can la sogs pa yod la /
translated: Just as there are distinctions, and so on,

original: rgyu dang mi ldan pa ni rtag pa'o zhes kun rtog par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang mi ldan pa ni rtag pa'o zhes kun rtog par byed de /
translated: the absence of causes is permanent. Thus, they imagine.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa la sogs don gcig 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa la sogs don gcig 'dzin pas na /
translated: Since it apprehends the object of seeing, touching, etc.,

original: bdag yod do zhes so //
analyzed: bdag yod do zhes so //
translated: it is said that the self exists.üîΩSince the cause is destroyed, the entity of the cause does not exist, so it is a view of annihilation.

original: rgyu zhig par rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni rgyu 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig pa'i gnyis po la 'bras bu'i dngos po med pas skad cig pa snga ma rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu zhig par rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni rgyu 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig pa'i gnyis po la 'bras bu'i dngos po med pas skad cig pa snga ma rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Since the cause is destroyed, the entity of the effect does not exist in the second moment of the cause, so the previous moment is not the cause.

original: de ltar na mu stegs can rnams chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mu stegs can rnams chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the tƒ´rthikas have a view of annihilation.

original: dran pa dang shes pa la sogs pa skad cig mar 'jig pa la mi rung ngo zhes par rgol ba la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gnas pa'i phyogs su gsungs pa /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes pa la sogs pa skad cig mar 'jig pa la mi rung ngo zhes par rgol ba la thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gnas pa'i phyogs su gsungs pa /
translated: In response to the objection that memory, cognition, etc., are not suitable to be momentary and destroyed, the Omniscient One said that they endure.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig par mi mthong bas chos zhes de skad du bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig par mi mthong bas chos zhes de skad du bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Since they are not seen to arise, endure, and be destroyed, they are called phenomena.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: Whatever exists is momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩrtag pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva @210a * //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no // rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva @210a * //
translated: like the sound of a finger snap, or a waterfall.

original: la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: Since the permanent is not produced, it is a non-entity, like the horn of an ass.

original: rim dang cig car du byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med do //
analyzed: rim dang cig car du byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med do //
translated: Since it is contradictory for it to function either gradually or instantaneously, it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman.

original: de'i phyir dran pa dang / shes pa dang / 'ching ba dang / grol ba dang / bde ba la sogs pa skad cig mar 'jig pa la ni rung gi rtag cing mi 'gyur ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa dang / shes pa dang / 'ching ba dang / grol ba dang / bde ba la sogs pa skad cig mar 'jig pa la ni rung gi rtag cing mi 'gyur ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, memory, cognition, bondage, liberation, pleasure, etc. are possible in the case of momentary destruction, but not in the case of permanence and immutability.

original: lung ston pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel bar kun rtog pa de dag mi rung ste /
analyzed: lung ston pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa dang / byed pa po mngon par 'brel bar kun rtog pa de dag mi rung ste /
translated: The various distinctions of arising, enduring, and disintegrating, etc. in the scriptures, and the imagination of the creator as being related to the created are not possible.

original: 'on kyang de nyid ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung ba las phyir med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung ba las phyir med par 'gyur te /
translated: However, that very thing arises from what was non-existent and becomes non-existent again from what existed.

original: des na skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos rtag pa yin te don dam pa'i yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos rtag pa yin te don dam pa'i yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, arising, enduring, and ceasing are permanent phenomena, but they are not ultimately existent.

original: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po rnams klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po rnams klog pa /
translated: How do the great sa·πÖghas recite this?

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can they be unstable and creative?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //üîΩbyed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de // byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: Whatever arises is just that.

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: It is also called the creator.

original: des na bdag med pa gnyis ka la yang skad cig mar 'jig pa yod ces thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag med pa gnyis ka la yang skad cig mar 'jig pa yod ces thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One intended that both types of selflessness have momentary disintegration.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las chos dpyad pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las chos dpyad pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the thirteenth chapter, on the analysis of phenomena, in the treatise Illuminating the Extent of the Middle Way, an explanation of the Supplement to the Middle Way.üîΩChapter Fourteen: The Analysis of the Two Truths

original: // / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, it is like this.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gang mu stegs byed thams cad rnam par rtog pa mya ngan las 'das pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba dag gi tshig lags so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gang mu stegs byed thams cad rnam par rtog pa mya ngan las 'das pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bgyi ba dag gi tshig lags so //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is a word for the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the complete cessation of all the conceptual thoughts of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said:

original: blo gros chen po de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, for that reason, listen well and so on.

original: mu stegs byed pa kha cig ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'gog pa dang / yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rtag pa dang chos mi mthun pa mthong bas sems dang sems las 'byung ba mang po mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa kha cig ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'gog pa dang / yul la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rtag pa dang chos mi mthun pa mthong bas sems dang sems las 'byung ba mang po mi 'byung ste /
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas, seeing the cessation of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, the freedom from desire for objects, and the incompatibility with permanence, say that many minds and mental factors do not arise.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi yul rjes su dran pa ni mar me dang / sa bon dang / rlung bzhin du rgyu zad pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug par brjod @210b do ;
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi yul rjes su dran pa ni mar me dang / sa bon dang / rlung bzhin du rgyu zad pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug par brjod @210b do ;
translated: They say that the recollection of past, future, and present objects, like a lamp, a seed, and the wind, is the non-engagement of conceptual thoughts due to the exhaustion of causes.

original: / de'i phyir de dag la mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur mod kyi blo gros chen po 'jig par lta bas mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i dpe mar me la sogs pas yul rnams skad cig mar 'jig pa rnam par shes pa nas 'jig pa'i lta ba gang gis mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa de dag la 'gro ba thams cad kyi ther zug tu snga ma'i skad cigüîΩpa'i 'og tu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de dag la mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur mod kyi blo gros chen po 'jig par lta bas mya ngan las mi 'da'o zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i dpe mar me la sogs pas yul rnams skad cig mar 'jig pa rnam par shes pa nas 'jig pa'i lta ba gang gis mya ngan las 'das par rtog pa de dag la 'gro ba thams cad kyi ther zug tu snga ma'i skad cig pa'i 'og tu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: Those who imagine nirvana through the view of destruction will have all their movements cease, and after the previous moment, there will be only nirvana.üîΩTherefore, seeing destruction, they will not attain nirvana.

original: de'i phyir 'jig par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pa dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pa dgongs par brtag go //
translated: This is how the Omniscient One should be understood.

original: nyan thos rnams dang / dge slong skye bo'i chos bsam pa can zhes bya ba rnams phung po 'jig par lta'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams dang / dge slong skye bo'i chos bsam pa can zhes bya ba rnams phung po 'jig par lta'o //
translated: The Shravakas and the monks who think about the Dharma of beings see the destruction of the aggregates.

original: theg pa chen po la ni phyi rol gyi don gyi dngos po med pas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ni phyi rol gyi don gyi dngos po med pas /
translated: In the Mahayana, external objects do not exist.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: Because there is no entity of a grasper and a grasped object, it is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because of the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates, it is not impermanent.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rtag par kun du mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rtag par kun du mi mthong ngo //
translated: As it says in the noble Perfection of Wisdom: ‚ÄúDo not see it as permanent,

original: mi rtag par yang ma yin no zhes pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag par yang ma yin no zhes pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: or as impermanent, as blissful, as suffering, as having a self, or as being without a self.

original: dge ba yang ma yin mi dge ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa rgya cher ro //
analyzed: dge ba yang ma yin mi dge ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa rgya cher ro //
translated: Do not see it as pure or as impure, as having an end, or as having no end, as being annihilated, or as being eternal, as being the same, or as being different, as being gone to cessation, or as not being gone to cessation.‚ÄùüîΩOthers say that liberation is going to another place.

original: gzhan dag ni yul gzhan gyi gnas su song ba thar pa'o zhes brjod pa ni ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na thar par 'gro'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni yul gzhan gyi gnas su song ba thar pa'o zhes brjod pa ni ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na thar par 'gro'o //
translated: Just as the sun goes to the center of the sky,

original: kha cig ni rlung gis klad pa brtol te zhi ba'i gnas su 'gro'o zhes rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni rlung gis klad pa brtol te zhi ba'i gnas su 'gro'o zhes rtog go //
translated: some imagine that the wind splits open the head and one goes to a place of peace.

original: gang na gnas su 'gro ba de na skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang na gnas su 'gro ba de na skye ba ste /
translated: Where one goes is birth.

original: skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba nyid kyi kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba nyid kyi kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Liberation is not going to another birth.

original: nyon mongs pa zad nas thar pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad nas thar pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One has declared that liberation is the exhaustion of the afflictions.

original: de bas na /üîΩnyon mongs 'dod sogs bsgos pa yis //
analyzed: de bas na / nyon mongs 'dod sogs bsgos pa yis //
translated: Therefore,üîΩthe mind itself is cyclic existence,

original: sems nyid 'khor pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems nyid 'khor pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is tainted by the afflictions, such as attachment.

original: de nyid de las grol ba ni //
analyzed: de nyid de las grol ba ni //
translated: Therefore, liberation from that

original: srid pa'i mthar phyin zhes par brjod //
analyzed: srid pa'i mthar phyin zhes par brjod //
translated: is called ‚Äúthe end of cyclic existence.‚ÄùüîΩSome tƒ´rthikas say that liberation is the destruction of the object of the awareness of the mind.

original: ces pa ni mu stegs byed pa kha cig ni blo'i rig par bya ba mthong ba rnam par gzhig pas thar pa brjod do //
analyzed: ces pa ni mu stegs byed pa kha cig ni blo'i rig par bya ba mthong ba rnam par gzhig pas thar pa brjod do //
translated: Others say that liberation is the destruction of the awareness of the mind.üîΩStill others say that liberation is the destruction of both.

original: shes pa la blo'i rig par bya ba zhig par ma mthong bas thar pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa shes nas skyo ba thob pa'o //üîΩde ni nyon mongs pa zad par bya @211a * //
analyzed: shes pa la blo'i rig par bya ba zhig par ma mthong bas thar pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa shes nas skyo ba thob pa'o // de ni nyon mongs pa zad par bya @211a * //
translated: But since they do not see the destruction of the awareness of the mind, they say that liberation is the attainment of disenchantment through understanding impermanence.

original: ba thabs mi shes te /
analyzed: ba thabs mi shes te /
translated: They do not know the method for exhausting the afflictions.

original: gal te rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba bdag med pa shes na ldog go zhe na ni de'i tshe na thar pa'i thabs su 'gyur na 'du shes kyi rnam par rtog pa bkag ste 'khod cing ji ltar shes rab kyi thabs rnams kyis chags pa log
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba bdag med pa shes na ldog go zhe na ni de'i tshe na thar pa'i thabs su 'gyur na 'du shes kyi rnam par rtog pa bkag ste 'khod cing ji ltar shes rab kyi thabs rnams kyis chags pa log
translated: But how could it be a method for liberation? It is not a method for liberation because it is not a method for reversing attachment.

original: ste / ji ltar 'gro ba de lta bur skad cig mar 'jig pa mi shes so //
analyzed: ste / ji ltar 'gro ba de lta bur skad cig mar 'jig pa mi shes so //
translated: It is not a method for reversing attachment because it does not know the momentary disintegration of the aggregates.üîΩSome say: Conceptualization does not engage and one sees permanence and impermanence.

original: kha cig ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug cing rtag pa dang / mi rtag par mthong bas zhes pa ni rgyud kyi rgyun du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la bdag tu sgro btags te rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas su brtags nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug cing rtag pa dang / mi rtag par mthong bas zhes pa ni rgyud kyi rgyun du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la bdag tu sgro btags te rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas su brtags nas /
translated: They superimpose a self on consciousness that endures as a continuum and impute it to be a permanent substance such as a self.

original: blo dang sgra dang mi rnams mi rtog go zhes rnam par rtog pa bzlog cing de'i yon tan blo la sogs pa skye ba rnams bkag ste rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: blo dang sgra dang mi rnams mi rtog go zhes rnam par rtog pa bzlog cing de'i yon tan blo la sogs pa skye ba rnams bkag ste rnam par rtog go //
translated: They say that the mind, speech and body of humans do not conceptualize and they reverse conceptualization. They say that the qualities of the mind and so on that arise are stopped.

original: kha cig ni mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa mang ba ni sdug bsngal skye ba thob par byed pa'o snyam nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa mang ba ni sdug bsngal skye ba thob par byed pa'o snyam nas /
translated: Some, thinking that the many conceptual thoughts with signs cause the attainment of the birth of suffering,üîΩare frightened and terrified by signs, not skilled in the mere appearance of their own minds. Because of seeing signs, they think of nirvana as the desire for happiness.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pa dag mtshan mas 'jigs shing skrag ste mtshan ma mthong bas bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor gyur te zhes pa ni 'du shes kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pa dag mtshan mas 'jigs shing skrag ste mtshan ma mthong bas bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor gyur te zhes pa ni 'du shes kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: This is the nature of grasping the signs of discriminations.

original: 'du shes skran dang 'du shes zug rdu'o snyan nas de lta bur 'du shes med pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes skran dang 'du shes zug rdu'o snyan nas de lta bur 'du shes med pa can yin no //
translated: Thinking that discriminations are tumors and discriminations are pains, they are like those who are without discriminations.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pa ni /
translated: Not skilled in the mere appearance of their own minds,

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: the body, enjoyments, and appearances of abodes

original: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise from the all-base.

original: zhes pa shes rab kyis dpyad pas ldog pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: zhes pa shes rab kyis dpyad pas ldog pa mi shes nas /
translated: Not knowing how to reverse that through the analysis of wisdom,

original: bdag rtag pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i gnas kyi mya ngan las 'das par rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba rnams rtog go //
analyzed: bdag rtag pa ni mchog tu dga' ba'i gnas kyi mya ngan las 'das par rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba rnams rtog go //
translated: the proponents of the extreme of the holders of awareness mantras imagine that the permanent self is the nirvana of the abode of supreme bliss.

original: gang na bde ba'i kun du tshor ba yod pa de na skye ba gzhan gyi gnas te /
analyzed: gang na bde ba'i kun du tshor ba yod pa de na skye ba gzhan gyi gnas te /
translated: Where there is the feeling of pleasure, there is the abode of another birth.

original: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: How can it be nirvana? Thus the Omniscient One thought.

original: yang kha cig ni nang dang phyi'i chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dngos po mi gnas te /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni nang dang phyi'i chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud cing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dngos po mi gnas te /
translated: Moreover, some imagine that nirvana is the non-abiding of things in the past, future, and present, having comprehended the general and specific characteristics of all internal and external phenomena.

original: mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni zhi ba pa dang / gtogs 'dod pa dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa smra ba po rnams kyis dngos po rnams spyi dang khyad par du ldan pa kun du @211b rtog go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni zhi ba pa dang / gtogs 'dod pa dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa smra ba po rnams kyis dngos po rnams spyi dang khyad par du ldan pa kun du @211b rtog go //
translated: Thus, the proponents of peace, the Lokayatas, the Brahmins, and so on imagine that things possess universals and particulars.üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar / thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
analyzed: ji ltar / thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
translated: All this is peace,

original: zhi ba nyid las rab tu byung //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid las rab tu byung //
translated: arisen from peace itself.

original: 'byung po kun la zhi ba ste //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la zhi ba ste //
translated: Peace for all beings,

original: gang zhi de ni bdag nyi do //
analyzed: gang zhi de ni bdag nyi do //
translated: peace is the self.üîΩJust as fire is in wood,

original: ji ltar shing la me yod dang // chu ni sa la yod pa ste //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la me yod dang // chu ni sa la yod pa ste //
translated: and water is in the earth,

original: de ltar 'byung po thams cad la //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung po thams cad la //
translated: Thus, all the beings

original: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //
analyzed: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //
translated: are situated in the pure peace.

original: bstan pa byin 'gro de bzhin du ;
analyzed: bstan pa byin 'gro de bzhin du ;
translated: The teaching is the going of the gift, and likewise,

original: / gang sar cung zad yod pa ni //
analyzed: / gang sar cung zad yod pa ni //
translated: whatever exists anywhere

original: thams cad de ni dbang mchog gi / bdag nyid khyab ste gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad de ni dbang mchog gi / bdag nyid khyab ste gnas pa'o //
translated: is pervaded by the nature of the supreme power and abides.

original: gtogs 'dod kyis kyang smras pa /üîΩ'byung po kun la bdag gnas par //
analyzed: gtogs 'dod kyis kyang smras pa / 'byung po kun la bdag gnas par //
translated: Ka·πáƒÅda also said:üîΩI abide in all beings,

original: bdag la 'byung po thams cad de //
analyzed: bdag la 'byung po thams cad de //
translated: and all beings are in me.

original: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
analyzed: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
translated: Whoever knows that

original: kun du mnyam par mthong ba'o//
analyzed: kun du mnyam par mthong ba'o//
translated: sees the equality of all.

original: tshangs par smra ba lha dra ha ri la sogs pas sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: tshangs par smra ba lha dra ha ri la sogs pas sgrub par byed pa /
translated: The gods, such as BrahmƒÅ and Indra, speak of the practice.

original: de phyir da rod sa gnas pa //
analyzed: de phyir da rod sa gnas pa //
translated: Therefore, the abode is the place

original: snang ba'i grong ni 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: snang ba'i grong ni 'gyur ba med //
translated: of the unchanging city of appearances.

original: tshad dang ldan pa'i sprin rnams ni //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa'i sprin rnams ni //
translated: The clouds that have measure

original: rlung las skye ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rlung las skye ba bzhin du'o //
translated: are like those that arise from the wind.

original: so sor tshig don de dag dang // khams kyi don kyang smra ba ste //
analyzed: so sor tshig don de dag dang // khams kyi don kyang smra ba ste //
translated: Each one speaks of the meaning of the words and the meaning of the elements.

original: de yod dang ni de che ba /üîΩbdag nyid kho na nyid rnams smras //
analyzed: de yod dang ni de che ba / bdag nyid kho na nyid rnams smras //
translated: The existence of that and the greatness of that

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: are spoken of as the nature of one‚Äôs own.

original: de de ltar mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis spyi dang khyad par du brtags pa rnam pa thams cad kyi grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar mi gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis spyi dang khyad par du brtags pa rnam pa thams cad kyi grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for those who maintain that there is no difference, there would be the fault that all the distinctions and universals that are imagined would be liberated or not liberated, rich or poor, and so on, in the same way.

original: ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can gyis tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par brtags pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can gyis tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par brtags pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The LokƒÅyatas and the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas do not imagine that there is difference or non-difference.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gnyis gcig pa gcig pu la rang bzhin gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / grang ba dang / me la sogs pa rnams gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i steng du phan tshun gyi 'bras bu med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gnyis gcig pa gcig pu la rang bzhin gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / grang ba dang / me la sogs pa rnams gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i steng du phan tshun gyi 'bras bu med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the two natures of self and other are not possible in a single thing, there would be the fault that form and formless, cold and fire, and so on, would be the same, and in addition, they would not be mutually caused.

original: des na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas thar pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas thar pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One intended that liberation does not exist through understanding the characteristics of universals and particulars.

original: kha cig ni bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / chos thams cad mi 'jigs par mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni thos pa las te /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / chos thams cad mi 'jigs par mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni thos pa las te /
translated: Some imagine that the self, sentient beings, life, the nourished, the person, the individual, and all things are fearless in nirvana.

original: gal te bdag lta bar byas na shes par bya ba dang / gdon mi za bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag lta bar byas na shes par bya ba dang / gdon mi za bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: If one were to adopt the view of the self, one would have to admit that it is the object of knowledge and that it is permanent.

original: 'on te skye dgu mi 'dod na skye dgu ci bya /
analyzed: 'on te skye dgu mi 'dod na skye dgu ci bya /
translated: But if one does not accept the self, what is the point of the aggregates?

original: gang dag la 'jig rten 'di med cing 'jig rten gyi mi @212a * //
analyzed: gang dag la 'jig rten 'di med cing 'jig rten gyi mi @212a * //
translated: The Omniscient One has declared that those who do not have this world and the world beyond,

original: rtag pa nyid shes nas bdag gi rnal 'byor du gnas pa de dag la ni ji tsam du bdag tu chags pa yod pa de tsam du thar pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid shes nas bdag gi rnal 'byor du gnas pa de dag la ni ji tsam du bdag tu chags pa yod pa de tsam du thar pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: and who, knowing the impermanence of the world, abide in the yoga of the self, have no liberation to the extent that they are attached to the self.

original: bdag dang sems can la sogs pa ming ni rnam grangs kyi sgra bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can la sogs pa ming ni rnam grangs kyi sgra bcu gnyis te /
translated: The self, sentient beings, and so on are twelve synonyms.

original: mu stegs byed kyi thar par kun brtags pa de dag rtag la gzugs la sogs pa gzhan ni mi rtag ba'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi thar par kun brtags pa de dag rtag la gzugs la sogs pa gzhan ni mi rtag ba'o zhes pa ste /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas imagine that liberation is permanent, while other things, such as form, are impermanent.

original: des na bdag tu mngon par chags pa'i phyi de dag thar par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag tu mngon par chags pa'i phyi de dag thar par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, those who are attached to the self will not attain liberation.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las /
translated: As the King of SamƒÅdhi S≈´tra says:

original: gang dag bdag gi 'du shes la ni gnas //
analyzed: gang dag bdag gi 'du shes la ni gnas //
translated: Those who abide in the conception of a self

original: de dag sdug bsngal la ni rab tu gnas //üîΩgang na sdug bsngal la ni min pa yi //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal la ni rab tu gnas // gang na sdug bsngal la ni min pa yi //
translated: Abide in suffering.üîΩThose who do not have a self

original: bdag med pa'i ni bdag mi shes so zhes //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ni bdag mi shes so zhes //
translated: Do not know the selflessness of suffering.

original: zhes pa'o // blo gros chen po mu stegs byed mi mkhas pa'i blo can kha cig ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag mthong ba dang / yon tan 'gyur ba byed pa po'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni ne yi ya yi ka dang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // blo gros chen po mu stegs byed mi mkhas pa'i blo can kha cig ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag mthong ba dang / yon tan 'gyur ba byed pa po'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni ne yi ya yi ka dang /
translated: MahƒÅmati, some tƒ´rthikas, who are unwise, imagine nirvƒÅ·πáa to be the creator that is the transformation of the qualities of the nature and the person.

original: khyad par can rnams kyi yul las shin tu skye ste /
analyzed: khyad par can rnams kyi yul las shin tu skye ste /
translated: It is produced from the object of the special ones.

original: rtag par bdag tu spyor zhing rang gi yon tan blo la sogs pa khas blangs par sngar smras pa rnams yongs su spang ba'i phyir thar pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rtag par bdag tu spyor zhing rang gi yon tan blo la sogs pa khas blangs par sngar smras pa rnams yongs su spang ba'i phyir thar pa'o zhes so //
translated: Liberation is for the sake of completely abandoning the previously mentioned assertions of the self, which is always engaged in the self, and the qualities of the self, such as intelligence.

original: grangs can rnams ni mi mkhas pa'i blo can du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: grangs can rnams ni mi mkhas pa'i blo can du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Omniscient One has said that the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas are unwise.

original: sgra la sogs par dmigs pa'i yon tan skyes bus bye brag tu mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs par dmigs pa'i yon tan skyes bus bye brag tu mthong ba ste /
translated: The qualities that are observed in sound and so on are seen to be distinct from the person.

original: gtso ni skyes bu'i don yin par rtog go //
analyzed: gtso ni skyes bu'i don yin par rtog go //
translated: The person is conceived to be the purpose of the qualities.

original: tshor ba can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi khyad par yongs su shes par gyur du zin kyang re lde dang rtsig pa'i khyad par bzhin te /
analyzed: tshor ba can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi khyad par yongs su shes par gyur du zin kyang re lde dang rtsig pa'i khyad par bzhin te /
translated: Even if the person comes to know the distinctions of objects such as form, it is like the distinctions of a fence and a wall.

original: bdag tu chags pa ma log pa'i bar du /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa ma log pa'i bar du /
translated: Until attachment to the self is reversed,

original: de tsam gyis thar par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de tsam gyis thar par 'gyur ram /
translated: is liberation attained by that alone?

original: bsam pa med pa'i yon tan rnams byed pa po yin gyi bsam pa yod pa ni byed pa po ma yin no zhes pas na mi mkhas pa'i blo can no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med pa'i yon tan rnams byed pa po yin gyi bsam pa yod pa ni byed pa po ma yin no zhes pas na mi mkhas pa'i blo can no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The wise have no intention of saying that the qualities are the agent when they are without intention, but that the qualities are not the agent when they are with intention.

original: rang bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi mtshan nyid du yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid dang / skyes bu'i longs spyod dang / yul gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi mtshan nyid du yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid dang / skyes bu'i longs spyod dang / yul gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the qualities is the nature of the three qualities, which are goodness, activity, and darkness. The nature of the object is the enjoyment of the person.

original: blos rtogs pa'i don ni skyes bus tshor ro zhes grangs can rnams kyis rtog go //
analyzed: blos rtogs pa'i don ni skyes bus tshor ro zhes grangs can rnams kyis rtog go //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine that the object that is understood by the intellect is experienced by the person.

original: de'i tshe na @212b yang yul gdon mi za bar yongs su bcad pa ni bsam pa dang bcas pa la ni rigs pas na blo dang skyes bu ji ltar na tha dad par rung zhes bya bar bar ti ka las zhib tu rtsod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na @212b yang yul gdon mi za bar yongs su bcad pa ni bsam pa dang bcas pa la ni rigs pas na blo dang skyes bu ji ltar na tha dad par rung zhes bya bar bar ti ka las zhib tu rtsod do //
translated: At that time, since the object is necessarily ascertained, it is reasonable that the person is with intention. Therefore, how can the intellect and the person be different? This is argued in detail in the Subcommentary.

original: kha cig ni bsod nams ma yin pa yongs su zad pas zhes pa ni ji ltar rig sngags kyi bun da ka'i rgyud las /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsod nams ma yin pa yongs su zad pas zhes pa ni ji ltar rig sngags kyi bun da ka'i rgyud las /
translated: As the Tantra of the Knowledge-Mantra of the Mound says:

original: rnal 'byor gyis ni gtsub gtan gtsub shing ni //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis ni gtsub gtan gtsub shing ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThe yogi, with the fire-stick of the mind,

original: zhes bsregs pa mtha' med pa gsod sdig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bsregs pa mtha' med pa gsod sdig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: burns the fuel of the aggregates, and the fire of knowledge is the means of destroying the evil of killing, and so on.

original: ji ltar ba dza sa na ya ka las byung ba'i rig sngags ni rig sngags ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ba dza sa na ya ka las byung ba'i rig sngags ni rig sngags ma yin no //
translated: As the VajrasamƒÅdhi S≈´tra says: The knowledge-mantra that comes from the VajrasamƒÅdhi is not a knowledge-mantra.

original: mchod sbyin ni mchod sbyin ma yin no //
analyzed: mchod sbyin ni mchod sbyin ma yin no //
translated: Sacrifice is not a sacrifice.

original: pha ni pha ma yin no //
analyzed: pha ni pha ma yin no //
translated: Father is not a father.üîΩMother is not a mother.

original: ma ni ma ma yin no zhes bya ba des rku ba mi rku bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma ni ma ma yin no zhes bya ba des rku ba mi rku bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, stealing is not stealing.

original: gdol bu ni gdol bu ma yin no //
analyzed: gdol bu ni gdol bu ma yin no //
translated: The outcaste is not an outcaste.

original: sme sha can ni sme sha can ma yin no //
analyzed: sme sha can ni sme sha can ma yin no //
translated: The untouchable is not an untouchable.üîΩThe Brahmin is not a Brahmin.üîΩAnd so on. Whoever does not see duality, that is nondual knowledge.

original: bram ze ni bram ze ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par gang gnyis su mi mthong ba de nyid na ye shes mi gnyis pa'o zhes pa ni bdag tu chags pa log pa na sdig pa yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze ni bram ze ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs par gang gnyis su mi mthong ba de nyid na ye shes mi gnyis pa'o zhes pa ni bdag tu chags pa log pa na sdig pa yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: When attachment to self is reversed, demerit is exhausted.

original: zhi ba la rtog pa ni /
analyzed: zhi ba la rtog pa ni /
translated: The idea of peace is as follows:üîΩThe Lord has said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'byung gcig gi / bsod nams sdig pa zad par byed //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'byung gcig gi / bsod nams sdig pa zad par byed //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has destroyed merit and sin

original: 'byung dang 'dra ba'i thar pa med //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'dra ba'i thar pa med //
translated: has no liberation like the one who has arisen.

original: yi ge phyi mo mtshungs rig med //
analyzed: yi ge phyi mo mtshungs rig med //
translated: There is no knowledge of the similarity of the letters.

original: gal te bdag tu chags pa med pa ma yin par rab tu byung bas sdig pa ldog par 'gyur na ni lhas rjes su bzung ba tsam du bzhag gi 'dod chags dang ma bral bar ni thar par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te bdag tu chags pa med pa ma yin par rab tu byung bas sdig pa ldog par 'gyur na ni lhas rjes su bzung ba tsam du bzhag gi 'dod chags dang ma bral bar ni thar par mi rung ngo //
translated: If the merit and sin of the one who has gone forth were to be destroyed without the absence of attachment to self, then it would be posited that they are sustained by the gods. But it is not suitable for them to be liberated without freedom from attachment.

original: kha cig ni nyon mongs pa zad par shes pas zhes pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa med par phyi rol gyi 'dod chags dag bral ba rnams kyi ye shes kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zad du zin kyang bdag tu chags pas na phyi
analyzed: kha cig ni nyon mongs pa zad par shes pas zhes pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa med par phyi rol gyi 'dod chags dag bral ba rnams kyi ye shes kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zad du zin kyang bdag tu chags pas na phyi
translated: Some say: ‚ÄúThe one who has destroyed the afflictions through knowledge‚Äù means that without the analysis of wisdom, the external objects of attachment are separated from the knowledge of those who are free from attachment. Even though the afflictions such as attachment are destroyed, because of attachment to self,

original: rol gyi rnams la thar pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rol gyi rnams la thar pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: the external objects are not liberated. This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore:

original: srid la chags med bsam gtan pa //
analyzed: srid la chags med bsam gtan pa //
translated: The one who is detached from existence and absorbed in concentration

original: srid pa'i thog mar phyin pa yang //
analyzed: srid pa'i thog mar phyin pa yang //
translated: And they go to the beginning of existence.

original: nga rgyal lcags kyus drangs nas su //
analyzed: nga rgyal lcags kyus drangs nas su //
translated: They are dragged by the hook of pride

original: sems can dmyal bar yang lhung ngo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar yang lhung ngo //
translated: and fall into the hells.

original: kha cig ni 'jig rten rnams ni dbang pos rang dbang du byas par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa rtog go zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig rten rnams ni dbang pos rang dbang du byas par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa rtog go zhes pa ni /
translated: Some imagine that nirvana is the world‚Äôs independence, since they see that the world is independent of the senses.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal bde ba la //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal bde ba la //
translated: The suffering of the self is not the suffering of the other.

original: skye bo mi shes dbang byar med //üîΩ@213a * // ngan song ngam ni mtho ris su //
analyzed: skye bo mi shes dbang byar med // @213a * // ngan song ngam ni mtho ris su //
translated: People are not independent of ignorance.üîΩLike a puppet moved by strings,

original: dbang pos bskyod pa bzhin du 'gro //üîΩde ste dbang po'i tshig btsan te //
analyzed: dbang pos bskyod pa bzhin du 'gro // de ste dbang po'i tshig btsan te //
translated: they go to the lower realms or to the higher realms.üîΩIf the senses were independent,

original: mtho ris dang thar pa la sogs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dbang po de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad nyid cis na thar par mi 'gro //
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa la sogs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dbang po de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad nyid cis na thar par mi 'gro //
translated: then everyone would be liberated, since the senses are free of attachment.

original: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na ni de la yang nyon mongs pa dang mi shes pa'i sdug bsngal sus byas /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na ni de la yang nyon mongs pa dang mi shes pa'i sdug bsngal sus byas /
translated: If they are not free of attachment, then who creates the suffering of the afflictions and ignorance?

original: de'i phyir dbang pos 'jig rten la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa byed pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang pos 'jig rten la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties do not cause pleasure and pain in the world.

original: yongs su dag pa zhig na ni thal bas skud pa dang / ral pa 'chang ba dang ; lhab lhub sna tshogs pa'i gar dang glu la sogs pas dbang bo mgu ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa zhig na ni thal bas skud pa dang / ral pa 'chang ba dang ; lhab lhub sna tshogs pa'i gar dang glu la sogs pas dbang bo mgu ste /
translated: If they were pure, then the world would be led to liberation by the pleasure of wearing garlands, perfumes, and ointments, and by the pleasure of dancing, singing, and playing music.

original: cis na thar par khrid /
analyzed: cis na thar par khrid /
translated: Why would it be necessary to lead it by the unpleasant?

original: des na rtag pa dang bdag tu chags pa'i sred pa dang ma bral ba ni mi rung gi /'dod chags dang bral ba la thar par rung ngo //
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang bdag tu chags pa'i sred pa dang ma bral ba ni mi rung gi /'dod chags dang bral ba la thar par rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable for those who are not free from craving for permanence and the self, but it is suitable for those who are free from craving.

original: kha cig ni 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba 'di ni gcig gis gcig zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba 'di ni gcig gis gcig zhugs pa ste /
translated: Some think that the origin of the world is one thing entering another.

original: rgyu las ma yin no zhes de la rgyu la mngon par chags pa bzhin du gti mug pas khong du mi chud de de khong du ma chud pas /
analyzed: rgyu las ma yin no zhes de la rgyu la mngon par chags pa bzhin du gti mug pas khong du mi chud de de khong du ma chud pas /
translated: They do not understand this through delusion, as if they were attached to a cause.üîΩNot understanding this, they imagine that nirvana is nonexistence.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni med par rtog go zhes pa ni skye ba'i skye bo rnams kyis las kyi mtshan ma dang skye ba'i ma yang rgyu /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni med par rtog go zhes pa ni skye ba'i skye bo rnams kyis las kyi mtshan ma dang skye ba'i ma yang rgyu /
translated: The world is born from the signs of karma and from the mother of birth.

original: rgyu gang med pas thar par 'gyur ba de khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: rgyu gang med pas thar par 'gyur ba de khong du mi chud do //
translated: They do not understand that liberation is due to the absence of any cause.

original: bdag la chags pa yod na las byed do //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa yod na las byed do //
translated: If there is attachment to self, one performs actions.

original: bdag med par shes pas mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag med par shes pas mi byed do //
translated: If one knows that there is no self, one does not perform actions.

original: bdag tu chags pa yod na ni ji ltar na las byed par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩlas su smra ba po rnams kyis bdag las kyi sgrib pa las 'grol bar 'gyur ro zhes de cis na brjod /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa yod na ni ji ltar na las byed par mi 'gyur ro // las su smra ba po rnams kyis bdag las kyi sgrib pa las 'grol bar 'gyur ro zhes de cis na brjod /
translated: If there is attachment to self, how could one not perform actions?üîΩHow do the proponents of karma say that one is freed from the obscurations of karma?

original: ji ltar las kyi rgyus skye ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar las kyi rgyus skye ba ste /
translated: It is due to the cause of karma that one is born.

original: las mi byed na skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: las mi byed na skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: If one does not perform karma, one will not be born.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyu ni bdag med par rig par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyu ni bdag med par rig par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs par brtag go //
translated: The root cause of nirvana should be known as selflessness. This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: blo gros chen po mu stegs byed kha cig ni bden pa'i lam khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni ji ltar ne yi ya yi kas rtog pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po mu stegs byed kha cig ni bden pa'i lam khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni ji ltar ne yi ya yi kas rtog pa ste /
translated: Some tƒ´rthikas imagine that by understanding the path of truth, one attains nirvana. This is like the NyƒÅyƒÅ‚Äôs conception.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i nyes pa ni log pa'i shes pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i nyes pa ni log pa'i shes pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The fault of the arising of suffering is due to the false views.

original: yang nas yang du lhung bar byed do //
analyzed: yang nas yang du lhung bar byed do //
translated: They cause one to fall again and again.

original: de ltar mtshan mar sbyor ba med na thar pa'o zhes @213b so ;
analyzed: de ltar mtshan mar sbyor ba med na thar pa'o zhes @213b so ;
translated: Thus, if one does not engage in the practice of signs, there is liberation.

original: / las 'byung na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / rgud pa dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: / las 'byung na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / rgud pa dang / 'chi ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: If action arises, there is the suffering of birth, old age, disease, and death.

original: las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pas byed do //
analyzed: las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pas byed do //
translated: And action is done by desire, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni log pa'i shes pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni log pa'i shes pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Desire, etc. arise from false views.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa yongs su shes pas log pa'i shes pa spang ngo zhes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa yongs su shes pas log pa'i shes pa spang ngo zhes so //
translated: False views are eliminated by the thorough knowledge of impermanence, suffering, and the ugly.

original: de lta bur bden pa'i shes pa thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bur bden pa'i shes pa thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One has taught the knowledge of reality.

original: 'on kyang de dag la bdag med pa'i ye shes med pas de bzhin du bdag tu chags pa'i phyir las dang skye ba ji ltar na ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la bdag med pa'i ye shes med pas de bzhin du bdag tu chags pa'i phyir las dang skye ba ji ltar na ldog par 'gyur /
translated: But, since they do not have the knowledge of selflessness, how can they turn away from action and birth, since they are attached to a self?

original: kha cig ni yon tan dang yon tan can mngon par khong du chud cing gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes pa ni khyad par can rnams kyis bdag gi yon tan dgu rtsa ba nas bcad na yon tan can bdag mthar ro zhes rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni yon tan dang yon tan can mngon par khong du chud cing gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga ma yin par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes pa ni khyad par can rnams kyis bdag gi yon tan dgu rtsa ba nas bcad na yon tan can bdag mthar ro zhes rtog go //
translated: The Vaisheshikas think that if the nine qualities of the self are completely eliminated, the self, the possessor of qualities, is finally destroyed.

original: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams gcig pa'i phyir tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i chud pa mtshungs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug rnams yon tan gcig pa yongs su spangs nas thar pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams gcig pa'i phyir tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i chud pa mtshungs pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug rnams yon tan gcig pa yongs su spangs nas thar pa'o zhes so //
translated: The non-dualists say that since Brahma, Indra, and so on are identical, happiness, suffering, and delusion are a single quality that is completely abandoned in liberation.

original: ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: lha yi 'di ni yon tan can //
analyzed: lha yi 'di ni yon tan can //
translated: This is the quality of the gods.

original: nga yi sgyu ma rgal dka' bar //
analyzed: nga yi sgyu ma rgal dka' bar //
translated: My illusion is difficult to cross.

original: de ltar nga la su rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar nga la su rtogs 'gyur //
translated: In that way, who will understand me?

original: de dag sgyu ma 'di las rgal //
analyzed: de dag sgyu ma 'di las rgal //
translated: They have crossed over this illusion.

original: zhes so // de bzhin du dbang po'i sgyu ma ni byed pa'i mthu ste /
analyzed: zhes so // de bzhin du dbang po'i sgyu ma ni byed pa'i mthu ste /
translated: Likewise, the magic of the senses is the power of action.

original: skyes bu dang / bud med kyi nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i tha dad pas phye ba ni 'ching bar 'jug go //
analyzed: skyes bu dang / bud med kyi nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i tha dad pas phye ba ni 'ching bar 'jug go //
translated: The twenty-four divisions of male and female are differentiated as entering into bondage.

original: shes pa'i mthus thar pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i mthus thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is by the power of knowledge.

original: gnyis kar smra ba ni gnyis su smra ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis kar smra ba ni gnyis su smra ba'o //
translated: The dualists are those who speak of duality.

original: gnyis ka'i ma yin par smra ba ni gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin par smra ba ksha pa na ka ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i ma yin par smra ba ni gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin par smra ba ksha pa na ka ste /
translated: The non-dualists are those who speak of neither duality nor non-duality, the Kshattriyas.

original: bdag dang / byed pa po dang / phyi rol du lta bar smra ba de dag la bdag tu chags pa yod kyi /
analyzed: bdag dang / byed pa po dang / phyi rol du lta bar smra ba de dag la bdag tu chags pa yod kyi /
translated: Those who speak of the self, the agent, and external views have attachment to the self.

original: bdag med pa'i ye shes med pas na 'khor ba ji ltar na yongs su zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ye shes med pas na 'khor ba ji ltar na yongs su zad par 'gyur /
translated: Since they do not have the wisdom of selflessness, how can their sa·πÉsƒÅra be completely exhausted?

original: kha cig ni rang bzhin las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi phyogs nyid brtag ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni rang bzhin las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi phyogs nyid brtag ste /
translated: Some say it is from nature, and so on. This is the LokƒÅyata position itself.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po 'di dang / rang bzhin las 'byung ba de bzhin du rnam par 'jig pa ni thar pa'o zhes so //üîΩde @214a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po 'di dang / rang bzhin las 'byung ba de bzhin du rnam par 'jig pa ni thar pa'o zhes so // de @214a * //
