translated: Just as this thing is, so is its origination from a cause, and so is its cessation.

original: ni skyes ma thag pa la dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan kun rtogs bas sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: ni skyes ma thag pa la dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan kun rtogs bas sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: This is inferred from the fact that the newborn experiences pleasure, fear, and sorrow, and from the fact that it has instincts.

original: sred pa dang bcas pa nyid ni skye ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mi skye bar mthong ba'i phyir des na sred pa yongs su zad na thar par dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: sred pa dang bcas pa nyid ni skye ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mi skye bar mthong ba'i phyir des na sred pa yongs su zad na thar par dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The meaning of the statement that liberation is the complete destruction of craving is to be inferred from the fact that one who is free from craving is not born again.

original: gzhan du skye ba rjes su dpag pa ni lan du mar bshad pa yin no //üîΩkha cig ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga khong du chud pas zhes pa ni grangs can rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan du skye ba rjes su dpag pa ni lan du mar bshad pa yin no // kha cig ni de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga khong du chud pas zhes pa ni grangs can rnams te /
translated: The inference of rebirth has been explained many times.üîΩSome understand the twenty-five principles.

original: kha cig ni dbang por 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang por 'dod pa ste /
translated: Some assert that the self is the sense organs.

original: kha cig ni dbang po mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang po mi 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that the self is not the sense organs.

original: de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga'i steng du dbang po ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga'i steng du dbang po ste /
translated: The self is the twenty-five principles plus the sense organs.

original: byed pa dang bcas pa dang / byed pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur rtog go //
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas pa dang / byed pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur rtog go //
translated: and that which has an operation and that which does not have an operation are imagined to be the cause of nirvana.

original: kho na shes pa nyi shu lnga //
analyzed: kho na shes pa nyi shu lnga //
translated: The twenty-five principles are the object of knowledge.

original: gnas ni gar dang gar yang rung //
analyzed: gnas ni gar dang gar yang rung //
translated: The place is anywhere at all.

original: mgo bregs ral pa phud bu can //
analyzed: mgo bregs ral pa phud bu can //
translated: The one who has shaved his head and face,

original: grol ba der ni gdon mi za //
analyzed: grol ba der ni gdon mi za //
translated: is liberated there, no doubt.

original: zhes pa ni spyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyir ro //
translated: This is the general teaching.

original: dbang por mi smra ba rnams ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag shes pas thar pa zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: dbang por mi smra ba rnams ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag shes pas thar pa zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Those who do not speak of the senses say that liberation is the knowledge of the nature and the particularities of the person.

original: de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga la sems pa ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid nyi shu rtsa lnga la sems pa ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The twenty-five principles are the nature of the person.

original: sems stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa mnyam pa'i dus na gtso bo gtso las chen po ste /
analyzed: sems stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa mnyam pa'i dus na gtso bo gtso las chen po ste /
translated: When the mind, strength, passion, and darkness are in balance, the primal matter is the great one.

original: de ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
translated: That is a synonym for intellect.

original: chen po las nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: chen po las nga rgyal lo //
translated: From the great one comes the I-principle.

original: nga rgyal las sgra la sogs pa'i yul de tsam lnga'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal las sgra la sogs pa'i yul de tsam lnga'o //
translated: From the I-principle come the five subtle objects, sound, etc.

original: de tsam lnga las 'byung ba lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yid de grangs can gyi lo rgyus so //
analyzed: de tsam lnga las 'byung ba lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yid de grangs can gyi lo rgyus so //
translated: The five elements are derived from the five subtle elements, the five sense faculties of the mind, the five faculties of action, and the mind. This is the history of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: khyad par can gyi bye brag ni blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / nan tan dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / 'du byed rnams bdag gi yon tan dgu zad na thar pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi bye brag ni blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa dang / zhe sdang dang / nan tan dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / 'du byed rnams bdag gi yon tan dgu zad na thar pa'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika say that liberation is the exhaustion of the nine qualities of the self: cognition, pleasure, pain, desire, hatred, effort, merit, demerit, and activity.

original: grangs can rnams kyi ni yon tan dang skyes bu'i khyad par mthong bas so //üîΩkha cig ni skye dgu skyong ba dang / yon tan drug bstan pa 'dzin pas mya ngan las 'das pa rtog go zhes pa ni bdag gi don spangs la /
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyi ni yon tan dang skyes bu'i khyad par mthong bas so // kha cig ni skye dgu skyong ba dang / yon tan drug bstan pa 'dzin pas mya ngan las 'das pa rtog go zhes pa ni bdag gi don spangs la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya say that it is seeing the difference between the qualities and the person.üîΩSome imagine nirvƒÅ·πáa as protecting the people and upholding the teaching of the six qualities.

original: gzhan gyi don du bsam pa dag cing snying rje can gyi skye dgu skyong bas yon tan drug bstan pa 'dzin pa'i phyir thar pa zhes te sdug bsngal zad par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bsam pa dag cing snying rje can gyi skye dgu skyong bas yon tan drug bstan pa 'dzin pa'i phyir thar pa zhes te sdug bsngal zad par brtags pa'o //
translated: They say that liberation is the exhaustion of suffering because of protecting the people with pure intention and compassion for the sake of others and upholding the teaching of the six qualities.

original: yon tan drug ni 'jal du ma dang / 'thab pa dang / chab dang / 'khod ba dang / rten pa dang / rnam pa gnyis @214b kyi dngos po chos kyi tshul gyis cis na tshe gzhan las thar zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra'i don las dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: yon tan drug ni 'jal du ma dang / 'thab pa dang / chab dang / 'khod ba dang / rten pa dang / rnam pa gnyis @214b kyi dngos po chos kyi tshul gyis cis na tshe gzhan las thar zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra'i don las dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The six qualities are: the unmeasured, the battle, the water, the standing, the support, and the two aspects.  By the method of the Dharma, why is there liberation from another life?  The meaning of the words of omniscience should be understood as the intended meaning.

original: kha cig ni byed pa po dus ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar dus kyi mthu las skye ba de ltar dus gzhan du thar pa zhes te 'bras bu 'byung ba nyid thar pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni byed pa po dus ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar dus kyi mthu las skye ba de ltar dus gzhan du thar pa zhes te 'bras bu 'byung ba nyid thar pa'o //
translated: Some say: Because the agent is seen at an untimely moment, and so on.  Just as arising occurs by the power of time, so liberation occurs at another time.  The occurrence of the effect itself is liberation.

original: ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa /
translated: As it is said by one who desires to be included:

original: srog dang srog min dbugs snyoms nas //
analyzed: srog dang srog min dbugs snyoms nas //
translated: Having equalized life and non-life,

original: sna yi nang du rgyu bar byed //
analyzed: sna yi nang du rgyu bar byed //
translated: It moves within the nose.

original: dbang po yid dang blo yang bsdams //
analyzed: dbang po yid dang blo yang bsdams //
translated: The senses, mind, and intellect are also restrained.

original: thub pa'i thar par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa'i thar par gnas pa'o //
translated: The sage abides in liberation.

original: zhes so // lha chen pos kyang smras pa /
analyzed: zhes so // lha chen pos kyang smras pa /
translated: And the Great God also says:

original: rnam par snyoms pa'i dbugs kyis ni //
analyzed: rnam par snyoms pa'i dbugs kyis ni //
translated: By the breath of equality,

original: zhags pa sus ni mchod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: zhags pa sus ni mchod mi 'gyur //
translated: Who would worship the noose?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: bdag tu chags pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la /
translated: One who is free from the attachment of self-love

original: las dang skye ba las thar bar rung ngo //
analyzed: las dang skye ba las thar bar rung ngo //
translated: is fit to be liberated from action and birth.üîΩSome, Mahamati, by existence,

original: blo gros chen po kha cig ni srid pas so zhes pa ni ci ltar mchod sbyin gyis mchod par gyur pas de dag go //
analyzed: blo gros chen po kha cig ni srid pas so zhes pa ni ci ltar mchod sbyin gyis mchod par gyur pas de dag go //
translated: as when one is worshipped by a sacrifice, so are they.

original: gang 'dir lta dang ldan pa'i yon ni mtho ris su mtho'o //
analyzed: gang 'dir lta dang ldan pa'i yon ni mtho ris su mtho'o //
translated: Here, those endowed with views are exalted in heaven.

original: gos sbyin pa ni nyi ma dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: gos sbyin pa ni nyi ma dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: The gift of clothing is together with the sun.

original: gser dngul sbyin pa ni de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi za zhing de tshe mtha' med pa'o //
analyzed: gser dngul sbyin pa ni de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi za zhing de tshe mtha' med pa'o //
translated: The gift of gold and silver is the eating of the nectar of reality, and then the end of life is endless.üîΩSome, Mahamati, by non-existence,

original: kha cig ni srid pa med pas so zhes pa ni khrus dang sbyin sreg la sogs par thar pa rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni srid pa med pas so zhes pa ni khrus dang sbyin sreg la sogs par thar pa rtog go //
translated: imagine liberation in bathing, burnt offerings, and so on.

original: gang g'a chu dang de bzhin mchod //
analyzed: gang g'a chu dang de bzhin mchod //
translated: The Ganges water and likewise worship,

original: gang g'a rgya mtsho 'dres par ni //
analyzed: gang g'a rgya mtsho 'dres par ni //
translated: where the Ganges mixes with the ocean,

original: khrus byed de dag mtho ris 'gro //
analyzed: khrus byed de dag mtho ris 'gro //
translated: those who bathe there go to heaven.

original: shi ba de dag yang srid med //
analyzed: shi ba de dag yang srid med //
translated: Those who die have no further existence.

original: ces pa la bdag tu chags pa ni las dang skye ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ces pa la bdag tu chags pa ni las dang skye ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Here, attachment to self is the cause of action and birth.

original: de la ma chags pa ni thar bar rung ngo //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni thar bar rung ngo //
translated: Without attachment to that, liberation is possible.

original: yid lta dpa' bor gnas shing ni //
analyzed: yid lta dpa' bor gnas shing ni //
translated: The mind, like a hero, remains

original: rnal 'byor brtson pa'i 'gro ba gang //üîΩgang g'a ya mun 'dres pa la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor brtson pa'i 'gro ba gang // gang g'a ya mun 'dres pa la //
translated: in the world of those who strive in yoga.üîΩIf one throws away one's life

original: srog 'dor de yi 'gro ba de //
analyzed: srog 'dor de yi 'gro ba de //
translated: in the mixture of the Ganges and YamunƒÅ,

original: nam zhig dus kyi rnam grangs kyis //
analyzed: nam zhig dus kyi rnam grangs kyis //
translated: At some point in time,

original: b'a r'a na s'ir gal te 'gro //
analyzed: b'a r'a na s'ir gal te 'gro //
translated: if one goes to VƒÅrƒÅ·πáasƒ´,

original: rdo bas rkang pa gnyis bcag ste //
analyzed: rdo bas rkang pa gnyis bcag ste //
translated: one's feet will be broken by a stone

original: de nyid du ni 'chi bar bya //
analyzed: de nyid du ni 'chi bar bya //
translated: and one will die right there.

original: bram ze gsod la sogs pa'i mi //
analyzed: bram ze gsod la sogs pa'i mi //
translated: Those who kill brahmins and so on

original: der bkrus nas ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: der bkrus nas ni rnam par grol //
translated: are liberated by bathing there.

original: srin ma phye ma leb rnams kyang //
analyzed: srin ma phye ma leb rnams kyang //
translated: Even lice and butterflies

original: shi ba grol bar gdon mi za //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: shi ba grol bar gdon mi za // zhes pa ste /
translated: are liberated when they die.

original: de de lta bur 'khru bas srid pa med par rtog go //
analyzed: de de lta bur 'khru bas srid pa med par rtog go //
translated: Thus, they imagine that by bathing in that way, there is no existence.üîΩ By mantra, too, one is liberated from the higher realms and the abode of the demigods.

original: sngags kyis kyang mtho ris dang sde dang bral ba'i gnas te ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa /
analyzed: sngags kyis kyang mtho ris dang sde dang bral ba'i gnas te ji ltar gtogs 'dod kyis smras pa /
translated: As it is said by KƒÅma,

original: nga yi rjes su dran pas @215a * //
analyzed: nga yi rjes su dran pas @215a * //
translated: By remembering me,

original: ni // bram ze gsad pa'i sdig byed nas //
analyzed: ni // bram ze gsad pa'i sdig byed nas //
translated: From the sin of killing a Brahmin,

original: lus ni bor nas rab 'gro ba //
analyzed: lus ni bor nas rab 'gro ba //
translated: Having cast off the body, he goes forth,

original: de ni 'gro ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
translated: He goes to the highest state of existence.

original: zhes gtogs 'dod kyis mtho ris dang thar pa dang srid pa med par brtags par brtag go //
analyzed: zhes gtogs 'dod kyis mtho ris dang thar pa dang srid pa med par brtags par brtag go //
translated: Thus, the desire to belong should be examined as heaven, liberation, and non-existence.

original: lha chen pos kyang smras pa /
analyzed: lha chen pos kyang smras pa /
translated: The Great God also said:

original: 'chi ba'i dus ni byung ba na //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus ni byung ba na //
translated: When the time of death has come,

original: rig sngags chen po gcig la sogs //
analyzed: rig sngags chen po gcig la sogs //
translated: By the power of a single great mantra,

original: mis ni yid la bsams gyur na //
analyzed: mis ni yid la bsams gyur na //
translated: If a person thinks of it,

original: lus zhig nas ni zhi ba dang // lhan cig sbyor 'gro gdon mi za //üîΩdgu bdag la sogs sngags chen no //
analyzed: lus zhig nas ni zhi ba dang // lhan cig sbyor 'gro gdon mi za // dgu bdag la sogs sngags chen no //
translated: After the body is destroyed, he will go to peace and union, there is no doubt.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The great mantras such as Navagraha and others,

original: de'i phyir yang smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is also said:

original: 'jig rten rgyu dang mi rgyu ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyu dang mi rgyu ba //
translated: The world, moving and unmoving,

original: chang btung la sogs skyon rnams kyis //
analyzed: chang btung la sogs skyon rnams kyis //
translated: By the faults of drinking alcohol and so on,

original: mi rigs par ni byas na yang //
analyzed: mi rigs par ni byas na yang //
translated: Even if done wrongly,

original: yang dag rigs nyid mi gos so //üîΩtshangs spyod stsogs pas lus la ni //
analyzed: yang dag rigs nyid mi gos so // tshangs spyod stsogs pas lus la ni //
translated: The true nature is not stained.üîΩBy austerities and so on, why torment the body?

original: gdung bar ci phyir bya zhig gu / yongs shes pas ni de dag grol //
analyzed: gdung bar ci phyir bya zhig gu / yongs shes pas ni de dag grol //
translated: By perfect knowledge, they are liberated.

original: de dag la ni gzir 'gyur med //
analyzed: de dag la ni gzir 'gyur med //
translated: They are not tormented by them.

original: des na srid pa med pa yongs su shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i snga ma'i phyogs su dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na srid pa med pa yongs su shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i snga ma'i phyogs su dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the nonexistence of existence is the position of the omniscient one in the past.

original: sngags dang khrus la sogs pas sred pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog na ni de'i tshe sdig pa yongs su zad de thar par rung ngo //
analyzed: sngags dang khrus la sogs pas sred pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog na ni de'i tshe sdig pa yongs su zad de thar par rung ngo //
translated: If craving, attachment, and so on, the afflictions, are eliminated by means of mantras, bathing, and so on, then at that time, since sin is completely exhausted, liberation is possible.

original: des na der zhi ba rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: des na der zhi ba rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: Therefore, the peacemakers there said:

original: srid zhi'i rgyus ni grol ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid zhi'i rgyus ni grol ba'i phyir //
translated: Since one is liberated by the cause of existence and peace,

original: shes pa med cing sdom pa'ang med //
analyzed: shes pa med cing sdom pa'ang med //
translated: there is no knowledge and no vow.

original: des na lkugs la sogs pa rnams //
analyzed: des na lkugs la sogs pa rnams //
translated: Therefore, the mute and so on

original: der bzhugs bskal par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: der bzhugs bskal par brjod pa'o //
translated: dwell there for an eon.

original: sngags kyi rnal 'byor la sogs pa grub pa rnams la ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par med pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i snga ma'i phyogs su dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rnal 'byor la sogs pa grub pa rnams la ni srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par med pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i snga ma'i phyogs su dgongs pa'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the distinction between existence and peace for those who have achieved the yoga of mantra and so on is the position of the omniscient one in the past.

original: ji ltar pa tan dza lis smras pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar pa tan dza lis smras pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said by PƒÅ·πá·∏çarƒÅ:

original: sman dang / nor bu dang / sngags dang / ting nge 'dzin las tshe gcig gis dngos grub skye'o //
analyzed: sman dang / nor bu dang / sngags dang / ting nge 'dzin las tshe gcig gis dngos grub skye'o //
translated: The power of the mantra is the power of the mantra of the Buddha, the mantra of the Bodhisattva, the mantra of the gods, the mantra of the nagas, the mantra of the yakshas, the mantra of the gandharvas, the mantra of the asuras, the mantra of the garudas, the mantra of the kinnaras, the mantra of the mahoragas, the mantra of the rakshasas, the mantra of the pisacas, the mantra of the bhutas, the mantra of the kumbhandas, the mantra of the vetalas, the mantra of the humans, the mantra of the non-humans, the mantra of the herbs, the mantra of the jewels, the mantra of the samadhi.

original: kha cig ni tshe gnyis po nyid la dngos grub ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshe gnyis po nyid la dngos grub ste /
translated: Some say that power is in two lives.

original: goms par spro ba'i dang srong ni thams cad shes par 'gyur ro zhes thos pa'o //
analyzed: goms par spro ba'i dang srong ni thams cad shes par 'gyur ro zhes thos pa'o //
translated: Those who are diligent in practice will attain it in all lives, so it is heard.

original: der de lta bu la ni rtsod pa med pa bde bar gshegs pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: der de lta bu la ni rtsod pa med pa bde bar gshegs pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: There is no dispute about this, because the Sugatas are distinguished by their selflessness.

original: rje'u'i kha zas kyi kha cig dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog dang / rtsa ba dang / sman la sogs pas dngos grub tu brjod do //
analyzed: rje'u'i kha zas kyi kha cig dang / 'bras bu dang / me tog dang / rtsa ba dang / sman la sogs pas dngos grub tu brjod do //
translated: Some say that power is in the food of the alms-bowl, in fruits, flowers, roots, herbs, etc.

original: @215b de bzhin du sman ras ya nas lus brtan pa'i dngos grub tu gyur pa yang rung /
analyzed: @215b de bzhin du sman ras ya nas lus brtan pa'i dngos grub tu gyur pa yang rung /
translated: Similarly, the power of the herb rasayana may be the power of the body.

original: 'khor ba ni bdag tu chags pa dang las kyi rgyu las te mi shes pa yongs su zad pa dang / skad cig mar 'jig pa'i shes rab kyis rung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni bdag tu chags pa dang las kyi rgyu las te mi shes pa yongs su zad pa dang / skad cig mar 'jig pa'i shes rab kyis rung ngo //
translated: Samsara is the cause of attachment to self and karma, but it is possible through the exhaustion of ignorance and the wisdom of momentary destruction.

original: nor bus ni nad med pa dang / cung zad cig zhi bar byed par 'gyur ba ni sngags dang dug sman la sogs pas kyang dug dang / 'dre sha za la sogs pa bsal bar yang rung na /
analyzed: nor bus ni nad med pa dang / cung zad cig zhi bar byed par 'gyur ba ni sngags dang dug sman la sogs pas kyang dug dang / 'dre sha za la sogs pa bsal bar yang rung na /
translated: Gems can cure diseases and pacify them a little, and even mantras, antidotes, and so forth can remove poisons, demons, flesh-eaters, and so on.

original: tshe'i bdag tu chags pa dang las kyi rgyu las 'byung ba bdag med par shes pas ldog go //
analyzed: tshe'i bdag tu chags pa dang las kyi rgyu las 'byung ba bdag med par shes pas ldog go //
translated: But by knowing that the lord of life and the cause of karma arise from selflessness, they are stopped.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dngos grub rnams ni de bzhin du lus yang pa'i phyir 'jig rten la sogs pa'i dngos grub mngon par shes pa lnga pa tan dza la'i rnal 'byor sdom pa dang / nges pa dang / bstan pa dang / srog gi 'bad pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dngos grub rnams ni de bzhin du lus yang pa'i phyir 'jig rten la sogs pa'i dngos grub mngon par shes pa lnga pa tan dza la'i rnal 'byor sdom pa dang / nges pa dang / bstan pa dang / srog gi 'bad pa dang /
translated: The accomplishments born from samadhi are also like that. Because the body is light, there are worldly accomplishments, such as the five higher perceptions, the yoga of the vows of Tanjila, certainty, teaching, striving with life,

original: phyis bsgrub pa dang / bsam gtan dang / 'dzin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / yan lag brgyad kyis grub pa yod par yang rung /
analyzed: phyis bsgrub pa dang / bsam gtan dang / 'dzin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / yan lag brgyad kyis grub pa yod par yang rung /
translated: accomplishment later, concentration, retention, samadhi, and accomplishment with the eight branches.

original: aa gasta dang / mchod sbyin shun lpags dang / sbron pa'i yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ni /
analyzed: aa gasta dang / mchod sbyin shun lpags dang / sbron pa'i yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor ni /
translated: There is also the yoga of the six branches of Agastya, Yagashuna, and the messenger.

original: srog 'bad de bzhin bsam gtan dang // phyis sgrub de nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: srog 'bad de bzhin bsam gtan dang // phyis sgrub de nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The life-force is the concentration, and then the practice, and then the retention.

original: rtog ge'i ting 'dzin de bzhin du //
analyzed: rtog ge'i ting 'dzin de bzhin du //
translated: The concentration of the intellect is just like that.

original: yan lag drug la rnal 'byor brjod //
analyzed: yan lag drug la rnal 'byor brjod //
translated: The yoga is said to be in the six limbs.

original: drang srod sa na ka'i rnal 'byor ni /
analyzed: drang srod sa na ka'i rnal 'byor ni /
translated: The yoga of the straight and crooked is

original: 'dzum pa phye ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'dzum pa phye ba de bzhin du //
translated: the opening of the smile, and just so,

original: thal mo tsam ni rnam shes bya //
analyzed: thal mo tsam ni rnam shes bya //
translated: the consciousness is known by the mere palm.

original: de bzhin bcu gnyis tsam po ni //
analyzed: de bzhin bcu gnyis tsam po ni //
translated: Just so, the twelve are

original: sgrog 'bad par ni mngon brjod bya //
analyzed: sgrog 'bad par ni mngon brjod bya //
translated: the proclamation, which is said to be the effort.

original: srog 'bad bcu gnyis 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: srog 'bad bcu gnyis 'dzin pa ste //
translated: The life-force is the twelve retentions,

original: 'dzin pa gnyis la'ang rnal 'byor yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis la'ang rnal 'byor yin //
translated: and the yoga is also in the two retentions.

original: de la rnal 'byor ldan pa la //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ldan pa la //
translated: The one who is endowed with the yoga in that

original: dbang phyug rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang phyug rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: will accomplish the supreme lord.

original: bdag gi mchog gi gzi brjid kyis //
analyzed: bdag gi mchog gi gzi brjid kyis //
translated: By the splendor of my supreme self,

original: des ni 'bar bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: des ni 'bar bar mthong ba'o //
translated: one sees the blazing.

original: zhes pa de bzhin du gsal zhing snang bar 'gyur ba yang rung ste rlung bkag pa na me skyed par byed do //
analyzed: zhes pa de bzhin du gsal zhing snang bar 'gyur ba yang rung ste rlung bkag pa na me skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, when the wind is blocked, fire is generated, whether it is clear and luminous or not.

original: rnam pa drug gi rnal 'byor gyis kyang rdza ma can gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa na ltor son pa'i rlung yang spyi bor gnas shing yang dag pa'i lus gong du khrid par byed do //üîΩde lta bu'i mngon par shes pa yod par yang rung na bdag tu chags pa'i rgyu las /
analyzed: rnam pa drug gi rnal 'byor gyis kyang rdza ma can gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa na ltor son pa'i rlung yang spyi bor gnas shing yang dag pa'i lus gong du khrid par byed do // de lta bu'i mngon par shes pa yod par yang rung na bdag tu chags pa'i rgyu las /
translated: Also, by the yoga of the six aspects, when one abides in the yoga of the pot, the wind that has entered the lower part of the body also abides in the head and leads the body to the higher state of perfection.

original: las dang tshe rnam par mi ldog pa snga ma bzhin no //üîΩlus @216a * //
analyzed: las dang tshe rnam par mi ldog pa snga ma bzhin no // lus @216a * //
translated: If one has such supernormal knowledge, it is possible that one will not turn back from karma and life, as before, due to the cause of attachment to self.

original: yang ba'i phyir nam mkhar 'phags shing 'bar ba dang / ring ba la sogs pa yongs su shes pas ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ba'i phyir nam mkhar 'phags shing 'bar ba dang / ring ba la sogs pa yongs su shes pas ma yin no //
translated: Because the body is light, one rises into the sky, blazes, and knows far and so on, but not by the power of the wind.

original: bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / 'o ma dang zas la sogs pa rnams la yang thar pa med pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / 'o ma dang zas la sogs pa rnams la yang thar pa med pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is no liberation in auspicious and inauspicious things, in milk, food, and so on?

original: shes rab kyis dpyad par skyo bar gyur pa la thar pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad par skyo bar gyur pa la thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is for one who is tired of analyzing with wisdom.

original: kha cig ni srid pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bye brag med par mthong bas zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha' nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig ni srid pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bye brag med par mthong bas zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub mtha' nyid de /
translated: This is the Buddhist philosophical tenet system.

original: slob dpon klus bos kyis dbu ma mya ngan las 'das par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: slob dpon klus bos kyis dbu ma mya ngan las 'das par bshad pa ni /
translated: The master Nagarjuna explains nirvana in the Middle Way:

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
translated: What is the limit of nirvana?

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa ;üîΩ/ de gnyis par nas cung zad kyang //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa ; / de gnyis par nas cung zad kyang //
translated: What is the limit of samsara?üîΩThere is not the slightest difference

original: shin tu phra mo yod pa min //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu phra mo yod pa min // zhes pa ste /
translated: between the two, even a subtle one.

original: nam shes rab kyis dmigs par bya ba mi dmigs pa de la 'khor ba dang khyad par mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dmigs par bya ba mi dmigs pa de la 'khor ba dang khyad par mi mthong ngo //
translated: When one does not see any difference between samsara and nirvana, one does not see samsara.

original: blo gros chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya ba de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya ba de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: The Buddha said to the bodhisattva Mahamati, ‚ÄúMahamati, the lion‚Äôs roar of the omniscient one is called ‚Äòthe teaching of the nonduality of existence and nonexistence.‚Äô

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam ji bzhin pa khong du chud pas rang gi sems snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i gzugs lta bu la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam ji bzhin pa khong du chud pas rang gi sems snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i gzugs lta bu la mngon par chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Since one has realized that appearances are one‚Äôs own mind, one should not become attached to external objects that are not included in the appearances of one‚Äôs own mind, which are like forms in a dream or an optical illusion.

original: mtha' bzhir gnyis dang / mi gnyis par smras pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: mtha' bzhir gnyis dang / mi gnyis par smras pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The four extremes are explained as nondual.

original: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ma yin par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ma yin par bshad par bya'o //
translated: [The four extremes are] explained as nondual, not different, and not the same.

original: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs par smra ba rnams la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa yang dag pa ji lta bur yongs su shes pa ma gtogs par brtag cing gcig pas mi rung ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs par smra ba rnams la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa yang dag pa ji lta bur yongs su shes pa ma gtogs par brtag cing gcig pas mi rung ste /
translated: For those who speak of BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on, except for the correct understanding of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, it is not suitable to investigate and say that they are the same.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva ltar med de /
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva ltar med de /
translated: Because they are permanent and unarisen, they do not exist like the horns of a rabbit.

original: gcig la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error of sameness would occur: one would be liberated and not liberated, rich and poor, and so on.

original: pha rol gyi don gzhan par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi don gzhan par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not suitable for the other, the object, because

original: rnam par phye ba ni khang pa dang / sde la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba ni khang pa dang / sde la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa kho na'o //
translated: the distinction is only empty, like a house, an army, and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi rtag cing spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la yang gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa yang mi rung ste sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rtag cing spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la yang gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa yang mi rung ste sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: Also, with regard to external, permanent, general, and specific characteristics, both, neither, different, and not different are not suitable, as explained before.üîΩThe non-falling into the two extremes of the conception of the appearance of one's own mind is called a dream.

original: rang gi sems snang bar rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba zhes bya ba ni rmi lam yin pa'i dus snga ma ni yod /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang bar rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis su ma lhung ba zhes bya ba ni rmi lam yin pa'i dus snga ma ni yod /
translated: At the time of the previous dream, it exists;üîΩat the time of the dream, it does not exist.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes par @216b mtha' gnyis su lhung ba med do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes par @216b mtha' gnyis su lhung ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no falling into the two extremes.

original: ji ltar na yang mtha' gnyis su lhung zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang mtha' gnyis su lhung zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: How is it that one does not fall into the two extremes? Having such a doubt, the Omniscient One said:

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-observation of apprehended and apprehender.

original: shes rab kyis gzhigs pa na dmigs su med pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis gzhigs pa na dmigs su med pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of non-apprehension when analyzed by wisdom.

original: tshad ma thams cad kyis grub pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don gyi dngos po med par rab tu grub pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad kyis grub pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don gyi dngos po med par rab tu grub pa ste /
translated: The establishment by all valid cognitions is the non-existence of external objects such as subtle particles, etc., established by the valid cognitions of direct perception and inference.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du rnam par slu ba'i phyir des na mnyam par mi 'jog pas dkrugs pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chud pa gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid me shes so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du rnam par slu ba'i phyir des na mnyam par mi 'jog pas dkrugs pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chud pa gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid me shes so //
translated: Because of being deceived by the cognition with the aspect of duality, like the cognition of dizziness, fainting, etc., one does not know the non-dual reality of the non-settling of the agitated water of the two with the aspect of duality.

original: de bsal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni log pa'i shes pa gsal na so sor bdag gis rigs par bya ba kho na nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de bsal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni log pa'i shes pa gsal na so sor bdag gis rigs par bya ba kho na nyid du 'gyur /
translated: The removal of that and so on means that when the false cognition is removed, it becomes the nature of each one's own reasoning.

original: bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pas so //
translated: Because of realizing the two types of selflessness means because of thoroughly knowing the two types of selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par gzhigs pa na stong pa nyid kyis shes so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par gzhigs pa na stong pa nyid kyis shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of dharmas is the knowledge of emptiness through the analysis of form, etc.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa ni gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa ni gang yod pa de thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: The selflessness of persons is that all that exists is momentary,

original: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a finger snap, a waterfall, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa gnyis rnam par log pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gnyis rnam par log pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'dag go //
translated: The reversal of the two defilements and the purification of the two obscurations refers to the purification of the afflictive and the objective obscurations through the realization of the two kinds of selflessness, of dharmas and of persons.

original: de ltar na sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sgrib pa gnyis rnam par dag pas thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the purification of the two obscurations, one becomes omniscient.

original: sa gong nas gong du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'phel ba ni sangs rgyas kho na'o //
analyzed: sa gong nas gong du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su 'phel ba ni sangs rgyas kho na'o //
translated: The increase of the accumulations of merit and wisdom from ground to ground is only possible for a buddha.

original: las kyi sgrib pa ni sa dang po nyid du log go //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa ni sa dang po nyid du log go //
translated: The obscuration of karma is reversed on the first ground.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa log pa na de'i mthong ba'i lam skye zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa log pa na de'i mthong ba'i lam skye zhing shes bya'i sgrib pa bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the obscurations of the afflictions are eliminated, the path of seeing arises and the obscurations of the knowable are thinned out.

original: sa bcu pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa shes bya'i sgrib pa mnyam par mi 'jog pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam du spang ngo //
analyzed: sa bcu pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa shes bya'i sgrib pa mnyam par mi 'jog pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam du spang ngo //
translated: The ignorance that is the affliction to be eliminated by the tenth stage, the obscuration of the knowable characterized by non-equipoise, and so on, is eliminated on the path of meditation.

original: des na mi shes pa ma lus par spangs te sa'i rim pas mkhyen pa'i ye shes @217a * //
analyzed: des na mi shes pa ma lus par spangs te sa'i rim pas mkhyen pa'i ye shes @217a * //
translated: Thus, having completely eliminated ignorance, the pristine wisdom of knowledge through the stages of the grounds

original: rnam par dag pa bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par nus pa mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs par nus pa mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du 'jug go //
translated: is pure. Like being free from the film of the eye, one enters into the entire domain of knowledge that is capable of benefiting oneself and others.

original: sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa yid kyi snang ba sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa yid kyi snang ba sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The mind is the appearance of the mind, the mental organ, and the mental consciousness, which are the cessation of the appearance of the world with its pure mundane appearances, such as illusions and reflections, and the abiding in meditative concentration.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: The mind is the store consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The mental organ is the mind that thinks ‚ÄúI.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: The mental consciousness is that which apprehends objects.

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: These are called the consciousnesses.

original: zhes pa la lus dang ; longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa log pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la lus dang ; longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa log pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation of the store consciousness, which appears as the body, sense objects, and the abode, is called mirror wisdom.

original: ngar sems pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa log pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su brjod do //
analyzed: ngar sems pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa log pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su brjod do //
translated: The cessation of the mental consciousness, which thinks ‚ÄúI,‚Äù is called the wisdom of equality.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par log pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su bstan to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par log pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su bstan to //
translated: The cessation of the eye consciousness, etc., is taught to be the wisdom of individual investigation.

original: de dag dang 'brel ba'i de ma thag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa'i mdo sde las brjod do //üîΩde ltar snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yongs su shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel ba'i de ma thag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa'i mdo sde las brjod do // de ltar snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yongs su shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The immediately subsequent mental consciousness associated with them is said in the sutras, such as the Buddha-bhumi, to be the gnosis of purposeful activity.üîΩThus, through understanding the differences between the samadhis with appearances and without appearances, one attains omniscience.

original: de ltar gzhan pa dang / gzhan bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / rma bya'i brtul zhugs dang / thal ba'i gnas su 'khod pa dang / chu stan dang me lnga'i brtul zhugs dang / grang ba dang dro ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan pa dang / gzhan bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / rma bya'i brtul zhugs dang / thal ba'i gnas su 'khod pa dang / chu stan dang me lnga'i brtul zhugs dang / grang ba dang dro ba dang /
translated: The other and the self and so forth refer to the observances of the cow, the peacock, the ash-dweller, the water-bedder, the five fires, the cold, the warm, the sun, the moon, the wind, the cloud, the elephant, the dog, the pig, the naked, the one-piece-garment, the matted-hair, the shaven-head, the earth, the water, the fire, the air, the space, the form, the formless, the desire, the non-desire, the virtue, the non-virtue, the vow, the non-vow, the existent, the non-existent, the past, the future, the present, the one, the many, the coarse, the subtle, the long, the short, the round, the square, the high, the low, the sweet, the sour, the bitter, the pungent, the salty, the astringent, the fragrant, the foul, the neutral, the pleasant, the unpleasant, the painful, the not painful, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not pleasant, the pleasant, the not

original: tsher ma la nyal ba la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs dang / bkra shis dang bkra shis ma yin pa dang / 'o ma dang 'o ma ma yin pa la sogs pa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / til dang / 'bras dang / rgod dang /
analyzed: tsher ma la nyal ba la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs dang / bkra shis dang bkra shis ma yin pa dang / 'o ma dang 'o ma ma yin pa la sogs pa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / til dang / 'bras dang / rgod dang /
translated: The ascetic practices of sleeping on thorns and so on, and the ascetic practices of auspicious and inauspicious things, milk and non-milk and so on, water, wind, sesame, rice, horse,

original: 'bras bu dang me tog dang / rtsa ba'i zas la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs de la gang dag gis thar pa rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang me tog dang / rtsa ba'i zas la sogs pa'i brtul zhugs de la gang dag gis thar pa rnam par rtog go //
translated: cow, fruit, flower, root, food and so on, by which they imagine liberation.

original: khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / thal bas skud pa dang / ral pa la sogs pa 'phyang ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pas 'khor bar 'jug go //
analyzed: khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / thal bas skud pa dang / ral pa la sogs pa 'phyang ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pas 'khor bar 'jug go //
translated: They enter sa·πÉsƒÅra through the pride of bathing, fire sacrifice, smearing with ashes, hanging hair and so on, and the pride of moral discipline and ascetic practices.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pa dang mi ldog par ldog pa'i rgyu mngon par mi shes pa'i @217b phyir de dag la thar pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rdo rje phreng ba las sems can dmyal bar ltung bar klog go //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pa dang mi ldog par ldog pa'i rgyu mngon par mi shes pa'i @217b phyir de dag la thar pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rdo rje phreng ba las sems can dmyal bar ltung bar klog go //
translated: Not only do they not have liberation, but the Vajra Garland reads that they fall into hell because they do not understand the cause of stopping and not stopping through the analysis of wisdom.

original: de dag rang yang zhig la log pa'i lta bas gzhan dag kyang zhig par byed do //
analyzed: de dag rang yang zhig la log pa'i lta bas gzhan dag kyang zhig par byed do //
translated: They themselves are destroyed, and by their false views they destroy others.

original: bkra shis dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang / gcin dang tshod ma dang / sha lu ga dang / bil ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pas thar pa rtog go //
analyzed: bkra shis dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang / gcin dang tshod ma dang / sha lu ga dang / bil ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pas thar pa rtog go //
translated: They imagine liberation to be auspicious things, cow dung, urine, vegetables, meat, bilva fruit, and so on.

original: gal te chos la bdag med par yongs su shes pas de dag gi bdag tu chags pa ldog na ni thar par rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med par yongs su shes pas de dag gi bdag tu chags pa ldog na ni thar par rung ngo //
translated: If they could stop their attachment to a self by fully understanding the selflessness of phenomena, then liberation would be possible.üîΩMahamati, all of them imagine nirvana by thinking in terms of the two extremes.

original: blo gros chen po de dag thams cad ni mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i bsam pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni 'di ni med ces dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' gnyis rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa las spyad do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de dag thams cad ni mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i bsam pas mya ngan las 'das par rtog go zhes pa ni 'di ni med ces dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtha' gnyis rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa las spyad do //
translated: They are carried away by the conceptualization of the two extremes of existence and nonexistence, saying, 'This does not exist.'

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i thar pa ni mi shes so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i thar pa ni mi shes so //
translated: They do not know the nonconceptual liberation of existence and nonexistence.

original: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Sapta≈õatikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ:

original: 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste gang 'di bsam pa med pa nyid do ;
analyzed: 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste gang 'di bsam pa med pa nyid do ;
translated: This is nirvana, which is the absence of thought.

original: / thams cad mkhyen pas de nyid bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: / thams cad mkhyen pas de nyid bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has accomplished that.

original: ji tsam du yid kyis 'gro zhing g-yo ba de tsam du gang la yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du yid kyis 'gro zhing g-yo ba de tsam du gang la yang mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes pa ste /
translated: To the extent that the mind moves and stirs, to that extent there is no nirvana anywhere.

original: gong na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod pa de na skye ba dang 'chi ba yin na /
analyzed: gong na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yod pa de na skye ba dang 'chi ba yin na /
translated: If there is going and coming above, there is birth and death there.

original: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das par rtog go //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan las 'das par rtog go //
translated: How can one imagine nirvana?

original: 'di la gang yang 'jug pa yang med /
analyzed: 'di la gang yang 'jug pa yang med /
translated: Here there is no entry of anyone,üîΩand no exit.üîΩNo one is born in any place, and that very one is not born in another place or at another time.

original: ldog pa yang med do zhes pa ni su gang du skyes pa nyid de nyid du 'phags pas na su yang yul gzhan du 'am dus gzhan du 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: ldog pa yang med do zhes pa ni su gang du skyes pa nyid de nyid du 'phags pas na su yang yul gzhan du 'am dus gzhan du 'jug pa med do //
translated: There is no entry of anyone into another place or at another time.

original: rtag pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa rtag pa gang yang 'jug pa yang med ldog pa yang med pa ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag dang sems can la sogs pa rtag pa gang yang 'jug pa yang med ldog pa yang med pa ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no entry of any permanent self, sentient being, and so on, and no exit, because there is no other nature of permanence.

original: des na rtag pa dang bdag tu smra ba rnams la thar par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang bdag tu smra ba rnams la thar par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not right for those who advocate permanence and a self to attain liberation.

original: bdag tu chags pas de dag la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pas de dag la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of attachment to a self, they experience the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang bdag tu chags pa nyid las 'dod pas bdag tu chags pa ji ltar na ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: thar pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yang bdag tu chags pa nyid las 'dod pas bdag tu chags pa ji ltar na ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Since liberation and nirvana are also desired because of attachment to a self, how could attachment to a self be reversed?

original: bdag med par smra ba rnams bdag tu chags pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: bdag med par smra ba rnams bdag tu chags pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Those who advocate selflessness do not observe a self because of attachment to a self and attain nirvana through wisdom.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /üîΩmya ngan 'das pa rnam rtog med //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las / mya ngan 'das pa rnam rtog med //
translated: As the Madhyamaka says:üîΩNirvana is nonconceptuality.

original: gang na 'khor ba bsal med pa //
analyzed: gang na 'khor ba bsal med pa //
translated: Where cyclic existence is not removed,

original: gang der 'khor ba bzhed pa @218a * //
analyzed: gang der 'khor ba bzhed pa @218a * //
translated: there cyclic existence is accepted

original: dang ; / mya ngan 'das par rnam rtog med //üîΩces pa ste /
analyzed: dang ; / mya ngan 'das par rnam rtog med // ces pa ste /
translated: and nirvana is nonconceptuality.

original: des na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i thar pas thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: des na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i thar pas thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that omniscience is intended to be nonconceptuality with regard to things and nonthings.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las thar pa dpyad pa'i le'u bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las thar pa dpyad pa'i le'u bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourteenth chapter, on the analysis of liberation, from the ‚ÄúEntry into Lanka‚Äù section of the Great  Vehicle discourse, the ‚ÄúEntry into Lanka.‚Äù

original: // / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva great being MahƒÅmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, please explain to me and the other bodhisattvas‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byas pa'am /üîΩma byas pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byas pa'am / ma byas pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, are the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas spoken of in terms of being produced or unproduced,

original: rgyu'am / 'bras bu'am /üîΩmtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: rgyu'am / 'bras bu'am / mtshan nyid dam /
translated: causes or results,üîΩcharacteristics or

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'am /
translated: the basis of characteristics,

original: rjod pa'am / brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: rjod pa'am / brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: expressions or the expressed,

original: blo'am / rig par bya pa'am de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig nges pa'i sgrar ni gcig gam tha dad dam ci lags /
analyzed: blo'am / rig par bya pa'am de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig nges pa'i sgrar ni gcig gam tha dad dam ci lags /
translated: mind or objects of cognition, or such like? Are they spoken of in terms of being the same or different?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:üîΩ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas are not spoken of in terms of being produced or unproduced,üîΩcauses or results,üîΩcharacteristics orüîΩthe basis of characteristics,üîΩexpressions or the expressed,üîΩmind or objects of cognition, or such like.

original: blo gros chen po gal te de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa yin na ni mi rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gal te de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa yin na ni mi rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: If the TathƒÅgata were a product, he would be impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir 'bras bu'o cog kyang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bas na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir 'bras bu'o cog kyang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bas na zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of impermanence, all effects would be the TathƒÅgata.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas cir dgongs she na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas cir dgongs she na /
translated: What does the Omniscient One intend?

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la nor te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la nor te /
translated: The consciousness of the aspect of the duality of the grasper and the grasped is mistaken.

original: bya ba dang byed par 'brel pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rtog go //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed par 'brel pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu kun rtog go //
translated: The cause and effect that are related as the action and the agent are the imagination.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi rnam par rtog pas na bya ba'i phyir na 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi rnam par rtog pas na bya ba'i phyir na 'bras bu'o //
translated: Because of the imagination of the expression, the effect is for the sake of the action.

original: byed pa'i phyir na rgyu ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir na rgyu ste /
translated: Because of the action, the cause.

original: de dag kyang gang gi tshe na skad cig pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyi ga med de /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang gi tshe na skad cig pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyi ga med de /
translated: When those are momentary, at that time both moments do not exist.

original: des na sus kyang ci yang mi byed de /
analyzed: des na sus kyang ci yang mi byed de /
translated: Therefore, no one does anything at all.

original: snga ma'i 'og na 'di yod pas na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig pas na chos su btags pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og na 'di yod pas na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig pas na chos su btags pa ni /
translated: Because of the mere statement, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that exists,‚Äù the designation of phenomena

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: is that all formations are momentary.

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: How can it be unstable? It is just that which is produced.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: And it is called the agent of that.

original: ces par bya ba dang byed pa po mngon par 'brel pas de bzhin gshegs pa ma byas so //
analyzed: ces par bya ba dang byed pa po mngon par 'brel pas de bzhin gshegs pa ma byas so //
translated: Thus, the TathƒÅgata is not produced, because the action and the agent are not connected.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it dual,

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan thams @218b cad dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan thams @218b cad dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like all other effects, such as a dream, a magical creation, and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na yongs su grub pa mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa de ma thag pa la 'di yod na 'di yod ces brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu byas pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad mi 'byung yang de'i spyi'i rnam
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na yongs su grub pa mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa de ma thag pa la 'di yod na 'di yod ces brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu byas pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad mi 'byung yang de'i spyi'i rnam
translated: How is it so? In the nondual, momentary, and perfectly accomplished state, when this exists, that comes into existence, and the conventional expressions of cause and effect, action and agent, and so on do not occur in the nature of reality, which is inexpressible.üîΩHowever, the conventional expressions of cause and effect, action and agent, and so on are superimposed on the general

original: par sgro btags te chos su gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: par sgro btags te chos su gdags par bya'o //
translated: aspect of that reality and are designated as phenomena.

original: ji lta bur byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: ji lta bur byas pa bstan to //
translated: The manner in which it is produced has been taught.

original: ma byas pa'i rtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i rtag pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible for a permanent thing to be unproduced.

original: snga ma'i skad cig ma'i 'og tu phyi ma mi 'byung bas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i skad cig ma'i 'og tu phyi ma mi 'byung bas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because the subsequent moment does not arise immediately after the prior moment, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is not unmade.

original: rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rig par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha dad gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa las 'byung gi /
analyzed: rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rig par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha dad gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa las 'byung gi /
translated: The consciousness arises from the differentiation of the two, the expressed and the expresser, the cognized and the cognizer, and so on.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par smra ba yang dag pa rig pa la tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i tha snyad med do //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par smra ba yang dag pa rig pa la tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i tha snyad med do //
translated: But in the ultimate truth, which is nondual, inexpressible, and nonapparent, there is no conventional designation of the form of differentiation.

original: des na gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad pa rnams kyi phan tshun du ltos te /
analyzed: des na gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad pa rnams kyi phan tshun du ltos te /
translated: Therefore, the conventions of the concepts of difference and nondifference are mutually dependent.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kun du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kun du brtags pa ste /
translated: The concepts of existence and nonexistence, past and future, entity and nonentity, and so on, are all imagined.

original: spros pa thams cad las 'das pa brjod du med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad las 'das pa brjod du med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la mi 'jug go //
translated: One does not enter into the Tathagata who is beyond all conceptual elaboration and is inexpressible.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las /
translated: As it says in the Madhyamaka:

original: spros las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
analyzed: spros las 'das pa mi gnyis pa //
translated: Beyond conceptual elaboration, nondual,

original: gang dag sangs rgyas spros par byed //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas spros par byed //
translated: Those who conceptualize the BuddhaüîΩAre dullards, impaired by conceptual elaboration,

original: spros nyams glen pa de dag gi / de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: spros nyams glen pa de dag gi / de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo // zhes pa ste /
translated: And do not see the Tathagata.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag las grol ba'o //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag las grol ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagata is free from all conceptualization.

original: mtshan ma'i gzhi dang mtshan ma dang // chos dang / chos can gyi tha snyad kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi brjod du med par bstan mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gzhi dang mtshan ma dang // chos dang / chos can gyi tha snyad kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi brjod du med par bstan mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to teach that the Tathagata is inexpressible in terms of all conceptualization, such as the basis of signs, signs, the Dharma, and the person who knows the Dharma.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las /
translated: As it says in the Madhyamaka:

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: If the characteristic of the characterized is different,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: The characteristic would be without a characterized.

original: gcig na de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they are the same, those two are not established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they are different, they are not different.

original: chos dang chos can rnams kyi gal te me las tsha ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin na me las tsha ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can rnams kyi gal te me las tsha ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin na me las tsha ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the defining characteristic of heat were different from fire, heat would not be fire.

original: gcig na mtshan ma'i gzhi yang med la mtshan nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: gcig na mtshan ma'i gzhi yang med la mtshan nyid kyang med do //
translated: If they were the same, there would be no basis for the defining characteristic, nor would there be the defining characteristic itself.

original: de de bzhin du chos dang chos can rnams tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par bsam @219a * //
analyzed: de de bzhin du chos dang chos can rnams tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par bsam @219a * //
translated: In the same way, if the dharmin and the dharmas were different or not different,

original: pa na stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: pa na stong pa nyid de /
translated: emptiness would not be possible.

original: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyang smra bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyang smra bar mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The inexpressible nature itself cannot be expressed,

original: chos dang bral ba'i chos can brjod du med la /
analyzed: chos dang bral ba'i chos can brjod du med la /
translated: because the dharmin devoid of dharmas is inexpressible,

original: chos can las tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po yang med do //
analyzed: chos can las tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po yang med do //
translated: and there is no entity of dharmas that are different from the dharmin.

original: gzhi'i khyad par gyi chos zhig gis spyir sgro btags te tha snyad du 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhi'i khyad par gyi chos zhig gis spyir sgro btags te tha snyad du 'jug go //
translated: A dharma that is a particular basis is superimposed in general and conventionally engaged.

original: 'on te de de ltar chos can rnams kyi gzugs dang gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid tha dad par gyur du zin na ni gzugs can ni gzugs med pa dang / gzugs med pa gzugs can gyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de de ltar chos can rnams kyi gzugs dang gzugs can gyi mtshan nyid tha dad par gyur du zin na ni gzugs can ni gzugs med pa dang / gzugs med pa gzugs can gyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were to be different from the characteristics of the forms of those phenomena, then the formless would be the form, and the form would be the formless.

original: de dag gcig na ni mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / mtshan ma nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gcig na ni mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / mtshan ma nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: If they were the same, it would not be tenable that there is a basis of characteristics and characteristics themselves.

original: tha dad na yang mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yang btsal dgos so //
analyzed: tha dad na yang mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yang btsal dgos so //
translated: If they were different, then the characteristic of the characteristic would have to be sought elsewhere.

original: de de ltar chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par bsam pa na yang rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de de ltar chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par bsam pa na yang rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong pa nyid de /
translated: When one considers in this way that the convention of phenomena and the bearer of the characteristics is neither different nor not different, it is empty of the two natures.

original: chos dang chos can de dag tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can de dag tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those phenomena and the bearer of the characteristics are not observed as different.

original: chos ma rtogs par chos can gyi rang bzhin ni bstan mi nus te brjod du med do //
analyzed: chos ma rtogs par chos can gyi rang bzhin ni bstan mi nus te brjod du med do //
translated: Without realizing the phenomenon, the nature of the bearer of the characteristics cannot be taught, and so it is inexpressible.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang sgra thams cad kyis de dag gi spyir brtags pa'i don du sgro btags te 'jug go zhes lan mang por bshad pa de'i phyir mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med pa'i yongs su
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang sgra thams cad kyis de dag gi spyir brtags pa'i don du sgro btags te 'jug go zhes lan mang por bshad pa de'i phyir mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid brjod du med pa'i yongs su
translated: Since it has been explained many times that all conceptual thoughts and terms such as entity and nonentity are superimpositions that apply to their general imagined objects, the thoroughly established nature, which is the opposite of that, is the thus-gone.

original: grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa yongs su dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa yongs su dag pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: It is the thoroughly pure, luminous, and inexpressible nature that is the characteristic of the second absence of attributes.

original: de ni 'bras bu ma yin /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu ma yin /
translated: It is not a result.

original: rgyu yang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu yang ma yin /
translated: It is not a cause.

original: mtshan ma'i gzhi yang ma yin /üîΩmtshan ma yang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i gzhi yang ma yin / mtshan ma yang ma yin /
translated: It is not a basis of signs.üîΩIt is not a sign.

original: rjod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rjod pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not an expression.

original: brjod par bya ba yang ma yin /üîΩbyas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang ma yin / byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not an object of expression.üîΩIt is not a product.

original: ma byas pa yang ma yin /üîΩblo yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma byas pa yang ma yin / blo yang ma yin /
translated: It is not a nonproduct.üîΩIt is not an awareness.

original: rig par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rig par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not an object of knowledge.

original: de bzhin du gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par phan tshun du ltos pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad las 'das shing de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa dang med par ni smra ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par phan tshun du ltos pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad las 'das shing de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa dang med par ni smra ba med do //
translated: In the same way, the TathƒÅgata is beyond the conventions of the two, which are mutually dependent, as other and not other, and he is not described as existent or nonexistent.

original: gnyis ka yang nyes par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te byas pa zhig na ni de'i tshe mi rtag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang nyes par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te byas pa zhig na ni de'i tshe mi rtag pa kho na ste /
translated: ‚Äú Both are faulty‚Äù and so on. If he were created, then he would be impermanent,

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'khor ba'i 'bras bu 'khrul lo cog dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'khor ba'i 'bras bu 'khrul lo cog dang 'dra'o //
translated: like any other effect of cyclic existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su grub pa yang gzhan gyi @219b dbang gnyis kyi rnam pa dang 'dres pa'i 'bras bu bzhin du skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i snang ba las grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su grub pa yang gzhan gyi @219b dbang gnyis kyi rnam pa dang 'dres pa'i 'bras bu bzhin du skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i snang ba las grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfected TathƒÅgata would not be free from the appearance of effects, such as birth, aging, and death, like the effect that is mixed with the two aspects of the other dependent nature.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang ma rig pa mnyam par mi 'jog pa dang / las kyi mthu las 'byung ba la 'dis byed do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang ma rig pa mnyam par mi 'jog pa dang / las kyi mthu las 'byung ba la 'dis byed do //
translated: The other dependent consciousness of the two is produced from the power of karma and the non-equipoise of ignorance.

original: zhes ma rig pas glongs pa'i 'khor ba rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: zhes ma rig pas glongs pa'i 'khor ba rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: This is the cause and effect of cyclic existence, which is produced by ignorance.

original: des na bya ba dang byed pa dang 'brel te yongs su dag pa'i chud pa ma byas pas na byas pa'i sgra la sogs pas snga ma'i skad cig gi 'og tu brjod du med pa bstan mi nus so //
analyzed: des na bya ba dang byed pa dang 'brel te yongs su dag pa'i chud pa ma byas pas na byas pa'i sgra la sogs pas snga ma'i skad cig gi 'og tu brjod du med pa bstan mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is related to action and agent. Since it is not a completely pure non-action, the terms ‚Äúproduced‚Äù and so on cannot indicate the inexpressible state that follows the prior moment.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na gnyis po med pas sus kyang ci yang byas pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na gnyis po med pas sus kyang ci yang byas pa med de /
translated: When there is a single moment, at that time there is no second moment. Therefore, nothing is produced by anyone.

original: des na ma byas pa ste snga ma'i skad cig pa'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya bar chos btags pa'o //
analyzed: des na ma byas pa ste snga ma'i skad cig pa'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya bar chos btags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is unproduced. If this exists, that exists is the designation of a phenomenon that follows the prior moment.

original: ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa de dag dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de yang med de /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa de dag dmigs su med pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir de yang med de /
translated: Since the horns of a rabbit, the son of a barren woman, and so on are not observed, they do not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po med do zhes pa'i skyon der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po med do zhes pa'i skyon der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The error that the thing that is the TathƒÅgata does not exist does not occur.

original: ma byas pa'i phyir rtag pa ste tshig tsam du yod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad gnyis kyi rnam pa gzhan gyi dbang la 'jug gi gang gnyis su med pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras
analyzed: ma byas pa'i phyir rtag pa ste tshig tsam du yod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad gnyis kyi rnam pa gzhan gyi dbang la 'jug gi gang gnyis su med pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras
translated: Because it is not made, it is permanent. The characteristic of the conceptualization that exists as mere words is to engage the dependent nature that has the aspect of the two, cause and effect, and so on.

original: bur bstan du med de gnyis kyi rnam par med do //
analyzed: bur bstan du med de gnyis kyi rnam par med do //
translated: That which is nondual cannot be taught as cause and effect, because it does not have the aspect of duality.

original: yod pa ma yin te med pa'i phyir mtha' bzhi'i phyi rol pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin te med pa'i phyir mtha' bzhi'i phyi rol pa ste /
translated: It is not existent because it does not exist. It is beyond the four extremes.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mtha' bzhi'i tha snyad ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'jug gi gnyis su med pa la ni ma yin no //
