analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mtha' bzhi'i tha snyad ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'jug gi gnyis su med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The conventions of the four extremes‚Äîexistence, nonexistence, both, and neither‚Äîengage the consciousness that has the aspect of duality, but not nonduality.

original: de de bzhin du byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa thams cad ni tha snyad nyid de /
analyzed: de de bzhin du byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa thams cad ni tha snyad nyid de /
translated: All such things as being made and unmade, permanent and impermanent, and so on are just conventions.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa la rab tu mi 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa la rab tu mi 'jug go //
translated: Without thought and without appearance, the ultimate truth, nondual, is not engaged in perfect cognition.

original: de la 'di snyam du gyur te chos thams cad bdag med ces thams cad mkhyen pa'i seng ge'i sgra ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa de ni bdag med pa na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa skad cig pa rnams la de ltar tshig de
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gyur te chos thams cad bdag med ces thams cad mkhyen pa'i seng ge'i sgra ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa de ni bdag med pa na ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa skad cig pa rnams la de ltar tshig de
translated: With regard to that, it occurred to him: ‚ÄúSince the lion‚Äôs roar of omniscience, ‚ÄòAll phenomena are selfless,‚Äô is produced, it is impermanent. Since it is selfless, how is it that the words ‚Äòall phenomena are selfless‚Äô are not impermanent?

original: dag thams cad kyis mi brjod ces @220a * //
analyzed: dag thams cad kyis mi brjod ces @220a * //
translated: All of those words are not expressed.‚Äù

original: de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas lan du gsungs par brtag pa ni /
analyzed: de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas lan du gsungs par brtag pa ni /
translated: Having thought that, the omniscient one‚Äôs response is to be imagined:

original: blo gros chen po gang yang ngas chos thams cad bdag med ces bshad pa de'i don kyang khong du chud par gyis shig /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang yang ngas chos thams cad bdag med ces bshad pa de'i don kyang khong du chud par gyis shig /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, you should understand the meaning of what I have explained, namely, that all phenomena are selfless.

original: blo gros chen po bdag med pa'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid de ;
analyzed: blo gros chen po bdag med pa'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid de ;
translated: MahƒÅmati, the thing that is selfless is selflessness.

original: rta dang ba lang bzhin du chos thams cad ni bdag gi dngos por yod pa de gzhan gyi dngos por ni med do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rta dang ba lang bzhin du chos thams cad ni bdag gi dngos por yod pa de gzhan gyi dngos por ni med do zhes pa ste /
translated: Like a horse and an ox, all things exist as the entity of self, but not as the entity of another.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas dngos po thams cad kyi gzhan bsal bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas dngos po thams cad kyi gzhan bsal bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One has stated that all things are the exclusion of other.

original: gang gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That which is the intrinsic reality of one is not another.

original: dkar po dang / dmar po dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu so sor snang ba sna tshogs tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad gcig las gcig rnam par log pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang / dmar po dang / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu so sor snang ba sna tshogs tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad gcig las gcig rnam par log pa'o //
translated: Because the various different effects of all things appear individually, such as white and red, cold and hot, form and formless, etc., all things are mutually exclusive.

original: des na bdag med pa phan tshun du bdag med pa thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag med pa phan tshun du bdag med pa thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One intended that all things are selfless and that selflessness is mutually inclusive.

original: rang bzhin med pa rnams ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa rnams ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Things that lack intrinsic reality are not non-existent, like the horns of a rabbit, etc., in the sense of being non-existent by their very nature.

original: blo gros chen po ba lang gi rva g-yas pa las g-yon pa gzhan /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ba lang gi rva g-yas pa las g-yon pa gzhan /
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is like the right horn of an ox being different from the left,

original: g-yon pa las g-yas pa gzhan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: g-yon pa las g-yas pa gzhan pa bzhin te /
translated: and the left being different from the right.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata is not different from the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams dang tha dad pa yang ma yin no zhes pa dang / gnyis ka yang skyon te phung po'i mtshan nyid mi mthun na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams dang tha dad pa yang ma yin no zhes pa dang / gnyis ka yang skyon te phung po'i mtshan nyid mi mthun na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Both of these are faulty: if the characteristics of the aggregates are incompatible, it would be a non-entity like the horn of a rabbit, etc.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid du yang byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid du yang byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste /
translated: And because it is made into the characteristic of the aggregates, it is impermanent.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang 'khor ba'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gzhan gyi dbang 'khor ba'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: It is different from that, like the result of sa·πÉsƒÅra, which is other-dependent.

original: skyon de gnyis spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mi gnyis pa'i chud pa'o //
analyzed: skyon de gnyis spangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mi gnyis pa'i chud pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata, who has abandoned those two faults, is the intrinsic luminosity, the non-dual sphere.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams ni gcig la gcig ltos pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams ni gcig la gcig ltos pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: The aspects of duality are mutually dependent cause and effect.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / mtshan ma dang / bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dang / dngos po dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / mtshan ma dang / bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dang / dngos po dang /
translated: the basis of signs and signs,üîΩself and selflessness,üîΩentity and non-entity,üîΩempty and not empty,

original: dngos po med pa dang / stong pa dang / @220b stong pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / stong pa dang / @220b stong pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: neither permanentüîΩnor impermanent, and so on.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa so sor snang ba'i sgra dang don rnams phan tshun du ltos te 'jug go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa so sor snang ba'i sgra dang don rnams phan tshun du ltos te 'jug go //
translated: The sounds and meanings that appear as individual conceptual thoughts operate in mutual dependence.

original: gnyis su med cing brjod du med pa la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog par mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing brjod du med pa la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog par mi 'jug ste /
translated: In the non-dual and inexpressible, conceptual thoughts of cause and effect, and so on, do not operate.

original: mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni snang ba med pa kho na'i phyir der gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams so sor snang ba med do //
analyzed: mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni snang ba med pa kho na'i phyir der gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams so sor snang ba med do //
translated: Correct knowledge of non-duality is only non-appearance, so the individual appearances of the aggregates such as form do not exist there.

original: gang gis mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa las skyes pa'i gzhan gyi dbang 'khor ba mtha' dag tu gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi rtag pa lta
analyzed: gang gis mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa las skyes pa'i gzhan gyi dbang 'khor ba mtha' dag tu gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi rtag pa lta
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not impermanent like the dependent nature that arises from the ignorance of non-equipoise, which appears in the form of the aggregates such as form, in the entirety of sa·πÉsƒÅra, in the aspect of duality such as cause and effect.

original: bur 'gyur yang rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: bur 'gyur yang rtag pa nyid de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is permanent,

original: glo bur gyi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur gyi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is free from the faults of the aspect of duality, which is adventitious.

original: gser la sogs pa dri ma dang bral ba bzhin du skad cig ma'i rgyun bstan zhing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa dri ma dang bral ba bzhin du skad cig ma'i rgyun bstan zhing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is the continuity of moments, like gold and so forth free from stains, and is the possessor of the intrinsic luminosity that is the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa ste /
translated: He is empty of the aspect of duality, that is, of the apprehender and the apprehended.

original: chos kyi chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas shing dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas de'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas shing dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas de'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena is primordially present, and since it is not made by anyone such as the sense faculties, it is therefore unconditioned.

original: skad cig pa la ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med de /
analyzed: skad cig pa la ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med de /
translated: In the momentary, there is no other dharma such as arising, enduring, ceasing, etc.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med cing 'gog pa med pa dang / dag pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba skad cig ma'i rgyu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med cing 'gog pa med pa dang / dag pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba skad cig ma'i rgyu bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is non-arisen and non-ceasing, and the pure dependent origination is taught as the cause of the momentary.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes chos brtags pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes chos brtags pa'o //
translated: After the previous, this exists, so this exists - this is the imputation of dharmas.

original: ji ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa tha snyad 'jug pa de bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa tha snyad 'jug pa de bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as the conventional engagement in the aspect of duality, so too the stream of non-dual moments is not in the inconceivable and non-apparent correct knowledge.

original: rang bzhin gyis brjod du med cing dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis brjod du med cing dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who are naturally inexpressible and non-conceptual regarding existence and non-existence, buddhahood occurs due to the abandonment of conceptualization.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: When one enters into the concentration which is endowed with the appearance of the Omniscient One, the teaching of the Dharma occurs.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /üîΩgzhan dang gzhan la brten nas gzhan //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las / gzhan dang gzhan la brten nas gzhan //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩThe other is dependent on the other,

original: gzhan pa de yang @221a * //
analyzed: gzhan pa de yang @221a * //
translated: and that other

original: yod min pas //
analyzed: yod min pas //
translated: does not exist.

original: gzhan dngos med phyir gzhan min med //
analyzed: gzhan dngos med phyir gzhan min med //
translated: Since the other is not a thing, the non-other does not exist.

original: yod pa rnams kyang ma yin no //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa rnams kyang ma yin no // zhes pa ste /
translated: Nor do the existent things.

original: des na sgra dang don du rnam par brtags pa de dag don dam pa la med de //
analyzed: des na sgra dang don du rnam par brtags pa de dag don dam pa la med de //
translated: Therefore, those conceptualized as words and meanings do not exist in the ultimate.

original: des na der chad pa dang / rtag pa'i lta bar gtogs par smras par 'gyur ba ni gang gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba de ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: des na der chad pa dang / rtag pa'i lta bar gtogs par smras par 'gyur ba ni gang gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba de ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is said that they are included in the views of annihilation and permanence. That which is free from the two aspects is not a thing,

original: ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i pad mo dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes so //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i pad mo dang / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes so //
translated: like the horn of a rabbit, the sky-lotus, the son of a barren woman, and so forth.

original: kha cig gis kun rtog pa ni gang gnyis kyi rnam par nor pa'i skad cig pa de med pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis kun rtog pa ni gang gnyis kyi rnam par nor pa'i skad cig pa de med pa ste /
translated: Some say that imagination is the momentary error of duality, which does not exist.üîΩThat which is not dual is not imagined, in order to eliminate the claim of the dualists.

original: gang mi gnyis pa de ni mi 'gyur bas na rtog go zhes gnyis su smra ba de bsal ba'i phyir srid pa dang thar pa'i dus na sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal med pa la sogs pa tha dad par phye ba'i chud pa la dngos po med pa yang
analyzed: gang mi gnyis pa de ni mi 'gyur bas na rtog go zhes gnyis su smra ba de bsal ba'i phyir srid pa dang thar pa'i dus na sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal med pa la sogs pa tha dad par phye ba'i chud pa la dngos po med pa yang
translated: In the context of existence and liberation, the distinction of suffering and non-suffering, etc., is not a non-entity,

original: ma yin / rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin / rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it permanent.

original: gser dri ma dang bral ba bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dag pa skye ba med cing 'gog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sangs rgyas kho na'o //
analyzed: gser dri ma dang bral ba bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dag pa skye ba med cing 'gog pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sangs rgyas kho na'o //
translated: Like gold free from stains, it is pure, free from the imagination of entity and non-entity, unborn and unceasing, characterized only by Buddhahood.

original: skye ba dang 'gog pa la sogs pa lung ston pa la sogs pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la brtags pa ni rnam pa gnyis ka la yang med de gzhan gyi dbang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skad cig ma'i rgyu la yang med na brjod du
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gog pa la sogs pa lung ston pa la sogs pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la brtags pa ni rnam pa gnyis ka la yang med de gzhan gyi dbang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skad cig ma'i rgyu la yang med na brjod du
translated: The investigation of dependent origination in both of these two aspects does not exist in the sense of arising, cessation, etc., because it does not exist in the dependent on others, which is nonconceptual and momentary, much less in the inexpressible perfect.

original: med pa'i yongs su grub pa la yang lta ci smos te gnas 'di ni med do //
analyzed: med pa'i yongs su grub pa la yang lta ci smos te gnas 'di ni med do //
translated: This point does not exist.üîΩIf the term ‚Äúenumeration‚Äù refers to nonarising and noncessation, then it is not suitable to say ‚Äúall phenomena are nonarisen,‚Äù as the noble MahƒÅmati S≈´tra says:

original: gal te rnam grangs kyi sgra 'di skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa de'i tshe chos thams cad ma skyes so zhes smos su mi rung bar 'phags pa blo gros chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa ni dngos po med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam grangs kyi sgra 'di skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa de'i tshe chos thams cad ma skyes so zhes smos su mi rung bar 'phags pa blo gros chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa ni dngos po med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is not a nonthing.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of the Omniscient One?

original: gang yongs su grub pa'i dngos po yod de /
analyzed: gang yongs su grub pa'i dngos po yod de /
translated: There is an existent perfect thing.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa lta bur rnam pa gnyis med pa kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa lta bur rnam pa gnyis med pa kho na ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the two aspects are simply not arisen, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / rab rib snang ba dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ltar sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / rab rib snang ba dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa ltar sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The dependent nature is also devoid of the nature of arising as various different aspects, like a dream, an illusion, the appearance of floaters, a reflection, and so on.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yongs su dag pa gnyis su med pa'i chud @221b pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yongs su dag pa gnyis su med pa'i chud @221b pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: Therefore the TathƒÅgata is the natural luminosity that is completely pure, the nondual expanse.

original: de gcig po la gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gcig po la gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for that to be harmed.

original: bdun brgya pa las kyang dngos po zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdun brgya pa las kyang dngos po zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sapta≈õatikƒÅ Praj√±ƒÅpƒÅramitƒÅ also says, ‚ÄúThing.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar dngos po zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar dngos po zhe na /
translated: How is the TathƒÅgata a thing?

original: der gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: der gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las rig par bya ste /
translated: The intention of that statement should be understood from the Samdhinirmocana S≈´tra.

original: don dam pa la ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po med do zhes te des na don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa la ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i dngos po med do zhes te des na don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate, there is no entity of the two aspects. Therefore, the ultimate, emptiness that is the absence of nature, is the TathƒÅgata.

original: btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pa'i bshad pa ni 'dir gsal ba ste /
analyzed: btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pa'i bshad pa ni 'dir gsal ba ste /
translated: The explanation of the noble Maitreya, the foremost of the venerable ones, is clear here:

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa yi //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa yi //
translated: The absence of the entity of the two

original: dngos po'i stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Is the defining characteristic of the emptiness of entities.

original: zhes pa'o // sa dang po dbang po'i dbu ma las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sa dang po dbang po'i dbu ma las kyang /

analyzed: don dam don ni gsal ba ste // rnam rtog med cing snang ba med //
translated: The meaning of the ultimate is clearüîΩIt is free from conceptuality and appearances

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma smos pa //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma smos pa //
translated: It is not fabricated by mental proliferations

original: 'jig rten mgon po sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: The protector of the world, the Buddha,

original: 'di ni bstan pa bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan pa bdud rtsi'o //
translated: Taught this nectar of the DharmaüîΩThose of little intelligence who see existenceüîΩAnd see nonexistence

original: gang dag dngos po yod mthong dang // med par mthong ba blo chung rnams /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po yod mthong dang // med par mthong ba blo chung rnams /
translated: Do not see

original: blta bya nyer zhi zhi ba ni //üîΩde dag gis ni mi mthong ngo //üîΩstong pa zhes par smra mi bya //
analyzed: blta bya nyer zhi zhi ba ni // de dag gis ni mi mthong ngo // stong pa zhes par smra mi bya //
translated: The pacification of the view, which is peace.üîΩOne should not say ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù

translated: Or ‚Äúnonemptiness‚Äù

original: rnam bzhi zhi la gang la zhig / de de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pas brgyad du dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam bzhi zhi la gang la zhig / de de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pas brgyad du dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The middle way samƒÅdhi is eightfold, since it is non-conceptual with regard to entities and non-entities.

original: de skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong zhing dbus su rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa la so sor mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong zhing dbus su rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa la so sor mi snang ngo //
translated: The arising and cessation of dependent origination are empty of a beginning and end, and in the middle they are empty by nature.

original: shes pa 'ba' zhig lam zad de shes par bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: shes pa 'ba' zhig lam zad de shes par bya ba yang ngo //
translated: Consciousness alone is the path and the object of knowledge.üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar / phyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
analyzed: ji ltar / phyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
translated: Having eliminated external things,

analyzed: shes pa tsam la 'jug pas ni //

analyzed: de na dbu ma'i nan tan te //

original: gang na skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de ni sa bdun du phyin pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de ni sa bdun du phyin pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no //

translated: He teaches the Dharma by emanating in whatever forms are appropriate.
