analyzed: de bzhin du la las ni 'dren pa dang / rnam par 'dren pa dang / yongs su 'dren pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / khyu mchog dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jug sel dang / dbang phyug dang / gtso bo dang / ser skya dang ;
translated: and so on.

original: yang dag mu dang / mi gdon mu khyud dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / rtse ba po dang / rnam par 'dor dang / ne tso dang / dbang po dang / stobs can dang / chu bdag tu rab tu shes so zhes pa gang tshe bdag thams cad gang dag gis gzung ba'i sems can de dag la de bzhin du sprul pa rnams kyi 'dul ba chen pos 'dul bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag mu dang / mi gdon mu khyud dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / rtse ba po dang / rnam par 'dor dang / ne tso dang / dbang po dang / stobs can dang / chu bdag tu rab tu shes so zhes pa gang tshe bdag thams cad gang dag gis gzung ba'i sems can de dag la de bzhin du sprul pa rnams kyi 'dul ba chen pos 'dul bar mdzad do //
translated: He is known as the perfect circle, the circle of the indestructible, the moon, the sun, the playful, the discriminating, the parrot, the powerful, the strong, and the lord of the waters.

original: nga'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo rnams kyi rnam grangs tha dad pa mtha' med pa rnams ni phyogs bcur mtha' med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khyon rnams su yang rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: nga'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo rnams kyi rnam grangs tha dad pa mtha' med pa rnams ni phyogs bcur mtha' med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khyon rnams su yang rab tu 'jug go //
translated: The infinite varieties of my emanations engage in infinite world systems in the ten directions.

original: des na rnam grangs rnams kyi gcig po la yang mang po ste /
analyzed: des na rnam grangs rnams kyi gcig po la yang mang po ste /
translated: Therefore, the one is many.

original: ji ltar lag pa /
analyzed: ji ltar lag pa /
translated: For example, hand,üîΩmaker,

original: byed pa / spyod pa zhes so //
analyzed: byed pa / spyod pa zhes so //
translated: and agent.

original: snang ba tha dad pas kyang chu la zla ba mang ba lta bu dang / sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sprul pa'i skyes bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pas kyang chu la zla ba mang ba lta bu dang / sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sprul pa'i skyes bu lta bu ste /
translated: Also, due to the diversity of appearances, it is like the many moons in water, and like a person emanated by various illusory forms.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i tshangs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yong par ni rung /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i tshangs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul yong par ni rung /
translated: It is possible that there is the miracle of BrahmƒÅ‚Äôs magical power with such aspects.

original: grub pa gnyis su @222b med pa'i mtshan nyid la ni sna tshogs med de /
analyzed: grub pa gnyis su @222b med pa'i mtshan nyid la ni sna tshogs med de /
translated: However, in the characteristic of nondual accomplishment, there is no diversity.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa don dam pa'i tshul ston pa gzhan la las na skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bden pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa don dam pa'i tshul ston pa gzhan la las na skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bden pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang /
translated: Likewise, when the omniscient one teaches the mode of the ultimate, there is nonarising, noncessation, emptiness, suchness, reality, the limit of reality,

original: chos kyi dbyings dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rtag pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the dharmadhƒÅtu, nirvƒÅ·πáa, permanence, sameness, nonduality, and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa dang / mi skye ba dang 'gog pa med pa la sogs pa ni mu stegs byed rnams kyi rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs par brtags par chags pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dang / mi skye ba dang 'gog pa med pa la sogs pa ni mu stegs byed rnams kyi rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs par brtags par chags pa'o //
translated: Non-duality, non-arising, non-cessation, and so on are attached to the imputations of the tƒ´rthikas as permanence, unity, self, BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on.

original: bde bar gshegs pa kha cig la yang de dngos po med pa'i yul te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa kha cig la yang de dngos po med pa'i yul te /
translated: Some of the Sugatas are also attached to the non-existence of those things.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mang du thos pa rnams las dmigs pa'i don gyi khyad par 'di thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'i yi ge'i phyir 'brang bar mi bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mang du thos pa rnams las dmigs pa'i don gyi khyad par 'di thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa'i don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'i yi ge'i phyir 'brang bar mi bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, just as the learned ones have heard, one should follow the meaning of what is taught by the Omniscient One, the distinctions of the objects of observation, and not follow the words.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas bsngags pa'i mang du thos pa rnams kyis ni rtogs par yang nus pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas bsngags pa'i mang du thos pa rnams kyis ni rtogs par yang nus pa ste /
translated: The learned ones praised by the Omniscient One are also able to understand.

original: de dag ni rjes su dpag pas thams cad shes so //
analyzed: de dag ni rjes su dpag pas thams cad shes so //
translated: They know everything through inference.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa rnams kyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos bya ba byas pa dang / byed pa por 'brel par kun brtags pa'i rnam pa ni de ltar tha dad par mi rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa rnams kyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos bya ba byas pa dang / byed pa por 'brel par kun brtags pa'i rnam pa ni de ltar tha dad par mi rung ste /
translated: As the scriptures state, the aspects of the activity of the phenomena of arising, enduring, and ceasing, and the connection between the agent and the action, are not tenable in that way.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis med de /
translated: When one moment exists, at that time the second moment does not exist.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa sus gang zhig bya /
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa sus gang zhig bya /
translated: By whom and what is the activity of arising, enduring, and ceasing performed?üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar / 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: ji ltar / 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can the unstable be an agent?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: That which arises is the agent.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: That is also called the agent.

original: ces pa de de ltar skye ba la sogs pa gang zag la bdag med pa la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ces pa de de ltar skye ba la sogs pa gang zag la bdag med pa la mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, arising and so on are not tenable in the selflessness of the person.

original: chos la bdag med pa la yang med de gnyis kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de dag gi skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la yang med de gnyis kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de dag gi skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: Nor do they exist in the selflessness of phenomena. The nature of the arising of those two aspects does not exist.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi rnam pa dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi rnam pa dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: like a dream, a magical creation, a mirage, a reflection, or an optical illusion.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: The ultimate truth is non-conceptual and non-apparent, and is the perfect knowledge of non-duality.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa @223a * //üîΩyang brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pas 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed pa dang / rjod pa dang /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa @223a * // yang brjod du med pa'i phyir dngos po dang dngos po med par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pas 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed pa dang / rjod pa dang /
translated: The continuity of moments is perfect knowledge.

original: brjod par bya ba dang / mtshan ma'i gnas dang / mtshan ma dang / gzhan dang / gzhan pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa dang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad thams cad der ldog go //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / mtshan ma'i gnas dang / mtshan ma dang / gzhan dang / gzhan pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa dang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad thams cad der ldog go //
translated: Since it is inexpressible, all conceptual thoughts of existence and non-existence, of subject and object, of action and agent, of cause and effect, of expression and object of expression, of characteristics and the basis of characteristics, of one and many, and all dualistic conventions, are eliminated.

original: yi ge med pa ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge med pa ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is without syllables.

original: rnam par mi rtog par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa ste /
translated: The Omniscient One has the intention of non-conceptuality.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nges par 'jug pa dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nges par 'jug pa dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: Otherwise, the entry would be like the sense consciousnesses and the knowledge of the correct number of breaths.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun 'byung zhing rnam par rtog pa med par mngon sum du myong yang rnam pa de lta bu bstan mi nus pa'i phyir der sems nyid kyang gnyis kyi rnam par mi 'jug na yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun 'byung zhing rnam par rtog pa med par mngon sum du myong yang rnam pa de lta bu bstan mi nus pa'i phyir der sems nyid kyang gnyis kyi rnam par mi 'jug na yi ge dang sgra lta ci smos /
translated: Even though the continuum of moments arises and is experienced non-conceptually, it cannot be taught in that form. Therefore, the mind itself does not engage in the form of duality, let alone letters and sounds.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos ston pa yang 'byung ngo zhes lan du mar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos ston pa yang 'byung ngo zhes lan du mar bshad pa'o //
translated: When one enters into samƒÅdhi with appearances, the teaching of the omniscient Dharma also arises. This has been explained many times.

original: khyad par can la sogs pa rnams kyis sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid dang rdzas dgu lta bur phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pas kun du brtags pa'i rtag pa'i rdzas dgu la mu stegs byed pas ma skyes pa 'gags par kun du brtags pa'i rtog go zhes blo gros chen pos glengs pa'i lan du khyad par de nyid
analyzed: khyad par can la sogs pa rnams kyis sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus dang / phyogs dang / bdag dang / yid dang rdzas dgu lta bur phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pas kun du brtags pa'i rtag pa'i rdzas dgu la mu stegs byed pas ma skyes pa 'gags par kun du brtags pa'i rtog go zhes blo gros chen pos glengs pa'i lan du khyad par de nyid
translated: In particular, the tƒ´rthikas imagine that the nine substances of earth, water, fire, wind, space, time, direction, self, mind, and substance are permanent external things.

original: du gsung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: du gsung bar mdzad do //
translated: The Buddha replied to MahƒÅmati‚Äôs question with the following teaching.

original: de la phyi rol dang nang gi rnams la 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por kun brtags pa'i rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir rtag pa dang bdag tu chags pa'i las dang / 'du ba'i mthu las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la phyi rol dang nang gi rnams la 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por kun brtags pa'i rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir rtag pa dang bdag tu chags pa'i las dang / 'du ba'i mthu las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
translated: In this regard, because of the imagined external and internal things that are apprehended and the things that are apprehended, like dreams, illusions, and so on, things do not exist. Therefore, the karma of attachment to permanence and self and the power of their accumulation give rise to the sufferings of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams mi zad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams mi zad de /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are inexhaustible.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs par ston pa rim gyis gzud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs par ston pa rim gyis gzud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to gradually introduce those who are not yet ready to understand the profound teaching of emptiness, the Buddha taught that all things are impermanent, devoid of self, suffering, and ugly.

original: zab mo'i chos la mos pa rnams la ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i chos la mos pa rnams la ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa ston pa ste /
translated: For those who are ready for the profound teaching, he taught the door of liberation of emptiness, the door of liberation of signlessness, and the door of liberation of wishlessness.

original: mnyam @223b par mi 'jog pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: mnyam @223b par mi 'jog pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: By abandoning the obscurations of the knowable, which are the habitual tendencies of non-equipoise and the ignorance of the absence of afflictions,

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa nus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa nus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: one becomes a master of yoga with the ability to benefit all sentient beings and attains omniscience.

original: rab rib kyi rnam pa lta bur nor cing so sor snang ba la phyi rol gyi don du nges pa pa'i sems can rnams gzud pa'i rim gyis des na ston pa'i don gnyis so //
analyzed: rab rib kyi rnam pa lta bur nor cing so sor snang ba la phyi rol gyi don du nges pa pa'i sems can rnams gzud pa'i rim gyis des na ston pa'i don gnyis so //
translated: In order to gradually introduce those sentient beings who are certain that external objects exist and who perceive things as if they were distorted by eye disease, the Buddha taught two kinds of objects.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mi gnyis pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni brjod du med pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag med pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa shin tu med de /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mi gnyis pa'i skad cig ma rnams ni brjod du med pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag med pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa shin tu med de /
translated: The moments of the two kinds of perfected persons are inexpressible, and so are utterly devoid of the conceptual thoughts of self and selflessness, action and agent, done and undone, permanence and impermanence, and so on.

original: mdzub mo'i rtse mo tsam 'ba' zhig gis rab kyi mtshan nyid yi ge med pa'i tha snyad la de ltar yi ge med par yi ger bya ste /
analyzed: mdzub mo'i rtse mo tsam 'ba' zhig gis rab kyi mtshan nyid yi ge med pa'i tha snyad la de ltar yi ge med par yi ger bya ste /
translated: With just the tip of a finger, one should make the mere character of the unexcelled into a letter, that is, into a syllable, in the convention of the inexpressible.

original: spyir sgro btags nas mos pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa bstan pa brjed pas gzud do //
analyzed: spyir sgro btags nas mos pa sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa bstan pa brjed pas gzud do //
translated: Having generally fabricated that, one should lead sentient beings by means of various interests, teaching them the aggregates, constituents, sources, dependent origination, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis med de /
translated: When there is one moment, at that time there is no second moment.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med pas sus kyang ci yang mi byed de /
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med pas sus kyang ci yang mi byed de /
translated: Since all phenomena are without action, no one does anything at all.

original: de ma thag tu 'di yod do zhes chos su brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'di yod do zhes chos su brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: because immediately after that, it is designated as a phenomenon, saying ‚Äúthis exists.‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pas 'di skad du sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas 'di skad du sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has established this in the following way:

original: rgyu 'bras lta ba log pa yis //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras lta ba log pa yis //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have a wrong view of cause and effect

original: bdag brlag gzhan yang rlag par byed //
analyzed: bdag brlag gzhan yang rlag par byed //
translated: destroy themselves and others.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / rgyu med smra bas brtsan bya ste //üîΩma skyes pa yang rab tu sgrub //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / rgyu med smra bas brtsan bya ste // ma skyes pa yang rab tu sgrub //
translated: And: ‚ÄúThe proponents of causelessness should be refutedüîΩbecause they establish non-arising.

original: skye ba med par rang bsgrubs na //
analyzed: skye ba med par rang bsgrubs na //
translated: Having established non-arising,

original: nga yi tshul ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: nga yi tshul ni mi 'jug go //
translated: they do not engage in my way.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni 'byung ba med ces lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni 'byung ba med ces lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: It has been explained many times that dependent origination is non-arising.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos ni bdag med pa gnyis la yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos ni bdag med pa gnyis la yang mi rung ste /
translated: The phenomena of arising and so on are not tenable even in the context of the two selflessnesses.

original: skad cig pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa la sogs pa'i chos gzhan med do //
translated: There are no other phenomena such as momentariness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams la yang skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams la yang skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa nyid de /
translated: Even in the context of the dependent nature, the two aspects are devoid of the nature of arising,

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a dream, an optical illusion, and so on.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa /üîΩskad cig ma'i rgyun rnams brjod du med pa'i phyir der rtag @224a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa / skad cig ma'i rgyun rnams brjod du med pa'i phyir der rtag @224a * //
translated: The ultimate truth is nondual, perfectly known.üîΩSince the continuum of moments is inexpressible, there is no occurrence of conceptual thoughts such as permanence,

original: pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: self, selflessness, and so on.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par shas pa la ni yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par shas pa la ni yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad thams cad nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: In the cognition of duality, all conventions of existence, nonexistence, and so on occur.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa / yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste ;
translated: As it is said here:üîΩNonexistence is implied by existence,

original: / yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
analyzed: / yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
translated: and existence is implied by nonexistence.

original: de bas med par shes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par shes mi bya //
translated: Therefore, do not understand nonexistence,

original: yod par yang ni mi brtag go //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: yod par yang ni mi brtag go // zhes pa ste /
translated: and do not imagine existence.

original: rtog pas sgro btags te ma grub pa brtags nas ba lang gi rva ni yod /
analyzed: rtog pas sgro btags te ma grub pa brtags nas ba lang gi rva ni yod /
translated: Since it is imputed by thought, the nonestablished is imagined.

original: ri bong gi rva med pa dang / rmi lam ma yin pa na ni yod /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med pa dang / rmi lam ma yin pa na ni yod /
translated: The cow‚Äôs horn exists, the rabbit‚Äôs horn does not exist,üîΩand that which is not a dream exists,üîΩbut that which is a dream does not exist.

original: rmi lam na ni med ces pa de de ltar gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni med ces pa de de ltar gang gi tshe na /
translated: When is it like that?

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is destroyed by the analysis of subtle particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The part of the atom is not existent.

original: zhes par shes rab kyis dpyad pas /
analyzed: zhes par shes rab kyis dpyad pas /
translated: Thus, through the analysis of wisdom,

original: ba lang gi rva lta nyid med na /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva lta nyid med na /
translated: if the ox-horn does not exist,

original: ri bong gi rva lta ga la zhig ste /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva lta ga la zhig ste /
translated: how could the rabbit-horn exist?

original: de de ltar na /
analyzed: de de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: bdag dang bdag med phyogs bslad cing //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med phyogs bslad cing //
translated: the side of self and selflessness is polluted.

original: sgra tsam la ni 'jug pa dag / ces pa ste /
analyzed: sgra tsam la ni 'jug pa dag / ces pa ste /
translated: Those who engage in mere words

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rnam par rtog go //
translated: conceive of the entity of cause and effect.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gang dag gi bdag med pa de dag gi rang bzhin med pa'o zhes de ltar chud par mi bya bar chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khyad par du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gang dag gi bdag med pa de dag gi rang bzhin med pa'o zhes de ltar chud par mi bya bar chos dang gang zag la bdag med par khyad par du bstan pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One has taught that those who are selfless are essenceless. Thus, one should not be confused. The selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons are taught as distinct.

original: phan tshun du rnam par ldog pa'i bdag nyid pa rnams te /
analyzed: phan tshun du rnam par ldog pa'i bdag nyid pa rnams te /
translated: They are mutually exclusive.

original: de bzhin du ni gzhan spangs pa'i mtshan nyid pa rnams des na bdag med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la mu stegs byed pas rtag pa dang bdag dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs par rtog pa de lta bu med na de la ltos te bdag dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzhan spangs pa'i mtshan nyid pa rnams des na bdag med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la mu stegs byed pas rtag pa dang bdag dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs par rtog pa de lta bu med na de la ltos te bdag dang /
translated: In the same way, if the tƒ´rthikas do not conceive the characteristics of the self, permanence, and external substances, and so on, in the characteristics of the selflessness of the real, why do they conceive the self,

original: bdag med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi dang / phyi rol ma yin pa'i rdzas la sogs par cis na rtog /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi dang / phyi rol ma yin pa'i rdzas la sogs par cis na rtog /
translated: selflessness, permanence, impermanence, momentariness, non-momentariness, external substances, and so on, in dependence on that?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam par gang snang ba de dag ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib tu snang ba dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa des ma skyes pas na dngos po med pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam par gang snang ba de dag ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib tu snang ba dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa des ma skyes pas na dngos po med pa rnams so //
translated: Whatever appears in the form of the dependent nature is like a dream, an illusion, an appearance of floaters, a reflection, and so on. Since it is not produced in that way, it is unreal.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ma skyes pas na dngos po med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ma skyes pas na dngos po med do //
translated: because of the non-existence of a permanent, unitary, and independent self and external substances, etc., the non-arisen is not a real entity.

original: yongs su grub pa rnams @224b kyi ni yang gnyis kyi rnam par stong pa nyid de bsam pa med pa dang snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa rnams @224b kyi ni yang gnyis kyi rnam par stong pa nyid de bsam pa med pa dang snang ba med pa'o //
translated: The perfected nature is empty of the duality of the imagined nature, which is non-existent and non-apparent.

original: mu stegs byed rnams kyi ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi bar sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams kyi ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi bar sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of the imagined nature is the non-existence of the superimposition of permanence, a self, and external things by the heterodox.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa'o //
translated: The perfected nature is the momentariness of all conditioned things.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gis gang yin pa de dag kyang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gis gang yin pa de dag kyang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa ste /
translated: That which is dependent on others is like a dream, an illusion, etc.

original: lung ston pa po rnams kyis skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / byed pa por mngon par 'brel par brtags pa gzhan dag med do //
analyzed: lung ston pa po rnams kyis skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / byed pa por mngon par 'brel par brtags pa gzhan dag med do //
translated: The other, i.e., the imagined nature, is the non-existence of the connection of an agent and action, such as the arising and cessation, etc., imagined by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pas 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba yang mi dmigs pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod du med pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs par gzhan kun du brtags pa lta zhig gi skabs
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pas 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba yang mi dmigs pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod du med pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs par gzhan kun du brtags pa lta zhig gi skabs
translated: Through the analysis of wisdom, the apprehender and the apprehended are not observed. Since there is no thought and no appearance, the ultimate truth is nondual. Since the continuum of moments of perfect cognition is inexpressible, how could there be any occasion for the other imagined things, such as arising?

original: ga la yod de med do //
analyzed: ga la yod de med do //
translated: There is none.

original: chos thams cad la yi ge med pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la yi ge med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la yi ge med pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la yi ge med pa ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are without syllables, their individual characteristics are without syllables.

original: de'i phyir na de kho na nyid rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de kho na nyid rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: Therefore, reality is nonconceptual.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i don dam pa la ni mu stegs byed rnams dngos por sgro btags pas /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i don dam pa la ni mu stegs byed rnams dngos por sgro btags pas /
translated: In the ultimate, which is nonconceptual with regard to things and nonthings, and so on, the tƒ´rthikas superimpose things.

original: blo gros chen po nga'i chos ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas de'i phyir mu stegs byed rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gros chen po nga'i chos ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas de'i phyir mu stegs byed rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par smra ba dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Mahamati, my Dharma is free from the conceptualization of the positions of existence and non-existence, therefore it is not the same as the non-arising and non-cessation spoken of by the tirthikas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas nyan thos dang mu stegs byed smra ba las theg pa chen po khyad par can zhes te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas nyan thos dang mu stegs byed smra ba las theg pa chen po khyad par can zhes te /
translated: The Omniscient One, in the Mahayana, speaks of a special teaching, different from the teachings of the Shravakas and tirthikas.

original: gnyis ka dang mi gnyis pa'i chos ston pas snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang mi gnyis pa'i chos ston pas snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gsungs pa'o //
translated: He speaks of the special samadhis of appearance and non-appearance, teaching a Dharma that is both and not both.

original: rang gi rnam pa brgyal ba la sogs pa lta bu nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba gzhigs nas mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam ba med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa dngos po
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa brgyal ba la sogs pa lta bu nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba gzhigs nas mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam ba med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa dngos po
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom, and having investigated what is to be known, such as one's own appearances, one does not observe them, at that time, without thought and without appearance, one should know the ultimate truth, which is non-dual.

original: dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gnas so //üîΩde la byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa po dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / sems @225a * //
analyzed: dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gnas so // de la byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa po dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / sems @225a * //
translated: and non-conceptuality regarding existence and non-existence.

original: can drug brtags pa thams cad dang / 'du ba'i rnam par rtog pa phyi nang gi rkyen gyi 'brel pa gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa la snang ngo //
analyzed: can drug brtags pa thams cad dang / 'du ba'i rnam par rtog pa phyi nang gi rkyen gyi 'brel pa gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa la snang ngo //
translated: Here, the six kinds of sentient beings, all the imagined, and the dependent appearances in the aspect of the dependent origination of internal and external conditions, such as the agent, action, expression, speaker, apprehender, apprehended, permanent, impermanent, self, selflessness, and the imagined connections, appear.

original: 'brel pa 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'du ba la thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'du ba la thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa ste /
translated: Connection, connection means the connection of all in the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: sems 'khrugs na ji tsam du 'khor bar snang ba de tsam du mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems 'khrugs na ji tsam du 'khor bar snang ba de tsam du mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste /
translated: When the mind is disturbed, to the extent that samsara appears, to that extent there is the dependent origination of formations and so forth, characterized by non-equipoise, conditioned by ignorance.

original: de ni rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pa'i ma rig pa dang / las dang len pa las srid pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pa'i ma rig pa dang / las dang len pa las srid pa ste /
translated: It is eternal, and ignorance of self-attachment, and existence from action and appropriation.

original: des na phan tshun gyi 'brel pa ni nang gi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: des na phan tshun gyi 'brel pa ni nang gi rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o ;
translated: Thus, the mutual relation is internal dependent origination.

original: / phyi rol gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyi ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang 'khor lo la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rten ltos te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: / phyi rol gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i tshogs kyi ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang 'khor lo la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rten ltos te 'byung ngo //
translated: The external dependent origination is the collection of external elements, which arise from the mutual dependence of the elements, such as a lump of clay and a wheel, etc.

original: de ltar na byas pa ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na byas pa ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Thus, the produced is impermanent,

original: mig yor dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig yor dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a mirage, a dream, a magical illusion, etc.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: rmi lam bzhin dang sgyu ma bzhin //
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin dang sgyu ma bzhin //
translated: Like a dream, like an illusion,

original: ji bzhin dri za'i grong khyer bzhin //
analyzed: ji bzhin dri za'i grong khyer bzhin //
translated: Just like a castle in the clouds,

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
translated: So is arising, so is enduring,

original: de bzhin 'jig par brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig par brjod pa'o //üîΩzhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: So is disintegration declared.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa las skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos kun brtags pa'i skad cig pa ma gtogs par med de /
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa las skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos kun brtags pa'i skad cig pa ma gtogs par med de /
translated: Just as in the case of the Buddha‚Äôs prediction, there is no such thing as the dharma of arising, enduring, and ceasing, except as a momentary imputation.

original: des na ji ltar mu stegs can rnams kyi chos dang / chos can lta bur mi rtag pa ni tha dad pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar mu stegs can rnams kyi chos dang / chos can lta bur mi rtag pa ni tha dad pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, impermanence is not different from the dharma and the possessor of the dharma, as in the case of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it not different.

original: gal te mi rtag pa tha dad na ni mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshe na tshig gi don rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa tha dad na ni mi rtag pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshe na tshig gi don rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If impermanence were different, then at that time, the meaning of the word would be permanent, because there would be no impermanence.

original: rtag pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And permanence would become impermanence.

original: de lta bas mi rtag pa ni gzhan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bas mi rtag pa ni gzhan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, impermanence is not different.

original: gzhan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it not different.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las /
translated: As it says in the Madhyamaka:

original: gal te skye ba sngar yod la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba sngar yod la //
translated: If birth were prior

original: rga dang 'chi ba phyi nas ni //üîΩskye ba rga ba 'chi ba med //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba phyi nas ni // skye ba rga ba 'chi ba med //
translated: And old age and death were later,üîΩThere would be birth without aging and death,

original: skyes pa 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes pa 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur //
translated: And the born would not die.

original: gang na de dag thog ma dang tha ma lhan cig dang go rims su mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gang na de dag thog ma dang tha ma lhan cig dang go rims su mi 'jug na /
translated: If they do not occur together or in sequence,

original: skye ba dang ni rga ba yang //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni rga ba yang //
translated: then birth and aging

original: chos kun la ni 'chi ba ci //
analyzed: chos kun la ni 'chi ba ci //
translated: and death do not exist for any thing.

original: dngos po kun la rnam rtog byed //
analyzed: dngos po kun la rnam rtog byed //
translated: And all things are imagined to beüîΩendowed with birth and death.

original: skye dang 'chi ba ma gtogs pa //üîΩdngos po gang zhig yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'chi ba ma gtogs pa // dngos po gang zhig yod par 'gyur //
translated: Apart from birth and death,üîΩwhat thing exists?üîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.üîΩThe cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚Äù

original: ji ltar lung ston pa la sogs pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / @225b 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams brtags pa dang / ji ltar khyad par can gyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag par rnam par brtags pa ni rim dang cig car du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa la sogs pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / @225b 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams brtags pa dang / ji ltar khyad par can gyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag par rnam par brtags pa ni rim dang cig car du mi rung ngo //
translated: As the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.

original: nam rim du 'gyur ba de'i tshe skye ba ni rga ba dang 'chi ba dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: nam rim du 'gyur ba de'i tshe skye ba ni rga ba dang 'chi ba dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: The cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.

original: gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba rnams kyang skye ba dang bral te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba rnams kyang skye ba dang bral te /
translated: The cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚ÄùüîΩAs the Buddha has said, ‚ÄúThe Dharma is taught by me for the cessation of all fabrications.

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cessation of all fabrications is peace.‚Äù

original: sngar dngos po med pa dang zhig nas dngos po med pa la sogs par ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / grangs can dang / dpyod pa can dang / ksha pa na ka gang dag gis kun rtog pa gal te de dag dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med par de ltar 'brel par mi rung ste /
analyzed: sngar dngos po med pa dang zhig nas dngos po med pa la sogs par ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / grangs can dang / dpyod pa can dang / ksha pa na ka gang dag gis kun rtog pa gal te de dag dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe dngos po dang dngos po med par de ltar 'brel par mi rung ste /
translated: If the non-entity that is the prior non-entity and the non-entity that is the post-disintegration, etc., are not different from the entity, then at that time it is not tenable that they are related to the entity and non-entity.

original: gnyis ka'ang dngos po phyir su gang gi khyad par du 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis ka'ang dngos po phyir su gang gi khyad par du 'gyur /
translated: Since both are entities, what would be the difference between them?

original: de'i phyir dngos po bdag nyid kyi rgyus de ltar 'byung ba dang 'jig ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po bdag nyid kyi rgyus de ltar 'byung ba dang 'jig ste /
translated: Therefore entities arise and disintegrate by the power of their own causes.

original: gang thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas kyi cha dang bral ba'i skad cig pa gzhan nyid du yang mi gnyis pa grangs can rnams kyis de skad cig pa drug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa lta bur yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas kyi cha dang bral ba'i skad cig pa gzhan nyid du yang mi gnyis pa grangs can rnams kyis de skad cig pa drug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa lta bur yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since they are momentary, they are not the same in the beginning and end. The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that it is not tenable that they are permanent in the sense of enduring for six moments.

original: drug ni skye ba dang / yod pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'phel ba dang / zad pa dang / 'jig go zhes dngos po'i 'gyur ba drug go //
analyzed: drug ni skye ba dang / yod pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'phel ba dang / zad pa dang / 'jig go zhes dngos po'i 'gyur ba drug go //
translated: The six are origination, existence, change, increase, exhaustion, and destruction.

original: skad cig pa gcig kyang skad cig pa drug tu gnas par 'gyur bas rim dang cig car mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig kyang skad cig pa drug tu gnas par 'gyur bas rim dang cig car mi rung ngo //
translated: Since a single moment would endure for six moments, sequential and simultaneous moments are not tenable.

original: de bzhin du ne yi ya yi ka dang khyad par can la sogs pas brtags pa'i skad cig pa drug rnams re re yang skad cig pa drug drug tu gnas par 'gyur ba ni yod par 'brel ba'i dus dang / gnas pa'i dus dang / yon tan gong ma 'byung ba'i dus dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ne yi ya yi ka dang khyad par can la sogs pas brtags pa'i skad cig pa drug rnams re re yang skad cig pa drug drug tu gnas par 'gyur ba ni yod par 'brel ba'i dus dang / gnas pa'i dus dang / yon tan gong ma 'byung ba'i dus dang /
translated: Similarly, the six moments of the NyƒÅyika and the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on are each established as six moments, because of the time of connection, the time of endurance, the time of the arising of higher qualities,

original: dmigs pa'i dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu rkyen bsnyen pa'i dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i dus te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu rkyen bsnyen pa'i dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i dus te /
translated: the time of observation, the time of approaching the cause and condition of destruction, and the time of destruction.

original: yod pa dang 'brel pa la sogs par rtog pa'i dus snga ma la phyi ma'i khyad par mi srid do //
analyzed: yod pa dang 'brel pa la sogs par rtog pa'i dus snga ma la phyi ma'i khyad par mi srid do //
translated: The later distinctions of the time of connection and so on are not possible in the earlier time of connection and so on.

original: de dag la yang de bzhin du skyon mi ldog pas blo dang sgra dang / glog la sogs pa shin tu myur bar rnam par 'jig pa yang med par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na skad cig pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos @226a * //
analyzed: de dag la yang de bzhin du skyon mi ldog pas blo dang sgra dang / glog la sogs pa shin tu myur bar rnam par 'jig pa yang med par 'gyur ro // des na skad cig pa la skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos @226a * //
translated: And because the faults are not removed in those, the mind, sound, lightning, and so on, which are very quick to disintegrate, would also not exist.

original: lhag pa med do //
analyzed: lhag pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in the momentary, there is no additional dharma such as arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po pa rnams klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po pa rnams klog pa /
translated: How is it that the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika recite:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can the unstable be a creator?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: That which arises is the creator itself.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //üîΩces bya ba dang / byed pa por 'brel te skye bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod // ces bya ba dang / byed pa por 'brel te skye bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is also called the creator.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa de'i tshe na /
translated: It is not suitable to connect it with the creator, because when there is one momentary thing, at that time there is no second momentary thing.

original: skad cig pa gnyis po med de snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod ces bya ba 'ba' zhig ste chos su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa gnyis po med de snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod ces bya ba 'ba' zhig ste chos su brtags pa'o //
translated: After the first, if this exists, that exists, is merely a designation of a dharma.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The imagination of the cause and effect of the two kinds of consciousness of the relative.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la yang de lta bu yod do //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa la yang de lta bu yod do //
translated: The imagination of the cause and effect of the two aspects of consciousness of the relative is like that in dreams, magical illusions, and so on.

original: kha cig gis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas der yang skad cig mar 'jig pa gdon mi za bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas der yang skad cig mar 'jig pa gdon mi za bar byed de /
translated: Some people, by direct perception and inference, definitely establish that even in those cases, there is momentary destruction.

original: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas tha dad pa dang bral ba dang / skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas yang skyes pa dang / ka ba dang rdza mal sogs pa yang mchog tu rnyings pa la sogs pas thog ma dang tha ma'i dus tha dad pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas tha dad pa dang bral ba dang / skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas yang skyes pa dang / ka ba dang rdza mal sogs pa yang mchog tu rnyings pa la sogs pas thog ma dang tha ma'i dus tha dad pa dang /
translated: For example, the sound of a finger snap is not separate from the time of its beginning and end, and hair, grass, and so on, having been cut, grow again. Also, pillars, pots, and so on, by extreme aging and so on, are not separate from the time of their beginning and end.

original: me tog la sogs pa rnams rnam par 'jig par rjes su dpag pa ni ji ltar de dag skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis 'jig pas so //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa rnams rnam par 'jig par rjes su dpag pa ni ji ltar de dag skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis 'jig pas so //
translated: The inference of the destruction of flowers and so on is that they are destroyed by the moment, the instant, the second.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la rnyings pa dang / cher rnyings pa la sogs par thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis skad cig mar 'jig pa gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la rnyings pa dang / cher rnyings pa la sogs par thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis skad cig mar 'jig pa gdon mi za'o //
translated: In the case of the dependent nature, it is certain that it disintegrates moment by moment, as is directly perceived by the omniscient ones and can be inferred by others.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa ni yongs su grub par yang mngon sum ste /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa ni yongs su grub par yang mngon sum ste /
translated: The perfected nature is also directly perceived as the continuum of moments of nondual ultimate truth, which is devoid of imagination and appearance and is inexpressible and fully present.

original: de de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rtag par brtags pa rnams gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa rnams la mi srid do //
analyzed: de de ltar skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rtag par brtags pa rnams gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa rnams la mi srid do //
translated: Thus, the imagined nature, which is imputed to be permanent in terms of arising, enduring, ceasing, and so on, is impossible in the dependent and perfected natures.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /üîΩrtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa / rtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: As it is said here:üîΩBy nature, all things are unborn,

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //üîΩgzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te // gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
translated: Because they are permanent.

original: mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
analyzed: mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
translated: Imagination arises in peopleüîΩIn dependence on the dependent nature.

original: gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog gis //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog gis //
translated: When the dependent nature is imagined

original: rnam par spangs te dag pa na //
analyzed: rnam par spangs te dag pa na //
translated: Having abandoned them, they are pure.

original: grub pa de bzhin nyid par smras //
analyzed: grub pa de bzhin nyid par smras //
translated: The Accomplished One is said to be just like that.

original: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bshad do //
analyzed: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained the s≈´tras as s≈´tras.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi rdzas la @226b sogs pa brtags pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam par ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi rdzas la @226b sogs pa brtags pa rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam par ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Because of the non-existence of things imputed as permanent, self, external substances, and so on, the dependent nature is not produced as various different aspects.

original: rnam pa des skyes pa'i rang bzhin med pas gcig pu la du mar mi rigs pa dang / rnam pa du ma la yang gcig pur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa des skyes pa'i rang bzhin med pas gcig pu la du mar mi rigs pa dang / rnam pa du ma la yang gcig pur mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is produced in that way, it does not have a nature, so it is not reasonable for the one to be many, and it is also not suitable for the many to be one.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub par byed pa /
translated: As ƒÄcƒÅrya Dharmikaƒ´rti establishes:

original: gang gis dngos po brtag bya ba //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po brtag bya ba //
translated: That by which a thing is imagined

original: yang dag par ni gzugs de med //
analyzed: yang dag par ni gzugs de med //
translated: Does not truly exist as form.

original: gang phyir gcig dang du mar yang //
analyzed: gang phyir gcig dang du mar yang //
translated: Because it is neither one nor many,

original: de dag gzugs ni med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gzugs ni med pa'o //
translated: That form does not exist.

original: gzhan du dngos po gcig po la //
analyzed: gzhan du dngos po gcig po la //
translated: Otherwise, in a single thing

original: sna tshogs gzugs ni snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs ni snang ba'i phyir //
translated: Various forms would appear.

original: rnam pa ji ltar bden par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar bden par 'gyur //
translated: How could that be true?

original: des na gcig kyang 'grib pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des na gcig kyang 'grib pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of the decrease of one,

original: gzhan la gzhan du 'grib pa yang //üîΩdbyer med ma yin gzugs mthong phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan du 'grib pa yang // dbyer med ma yin gzugs mthong phyir //
translated: The decrease of the other is not tenable.üîΩAnd the decrease of one thing in anotherüîΩIs not tenable, because form is seen.

original: rang bzhin tha dad mi mthong bas //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad mi mthong bas //
translated: Because of the non-perception of difference in nature,

original: blo ni tha dad mi rtogs so //
analyzed: blo ni tha dad mi rtogs so //
translated: The mind does not perceive difference.

original: 'o na blo ni de gcig la //
analyzed: 'o na blo ni de gcig la //
translated: But how does the mind, which is one,

original: ji ltar sna tshogs snang bar byed //
analyzed: ji ltar sna tshogs snang bar byed //
translated: Produce the appearance of variety?

original: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu las byung //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i mthu las byung //
translated: This is due to the power of entities.

original: mkhas pa gang dag gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: mkhas pa gang dag gsungs pa ste //
translated: This is what the wise have said.

original: ji ltar ji bzhin don bsam pa //
analyzed: ji ltar ji bzhin don bsam pa //
translated: Just as the meaning is conceived,

original: de bzhin de bzhin bden par 'gyur //üîΩgang gi don rnams bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin de bzhin bden par 'gyur // gang gi don rnams bdag nyid kyis //
translated: So it becomes the truth.üîΩIf one aspires to the meaning

original: mos na der ni bdag ci rtogs //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: mos na der ni bdag ci rtogs // zhes pa ste /
translated: By oneself, what is there to understand?

original: de de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gcig po la du mar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de de ltar gzhan gyi dbang gcig po la du mar mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the one dependent nature is multiple.

original: yongs su grub pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pas sangs rgyas kho na nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa stong
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pas sangs rgyas kho na nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa stong
translated: Since the thoroughly established nature is not harmed, the Buddha, who is free from thoughts and appearances, abides in the nondual ultimate truth, the nonconceptual emptiness of things and nonthings,

original: pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par thar pa'i sgo snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa don dam pa la bzhugs pa dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa med pa la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs te /
analyzed: pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par rnam par thar pa'i sgo snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa don dam pa la bzhugs pa dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin lhun gyis grub pa med pa la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs te /
translated: the spontaneous door of liberation that is the concentration of nonappearance, the ultimate, and the omniscience that abides in the spontaneous door of liberation that is the concentration of appearance, the pure mundane state, the nonultimate.

original: mos pa tha dad pa la gnas pa rnams la gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i chos gzud pa'i tshul gyis ston to //
analyzed: mos pa tha dad pa la gnas pa rnams la gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i chos gzud pa'i tshul gyis ston to //
translated: He teaches those who abide in different aspirations the Dharma in a way that is dualistic and nondualistic.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos gnyis kyi rnam pa can sems dkrugs pa'i @227a * //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos gnyis kyi rnam pa can sems dkrugs pa'i @227a * //
translated: The two aspects of phenomena are the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so on.üîΩSentient beings who are born from ignorance that does not rest in equipoise are confused about the two aspects of phenomena.

original: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa las skyes pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i dus dang thar pa'i rim par snang ba'i tshul dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa tha dad pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par rnams kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams la ste /
analyzed: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa las skyes pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i dus dang thar pa'i rim par snang ba'i tshul dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa tha dad pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par rnams kyis rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams la ste /
translated: The way in which the stages of samsara and nirvana appear to them, the differences in the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the different levels and perfections, and so on are for the lords of yogis.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang mtshan mas brgyan pa'i sku la sogs par snang bas sems can mgu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ji ltar rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang mtshan mas brgyan pa'i sku la sogs par snang bas sems can mgu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ji ltar rtag pa dang / bdag tu chags pa dang /
translated: The emanation of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya is the emanation of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya that is the emanation of the sambhogakƒÅya.üîΩüîΩThe emanation of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya is the emanation of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya that is the emanation of the sambhogakƒÅya.üîΩ

original: las kyi rgyu las skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog pa de ltar chos ston to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu las skye ba dang / 'chi ba'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog pa de ltar chos ston to //
translated: And by means of the magical power of transformation, the body adorned with the major and minor marks, and so on, they delight sentient beings and, by means of various kinds of wisdom and skillful means, they teach the Dharma in such a way as to turn them away from the suffering of samsara, which is born from the cause of karma, from attachment to permanence and self,üîΩand from attachment to the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi mdzes pa bsgom par chos zab mo la mos pa kha cig la ni sbom po dang phra mo shes rab kyis dpyad de rnam par gzhig pa /üîΩgzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mi mdzes pa bsgom par chos zab mo la mos pa kha cig la ni sbom po dang phra mo shes rab kyis dpyad de rnam par gzhig pa / gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: To those who are free from attachment, they teach the profound Dharma, meditating on impermanence, suffering and ugliness, and to some who are devoted to the profound Dharma, they analyze and destroy with wisdom the coarse and subtle.üîΩForm is destroyed by the analysis of atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Atoms are destroyed by the analysis of parts.

original: zhes par gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par brjod du med pa la gnas so //
analyzed: zhes par gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par brjod du med pa la gnas so //
translated: When the external is not perceived, then, without thought, without appearance, one abides in the ultimate truth, which is nondual, inexpressible, and perfectly known.

original: des na thugs rje'i bag chags kyis gzhan gyi don du sad do //
analyzed: des na thugs rje'i bag chags kyis gzhan gyi don du sad do //
translated: Thus, one awakens for the sake of others through the habitual tendencies of compassion.

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa gong nas gong ma'i tshogs kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rnal 'byor la goms pas gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa gong nas gong ma'i tshogs kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rnal 'byor la goms pas gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being accustomed to the yoga of the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the stages and perfections, one attains the samƒÅdhi of nonduality and nondifferentiation.

original: des na chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni don gyi rjes su 'brang ba la 'gyur gyi yi ge'i rjes su 'brang ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni don gyi rjes su 'brang ba la 'gyur gyi yi ge'i rjes su 'brang ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the complete knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena and persons is for those who follow the meaning, not for those who follow the words.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas mang du thos pa rnams las don rnyed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas mang du thos pa rnams las don rnyed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe Omniscient One finds the meaning from the learned ones.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos dpyad pa'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos thor bu dpyad pa bcva lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos dpyad pa'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos thor bu dpyad pa bcva lnga pa'o /
translated: The third chapter of the Arya-Lankavatara-bhasya composed by Jnanaprabha-bhadra, after the examination of the Buddha-dharmas, is the fifteenth chapter of the examination of the various dharmas such as pratityasamutpada and anityata.

original: // / thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dgongs pa'i bsdu ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: // / thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dgongs pa'i bsdu ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the summary of the omniscient one's intention regarding the nature of cause and effect is as follows:

original: rgyu 'dus pa las nang @227b dang phyi'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs snang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'dus pa las nang @227b dang phyi'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs snang ngo //
translated: The collection of the nature of internal and external effects appears from the assembly of causes.

original: de ni mig dang gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa rgyu 'dus pa'i mthu las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa rgyu 'dus pa'i mthu las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar skye'o //
translated: That is, from the power of the assembly of causes such as the eye, form, light, and mental activity, the eye consciousness and so forth are produced.

original: de la rgyu 'byong bas 'bras bu yang 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'byong bas 'bras bu yang 'byed pa ste /
translated: There, the effect is also distinguished by the development of the cause.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis chud pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis chud pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: By the immediate condition, it is the nature of being filled.

original: yul gyis ni de 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: yul gyis ni de 'dra bar ro //
translated: By the object, it is like that.

original: dbang po las ni yul so sor nges pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po las ni yul so sor nges pa ste /
translated: The object is determined by the sense faculty.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyis de lta bur yul dang yul can gyi dngos por kun du rtog go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyis de lta bur yul dang yul can gyi dngos por kun du rtog go //
translated: Thus, those who believe in external objects imagine that there is an objective realm of subject and object.

original: tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa de lta bur yang khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa du ma'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa de lta bur yang khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa du ma'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: But that consciousness which is the nature of the aggregate is empty, like a house, an army, a forest, etc., because it is manifold.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yul yang 'dus pa'i phyir khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yul yang 'dus pa'i phyir khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
translated: And the form of the elements and the form derived from the elements is empty, like a house, etc., because it is a composite of objects.

original: 'byung ba rnams cha dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir tha dad pa'i dngos po dngos por med de ;
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams cha dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir tha dad pa'i dngos po dngos por med de ;
translated: The elements do not exist as separate entities, because they are not separable into parts.

original: / de las byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyang rang dbang du tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: / de las byung ba'i gzugs rnams kyang rang dbang du tha dad pa med de /
translated: And the forms derived from the elements are not separately existent, because they are not independent.

original: des na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po de ni snang ba'i tshogs te don dam par ni med do //
analyzed: des na yul dang yul can gyi dngos po de ni snang ba'i tshogs te don dam par ni med do //
translated: Therefore, that objective realm of subject and object is a collection of appearances, but ultimately it does not exist.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na yang der gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang / dbang po dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa de bzhin du snang ba ste bslad pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad par snang gi / der byed pa dang byed
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na yang der gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang / dbang po dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa de bzhin du snang ba ste bslad pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad par snang gi / der byed pa dang byed
translated: Just as at the time of the dream, there are no objects such as forms, no sense faculties, and no eye consciousness, etc.,

original: pa por mngon par 'brel ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: pa por mngon par 'brel ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med do //
translated: in the same way, the various appearances, i.e., the various contaminations, arise from the power of the complete ripening of habitual tendencies. It is only consciousness that appears as the various different aspects, but there is no causal relation of agent and action there.

original: des na 'byung ba med pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: des na 'byung ba med pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba so sor snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of the various dependent originations without an origination occurs.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ste mi dmigs pa de na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma yang dag par rig pa ste brjod du med pa'i phyir der de ma thag pa
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ste mi dmigs pa de na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma yang dag par rig pa ste brjod du med pa'i phyir der de ma thag pa
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, the coarse and subtle aspects of the object are differentiated and not observed, then there is no thought and no appearance. That is the moment of nondual ultimate truth, the perfect knowledge that is inexpressible.

original: tsam gyis 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes chos su brtags pa bstan mi nus so //
analyzed: tsam gyis 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes chos su brtags pa bstan mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be demonstrated by the mere immediate succession of the thought, ‚ÄúIf this exists, that exists,‚Äù as a conceptual imputation of phenomena.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra dang don gyi tha snyad kyang spyi'i rnam par 'jug go //üîΩ'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa bzhin @228a * //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra dang don gyi tha snyad kyang spyi'i rnam par 'jug go // 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa bzhin @228a * //
translated: Even the conventional expressions of omniscience operate in a general way.

original: du snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: du snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When one abides in samƒÅdhi with appearance, like one who has arisen from the meditative absorption of cessation, the teaching of the Dharma occurs.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo las thams cad mkhyen pa bzhengs pa na sems can gyi bsam pa'i dgos pa ma lus par 'byung ste /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo las thams cad mkhyen pa bzhengs pa na sems can gyi bsam pa'i dgos pa ma lus par 'byung ste /
translated: When the Omniscient One arises from the door of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, having been awakened by the habitual tendencies of compassion, all the needs of sentient beings are fulfilled.

original: de ltar na chos ston pa la bar chad med do //
analyzed: de ltar na chos ston pa la bar chad med do //
translated: Thus, there is no obstacle to teaching the Dharma.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin tha dad pa la snyoms par 'jug cing bzhengs pa na chos ston pa sna tshogs dang / gsol ba'i lan kyang dgongs pa /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin tha dad pa la snyoms par 'jug cing bzhengs pa na chos ston pa sna tshogs dang / gsol ba'i lan kyang dgongs pa /
translated: When he enters and arises from the meditative absorptions of both with appearance and without appearance, he teaches the various Dharmas and responds to requests with his intention.

original: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sder sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sder sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied in the sutras such as the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de bzhin du g-yo ba med pa'i sar ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis so sor sad par bya ba dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa na sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung bar rnam par lta zhing chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yo ba med pa'i sar ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis so sor sad par bya ba dang / snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa na sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung bar rnam par lta zhing chos ston to //
translated: Likewise, when they are dwelling in concentration on the stage of non-regression, the Omniscient Ones awaken them, and when they enter into concentration with appearances, they teach the Dharma, seeing that the dependent origination which is like an illusion does not arise.
